loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites L. is a 32-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  sari-sari (general) store and a bakery. She lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. Through these two businesses, she is gradually making her family economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 10,000. 

Marites is borrowing PHP 11,000 to fund operations of her business venture. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund her business operations

loans.name: Reynaldo Magno

texts.es: El solicitante Reynaldo Magno P. Ramírez tiene una moto taxi el cual lo alquila aparte   tiene otro ingreso como producto de la  venta de zapallo en el mercado Toledo. El solicitante vive en casa de sus padres el cual será aval en el préstamo no cuenta con experiencia crediticia con otras entidades financieras .El prestatario esta solicitando el préstamo para comprarse otra moto taxi para alquilarlo y así le genere otros ingresos tiene buenas referencia  se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: The petitioner is Reynaldo Magno P. Ramírez, he has a motorcycle taxi which he rents and besides that he has another job by selling gourd in the Toledo market. Reynaldo lives in his parents’ home which coincidentally is his guarantee for the loan since he doesn’t have any loan history with any other financial organizations. He needs the loan to to rent another motorcycle taxi to have more income. Reynaldo has good references and is characterized by being a responsible person which is why the loan is proposed.

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Edward Asmani

texts.en:
Edward is 40 years old and married to Joyce. They have four children who are all in school. They live in Migori town. 

Edward has a wholesale shop where he sells sugar to retailers. He has been in this business for the past ten years and has seen his business grow over the years. Edward is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans. He intends to use the money to buy more sugar to add to his stock.  This will enable him to meet the demands of his clients.

His hope is to expand his business and build a bigger store so he can earn enough to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar to add to his stock

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Arturo; el tiene 73 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; el socio  cuenta con un carro que realiza el servicio de mudanza el trabaja de lunes a domingo por el día ,pero su horario puede variar de acuerdo a la actividad que pueda realizar durante el día, anteriormente el socio trabajo en entidades estatales y una vez jubilado decidió comprarse su carrito y es la actividad que actualmente realiza, él socio es una persona bien responsable y dedicado a sus hijos y el solo desea continuar trabajando por su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro y comprar algunos accesorios que le hacen falta. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the ” RICHARY RUNA” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. 

The associate is Señor Arturo.  He is 73 years of age and married with 5 children.  The associate relies on a car which he uses for a moving service.  He works from Monday to Sunday during the day, but his schedule can change according to the activities that he can carry out during the day.  Previously the associate worked in state companies and, once retired, he decided to buy his car for the activity that he carries out at present.  He is a very responsible person and dedicated to his children.  He only wants to continue working for his family.  

The associate requests the loan to carry out maintenance on his car and to buy some accessories that he needs.  

The associate is happy for the loan and he promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to maintain his car and to buy some accessories that it needs.

loans.name: Guido Bartolo

texts.es:
Guido Bartolo Z. H. tiene 41 años, es soltero vive con los hijos, en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  LA SOLEDAD se encuentra ubicada en el recinto EL TAMBO  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, arroz, maíz, yuca y además cría aves como gallina y patos.

Guido se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz,  los productos las compras en Chillanes y en El Tambo y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es educar a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Guido Bartolo Z. H. is 41 years old, single, and lives with his children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

'La Soledad' community bank is located in El Tambo, in Chillanes canton.  The group has 12 members who all work in agriculture, growing crops such as cacao, rice, corn and cassava.  They also raise birds such as hens and ducks.

Guido is a farmer who grows cacao, rice and corn.  He buys his products in Chillanes and El Tambo and sells his products in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

Guido is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as pest infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to educate his children.

Guido enjoys going out for walks with his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his crops as well as fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S., 36, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She is a local farmer who grows rice crop on her existing farmland. She is married to Chan Vibol, 29, who is a driver, and they have three single children. One of their children earns a living by repairing radios and television sets. To improve her family's comfort, Phan S. has decided to apply for a Kiva loan.  She will add the loan to her personal savings to build a new wooden house that is bigger than the family's current house.

loans.use: to build a new wooden house that is bigger than the family's current house.

loans.name: Ngha Gnon Mouta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NGHA GNON MOUTA est créé le 26 mai 2001. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce de fruits de saison. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de NIAGUIS NEMA. 

Madame Fariniane Mané est veuve et mère de huit (08)enfants. Elle a également la charge de sept (07) autres personnes.

Elle exerce un commerce de diverses marchandises: citron, miel, balais, huile de palme... Elle possède une bonne expérience dans ce domaine puisqu'elle exerce depuis plus de cinq ans.

Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter du citron, du miel, de l'huile de palme et des balais.

Ce prêt lui permettra de réaliser des revenus supplémentaires, afin de bien prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Ngha Gnon Mouta was created on May 26, 2001. It is composed of 6 women who are all from the same village. They formed their group based on friendly and neighborly ties. Their primary activity is selling seasonal fruits. The group is part of the Niaguis Nema banc villageois.

Mrs. Fariniane Mané is a widow and the mother of eight (8) children. She is also taking care of seven (7) other people.

She makes a living selling various commodities such as lemons, honey, brooms, palm oil, etc. With over five years of experience in this field, she has a good command of her activity.

She plans to use this loan to buy lemons, honey, palm oil, and brooms.

The loan will help her to increase her revenue and better look after her family.

loans.use: to buy lemons, honey, palm oil, and brooms

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old.  She is married and has 5 children, 4 of whom go to school.   Mary sells sugar, beans and rice to earn income. She has borrowed a loan to stock more sugar, beans and rice to sell.  She hopes to construct a house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more sugar, beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Mr. Shinebayar is 23 years old and lives with his wife and one-year-old baby in Kherlen, a city in the far-eastern province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, which is temporarily built on Shinebayar’s friend’s plot of land. His wife is a teacher but currently she is looking after the baby. 

Shinebayar served in the Mongolian Army on two years' contract which was finished last year. After the Army service he wed his wife and started a family life. He has a dream: to have his own family home in the future. 

Shinebayar runs a taxi business using his family car and the car needs some proper service now. The loan Shinebayar is asking for will be used to buy necessary spare parts and to service his car which is only source of his family’s income at the moment.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts and to service his car.

loans.name: Jossie Jo

texts.en:
Jossie Jo is 54 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. for her variety store.

Jossie Jo has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for two years and also earns income from buying & selling rice.

Jossie Jo aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming rice for three years, and she also earns additional income buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos es estudios. Tiene educación primaria.
La señora Angélica es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de venta de frazadas.  Con este dinero comprará 100 Kgs. de lana de todo color para la elaboración de frazadas, las que vende en la ciudad de Puno y Yunguyo.
En el negocio trabaja sola, su mamá le ayuda a cuidar a sus hijos menores y su esposo trabaja de chofer en una empresa de servicio urbano.
Su sueño es tener una buena casa y un carro para  transporte urbano.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the “Niño Jesús de Praga” (Infant Jesus of Prague) communal bank located in Yunguyo District and Province, Puno Department.  She’s 36 years old, has a spouse and four children in school.  She went to elementary school.

Angélica is a new member who recently joined the Manuela Ramos Movement.  She will ask for a 500 new sol loan to invest in her blanket weaving business.  She will use the money to buy 100 kilograms of wool in assorted colors to make the blankets which she sells in the cities of Puno and Yunguyo.

She works alone.  Her mother helps care for her younger children and her husband works as a driver for an urban transportation service provider.

Her dream is to have a good house and a car for urban transport.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 100 kilograms of wool in assorted colors.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en: Colleta is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. For the last three years she has made a living by running a taxi service, and is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd after being introduced to our organization by a friend who is also a client. She plans to use her loan to buy equipment for her taxi, including two spare tires, and money for gasoline. She is confident that these purchases will help her expand her business because they will improve the condition of her vehicle. Her goal for the future is to continue expanding her taxi business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and gasoline for her taxi.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Chibuto, provincia de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filho dos quais todos vão a escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e sustenta a sua sogra enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas dispesas de casa.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de emprego, é operador de maquinas na CFM ha mais de 21 anos e tem um rendimento de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Já fez emprestimo no BCI a longo prazo e pagou sem problemas. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE CASA PARA HABITACAO (cimento, blocos, ferro, pedra, e outros) para melhorar a sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 7.000.00mt aplicados na habitacao e bens de consumo.   
Sonha em concluir a sua obra,instalar agua e construir uma casa para os filhos, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Jacinto was born in Chibuto, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has six children who all go to school. Jacinto finished fourth grade and quit school because of financial problems. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his mother-in-law by sending her money to help with household expenses.

He left Inhambane to move to Maputo in search of a job. He has been a machine operator at CFM for more than 21 years and has an income of 12,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Jacinto had a long-term loan at BCI and paid it off without any problem. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is his fourth Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy construction materials FOR HIS HOME (cement, blocks, iron, stone and other items) to improve his house. The earlier loans were for 7,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, and 7,000 meticais. They were used for housing and consumer goods.

Jacinto dreams of finishing his house, installing running water and building a house for his children. To do so, he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for home construction (cement, blocks, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married to a farmer. By operating her general store, she helps her husband earn income to provide for their family. Lilibeth would like to look for a white collar job to better the family's life but unfortunately she cannot because of her low level of education. 

Lilibeth is 38 years of age and blessed with four children, three of whom attend school. Lilibeth wants them to finish their studies through college. With the help of her business, if well-managed, Lilibeth knows that someday she could be able to give her children their needed support. 

Lilibeth is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to avoid bankruptcy by buying stocks of commodities such as canned goods and spices to sell in her store. She hopes that her close communal ties will not render her into bankruptcy. On the positive side, she said that it is a great opportunity to learn and understand more about the people around her who are not good customers in paying their accounts.

loans.use: to avoid bankruptcy by buying stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kabumwa B Group

texts.en:
Jezina is the facilitator for Kabumwa B Group in Chwele.  She and her fellow group members joined One Acre Fund in 2011. Jezina says that she joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional profit to send her children to school and to access hybrid seed and fertilizer.  She also mentions that she wanted to be able to learn more about agriculture through the program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important farming inputs to distribute to Jezina and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

This season, Jezina says, she had a good harvest, yielding 9.5 bags on 1/2 acre of land.  She says that before joining the program, she harvested 1 bag on 1/2 acre.  With the profits from her harvest, she plans on investing in her children's education, buying livestock, and purchasing medications.

On the far left is Jezina's One Acre Fund Field officer!

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is a 55-year-old married woman with two children. She is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Merlie primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to improve her business and support her family.
Merlie has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.ru:
52-х летний Андраник живет в деревне Нореашен, Севанского региона, со своей женой и сыном. Андраник окончил индустриально-технологоческий техникум, где получил специальность бухгалтера. 
Сейчас Андраник работает в организации “Южно-Кавказские железные дороги”.  Сын учится в колледже.
Параллельно своей работе, Андраник и его жена занимаются сельским хозяйством. Они разводят крупный рогатых скот и кур, а также выращивают картофель. Картофель Андраник продает на рынке, мясо сдает мясникам на рынке, а молочную продукцию продает прямо из своего дома своим постоянным клиентам.   
Андрамику необходим кредит в 550.000 драм для покупки 3 телят, что позволит ему получать больший доход от своей фермы в будущем. 
Данный кредит является вторым, получаемым Андрамиком от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon).
texts.en: 52-year-old Andranik lives together with his wife and son in the Noreashen village in the Sevan region.  Andranik graduated from an industrial-technical college and obtained a speciality of an accountant.  He currently works for the Southern Caucasus Railroads organization.  His son attends a college.  Parallel to his work, Andranik and his wife are involved in agriculture.  They breed cattle and chickens and also grow potatoes.  Andranik sells the potatoes at a market, sells meat to butchers at the market and sells milk right from his house to his loyal customers.  He needs a loan in the sum of 550,000 dram to buy three calves, which would let him earn a large income from his farm in the future.  This is Andranik's second loan from the Nor Horizon organization.

loans.use: to buy three calves for his farm

loans.name: Carlos Noel

texts.es: Carlos Noel tiene 54 años su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa nueva. Desde hace 10 años que tiene este negocio, Carlos es un hombre que le encanta el comercio, el vende pantalones, sueteres, pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes para damas. Su forma de venta es en su vivienda y algunas veces que sale a ofrecer estos productos. Este el motivo por el cual realiza el crédito para la compra materia necesaria que le solicitan sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, pues siempre busca el medio de generar ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos Noel, 54, is a clothes merchant.  He’s had the business for ten years.  Carlos is a man who loves commerce.  He sells pants, sweaters, shirts, skirts, dresses and ladies’ outfits.  He sells from home and sometimes goes out to sell these products.  The reason for the loan request is to buy the items his customers are requesting.  He works every day from 7am until 7pm because he’s always seeking ways to generate income.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and a widow. She supports four people in her family. Her children are 20, 18, 15 and 13 years old. She owns a hotel (restaurant) and has been in the business for the past eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase seats for the hotel, as well as flour, sugar and cooking oil. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her dream is to expand her hotel and open another branch.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking fat and chairs

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
Juana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad  D. crecer en el negocio, ella comprara vitaminas, medicinas naturales como: meganoni, jugostin, assai, entre otros que son productos naturales, ella ha logrado mantenerse por la inversiones que ha realizado con prestamos pasados, ya que le han permitido mejorar y abastecer el inventario para la venta.
La condición D. Juana está mejorando y espera seguir en el camino, hacia el crecimiento, para mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Juana decided on a new loan because she needs her business to grow.  She buys vitamins and natural supplements like Meganoni, Jugostin and Assai, among others, which are natural products.  She’s managed to stay in business thanks to the previous loans that have allowed her to improve and stock inventory to sell.  Juana’s condition is improving and she hopes to stay on this road toward growth and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more natural dietary supplements.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is 21 years old and married. He has a 5-month-old baby. Joselito has been a fisherman for two years. He earns 5000 PHP per month. He is able to provide for his family through fishing. Joselito works hard to save for his family's future. He plans to use his loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. This will help improve Joselito's business.

In the future, Joselito hopes to acquire more fishing boats and build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 39-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 3-15 years. All of them are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a stall in Kator, South Sudan for three years.

Julia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread, tomatoes, and green vegetables. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread, tomatoes, and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Muniru

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Muniru. He is married, and has two children, age 3 and 8 years. He has one additional dependent who lives with him to help his wife with the house chores.  

In 2007, Muniru established his provision and drinks business. He began his business out of the need to be able to get a reliable source of income and become sustainable. Working six days a week and nine hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Muniru has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now he requires a new loan in order to buy milk, sardines, margarine, mayonnaise and drinks for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Muniru plans to move to the town center and open a business for his wife and to educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy milk, sardines, margarine, mayonnaise and drinks for his business.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is a 40 year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 3 children. Her husband sells building materials. Tam earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 5 years. 

Tam would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store

loans.name: Abeteraine Kyenkonge Group

texts.en:
Fabiano, aged 40 years, is a married man who hails from Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in a local brew that is commonly known as waragi by the locals. This is a business he has done for 5 years, having started as a farmer. Price fluctuations and inadequate capital are affecting the growth of his business.

He dreams of building a permanent home and educating his 7 children. His business dream is to be able to supply alcohol to the capital city where there is a ready market. He wants a loan to buy alcohol for resale.

Fabiano is a member of a group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for resale

loans.name: Angela Del Rocío

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Inició en esta actividad hace 3 años, cuando realizó cursos moda y costura.  Tenía desde pequeña la ilusión de ser modista y su madre le ayudó a conocer todo acerca del tema.  Realiza su trabajo sola en su domicilio, puesto que no tiene horario fijo.  No es casada y vive en la casa de sus padres con su hijo de 3 años, quien asiste al jardín de infantes.  Quisiera a futuro poder llegar a tener su propia factoría para poder tener ventas al por mayor y además gozar de buena salud.  Por ahora requiere del préstamo para la compra de telas y una máquina para su labor.
texts.en: The client’s from the city of Portoviejo.  She started this activity three years ago after taking dressmaking courses.  She had the small dream of becoming a clothes designer and her mother helped her to learn everything on this topic.  She works alone at home and has no fixed schedule.  She’s not married and lives wither three-year-old son in her parents’ house; he attends Kindergarten.  In future, she’d like to have her own factory to be able to sell at wholesale and also to enjoy good health.  For now, she needs the loan to buy fabric and a sewing machine for her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Capital equipment

loans.name: Shukufat

texts.en: Shukufat is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, settled in Sumgait city. This 23-year-old man has been engaged in his business for 2 years. Shukufat sells jean clothes. He supports his family with this business. Now he needs a loan amounting $1200 to be busy with selling industrial goods.

loans.use: To be busy with selling industrial goods

loans.name: Soma Sahar

texts.en: Soma Sahar is 38 years old and lives in a household of three in District 4 of Kabul Afghanistan. She started knitting when she was a child, and now has so much experience, she made knitting her professional business. She is very happy with the opportunity to obtain a loan to buy materials such as pine tree trunks, roots, petals and ferns to add to her already existing shop in the bazaar. These items will help bring in more customers and then she will be able to demonstrate how experienced she is in knitting.  Soma wants to increase her business as soon as possible so she can help her family economically.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for her shop.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina T. is a single mother raising her four children, Claudio (19), Ambreisi (17), Rosmery (13) and Ana (13). Regina supports her children by running her own clothing and personal care product store from their home in San Pedro de Macoris. She has requested this loan so she can expand her inventory from hygienic products to t-shirts. Regina says that by using these loans to develop her store, she hopes to help her community and family to become more successful and improve their lives.

NOTE: This $750 loan will go to fund Regina's business, as well as four other businesses within her solidarity group. She and four other micro-entrepreneurs in her community came to Esperanza and formed their own group. They have all gone through Esperanza's business training program and will receive shares of this $750 loan to invest in their respective businesses and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the success and struggles of the other members in their group.

loans.use: Soap, deodorant, hair products and collared shirts

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida, 40, is a widow and mother of one child. She lives with her child in Salyan region in Khaladj village.

11 years ago, Saida started her own business. In the beginning she bought a plot of land. Now she needs to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve her farm's yield. For that reason, she is requesting a loan of US$1200.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to increase her yield

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
35 years ago, Pedro G. German worked on a ranch, where he learned to kill animals for sale to butcher stores, and thus was born the idea to begin saving to buy a cow and a pig in order to put up his own butcher store, which he did and which began growing gradually, along with his grocery business. But since he first opened his butchery, he has not able to change his glass display case and some cabinets, which are badly damaged.

Today he is coming to you asking for a loan of $550 USD to be paid within four months. With the money he plans to buy some new cabinets to improve his grocery store, which will improve the sale of meats. Pedro is grateful for the help you can give him to help him move forward and improve the sales of his business. Thank you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 35 años, Pedro G. A. trabajó en un rastro, en donde aprendió a matar los animales para venderlos en las carnicerías, y así nació su idea para poner una carnicería, empezó a juntar sus ahorros para comprar una vaca y un cerdo, y puso una carnicería, que poco a poco ha ido creciendo, y metiendo venta de abarrotes, para obtener mayores ganancias. Sin embargo desde que puso su carnicería no a podido cambiar su vitrina, la cual ya está muy deteriorada.

Hoy está acudiendo a ustedes pidiendo un préstamo de US $550 para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, y con el dinero poder comprar unas vitrinas nuevas y surtir mejor de abarrotes. Para mejorar las ventas de su carnicería. Pedro te agradece la ayuda para poder salir adelante y mejorar su carnicería. ¡Muchas gracias por tu apoyo!

loans.use: To buy a glass display case and cabinets for his butcher/grocery store

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married to Natalicio Riquelme and they have three young children, all studying at the primary level.

Yolanda has been a business woman for 6 years. She has a store where she sells all types of goods, especially basic food staples including sugar, flour, milk, meat, fruit and vegetables. Her husband has worked as a distributor of pasta for the past 3 years. They work seven days a week in order to meet the family’s needs because the economic situation is difficult.

They are dynamic people who want to get ahead in order to give their children an education. They are asking for this credit in order to purchase merchandise to sell and thereby augment their income.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Yolanda Rodríguez esta casada con el Sr. Natalicio Riquelme y tienen tres hijos menores, todos estudian en el nivel primario.

La sra. Yolanda es comerciante hace 6 años, tiene una despensa donde comercializa todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad como azúcar, harina, leche, carne, frutas y verduras; su marido trabaja en una distribuidora de fideos hace 3 años. Ellos trabajan de lunes a lunes para el sustento de le familia ya que esta difícil la situación económica.

Son personas dinámicas que desean salir adelante, para brindarles a sus hijos educación. Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de mercaderías para su venta y así aumentar su ingreso.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, Christmas bread, soda, wine, fruit, milk products, etc.

loans.name: Shugufta's Group

texts.en:
My name is Shugufta Y. and I come from a big city: Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of an only son. My son has recently married. Both my husband and son operate a fruit business; they have separate fruit carts for this purpose. Now, after our son's wedding, our expenses have increased and we feel a need for an extra income. For this reason, they have decided to expand their fruit business and to do that, they require a loan.

There are few other women among my friends who are also in a need of a loan for their businesses. Alia B. needs a loan for her son’s scrapyard. Nasreen A. requires a loan for her grocery store. Suriya B. needs a loan for her husband’s juice corner to buy him a juicer. Razia A. needs a loan for the expansion of her husband’s grocery store. I know all these women; they are very responsible and hardworking and strive to make their families' lives better.

loans.use: Expand our family's fruit business

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham is a man whose most important responsibility is taking care of his three school-age children. For them, he has worked for the last 12 years buying and selling spart parts for cars, electrical and electronic goods, hardware and plumbing supplies.

He started the business in Chinandega's Bisne market and he's still there to this day. He urgently needs to purchase hardware products and he's approached Ceprodel which, for 4 years now, has supported him with 15 loans that he has used to invest in his business. Thanks to those loans, he has managed to offer a wider range of products and better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Abraham V. es un caballero cuya responsabilidad mayor es la atención a sus tres hijos en la edad escolar. Por esta razón es que desde hace 12 años, el señor V. se dedica a la venta de repuestos y artículos de electricidad, electrónica, ferretería y fontanería.

Su negocio lo comienza en el mercado Bisne de Chinandega y hasta hoy en día se encuentra ubicado en esta localidad. Su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de los productos ferreteros y por tal motivo acude a Ceprodel quien desde hace cuatro años le ha apyado con 15 créditos que los ha utilizado para invertir directamente en su negocio. Hoy en di gracias a estos créditos ha logrado diversificar sus productos y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Kireka B6 D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Teddy L.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase poultry feed. Teddy is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a civil servant. She has 1 child aged 3. Each week, Teddy makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to venture into another business. Teddy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her poultry farming business and the loan was paid back on time.

Teddy is joined in her small group by Ruth K., Sumayiya K., Hadijah K., and Lukiya N.. Ruth K. has a business running a beauty salon and wants to buy more hair oils, shampoo and chemicals. Sumayiya K. is currently operating a butcher's shop business and wants a loan to boost the business. Hadijah K. operates a business selling matooke and wants to purchase more matooke from the villages. Lukiya N. is currently in the business of stone quarrying and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To add to poultry business and expand it

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Christine G. was born July 24th, 1984 in Lomé. She is married and supports four people. Since the year 2000 she has been selling fabric in Lomé’s main market. The quality of fabric she sells attracts many buyers. Mrs. Christine G. uses her profits to help her husband pay school costs for the children he is responsible for. She is seeking a 500,000 franc CFA loan to buy new, high-quality fabrics in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Christine est le 24 juillet 1984 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a quatre (4) personnes à charge. Depuis l’année 2000, elle vend des tissus au grand marché de Lomé. La qualité des tissus qu’elle vend fait diriger beaucoup d’acheteurs vers elle. Madame G. Christine se sert de son revenu pour aider son mari à payer les frais de scolarité des enfants qu’ils ont à charge. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500.000 FCFA pour acheter de nouveaux tissus pagnes de qualité supérieure afin de pouvoir mieux servir sa clientèle.

loans.use: Stock the latest lines of new fabrics

loans.name: Safia's Jiamini Group

texts.en:
Safia is 30 years old and is a widowed woman with 4 children, ages16, 10, 7 and 4. Safia owns a small restaurant, which she started in 1998. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to perform maintainance of her restaurant. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in charcoal sales, fish sales, chicken sales and storekeeping.

loans.use:
For maintenance and repairs of her restaurant.




For maintainance of her restaurant.

loans.name: Criss

texts.es:
Criss comes from a very close home but with little economic resources. Since she started her family more than 5 years ago, she has worked tirelessly so that her 4 year-old daughter can enjoy tranquility and comfort. She started her business selling kitchen utensils but this business was not always profitable which is why she decided to dedicate herself to selling food (selling fried cheese) at the local terminal in the city of Juliaca. Her hard-working husband tries to take advantage of any job which comes along to provide additional income to keep his family without deprivation. Criss is not currently working because she is expecting a beautiful baby who will soon finish filling her home with happiness and love.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Criss, proviene de un hogar muy unido pero de bajos recursos económicos. Desde que formó su familia hace más de 5 años trabajó incansablemente con el fin de que su pequeña niña de 4 añitos de edad pueda gozar de tranquilidad y bienestar. Inició su negocio de venta de utensilios de cocina en forma ambulatoria, pero con este negocio no siempre lograba obtener buenos beneficios, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida (venta de queso frito) en el terminal provincial de la ciudad de Juliaca, mientras que su laborioso esposo trata de aprovechar cualquier trabajo eventual que se le presenta para obtener ingresos extras y poder mantener sin privaciones a su familia.Criss en estos momentos no se encuentra trabajando porque está en espera de un lindo bebé, que dentro de poco tiempo terminará de llenar de alegría y amor su dulce hogar.

loans.use: Additional capital to sell a greater quantity of dishes.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao K. lives in Kan Yuon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She sells fish. Mrs. Mao K. used a previous loan to start her fish business. Her business now has improved, so Mrs. Mao K. decided to ask for another loan to purchase more fish to resell at the market.

Her husband, Mr. Art Oeurn, always helps his wife with her business. Mrs. Mao K. is 36 years old and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell in the market.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina is a young mother who cultivates citrus. However, citrus season is coming to an end, so she needs to prepare to grow bananas, which she would like to sell in the nearby cities, especially in commercial areas. Her job is very laborious, so she must work hard everyday in order to yield a large amount of crops that will allow for greater profits. Justina is quite worried because the profits that she will earn will not be sufficient to increase her crops. As a result, she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of citrus plants that she will cultivate before the end of the season.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina es una joven madre que trabaja cultivando frutos cítricos, de los cuales la temporada de producción está llegando a su fin, entonces tiene que prepararse para la producción de de platanales, los que quiere llevar a vender a las ciudades aledañas, en especial donde hay mayor flujo comercial. Su trabajo es muy cansado, día tras día debe esforzarse para obtener gran cantidad de productos que le permitan conseguir mayores ingresos.Justina está muy preocupada porque el dinero que obtendrá como ganancia no le será suficiente para ampliar sus cultivos, por ello solicita un préstamo, dinero que invertirá en la compra de plantas de cítricos que desea cultivar antes de que termine la temporada.

loans.use: Purchase citrus plants to increase production

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora owns a shop that makes small machines to create rubber stamps which are sold in Santa Cruz, Cochabamba and Beni states. Her husband is in charge of selling these products. They have 3 children ages 15, 12 and 4. They live in the Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) are of El Alto city.

The loan will be used to buy raw materials which will allow for increased production of her small machines to satisfy demand.

This is her first loan with Impro. Our evaluation qualifies her favorably and therefore her application was immediately approved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Teodora posee un taller donde fabrica pequeñas maquinas para elaborar sellos de goma, las cuales son comercializadas en los departamentos de Santa Cruz, Cochabamba y Beni, el esposo es el encargado de vender estos productos tienen tres hijos de 15, 12 y 4 años de edad. Viven en la zona Villa Ingenio (Rió Seco) de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para comprar materia prima, lo que permitirá incrementar la producción de sus pequeñas maquinas y satisfacer la gran demanda.

Este es su primer crédito con Impro, nuestra evaluación la calificó favorablemente, por eso, su solicitud fue aprobada inmediatamente.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ndèye Fallo

texts.fr: Ndèye Fallo Ndao, 52 ans, mariée avec 07 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bayouf Pout à Thiès depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des fruits locaux comme les pastèques, les mandarines et les mangues selon la saison. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Ndèye Fallo Ndao, age 52, is married and has seven children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Bayouf Pout in Thiès for three years. Her business consists of buying and reselling local fruit, like watermelons, mandarin oranges, and mangoes according the season. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local fruit

loans.name: Ni Putu Murdani

texts.id: Ni Putu Murdani dan suaminya tinggal disebuah desa. Sebelum menekuni usaha ternak babi, Ni Putu Murdani menekuni usaha ternak ayam. Karena hasilnya tidak memuaskan, akhirnya Ni Putu Murdani berhenti memelihara ayam dan beralih beternak babi. Kebetulan lewat organisasi yang ada di desanya yang bekerja sama dengan Dinari akhirnya membuka peluang untuk kembali berusaha. Selain mendapat pinjaman dana, Ni Putu Murdani juga mendapat pelatihan tentang beternak babi secara baik dan benar. Dengan program pinjaman selama  6 bulan dan pembayaran seluruh pinjaman pada saat akhir periode. Setelah memperoleh dana, Ni Putu Murdani berkeinginan untuk memelihara 2 ekor babi dan membuat kandang yang lebih baik. Ni Putu Murdani berharap dari pinjaman yang diperolehnya nantinya bisa mendukung usahanya. Ni Putu Murdani memiliki 2 orang anak yang sekarang memerlukan biaya banyak untuk pendidikannya dan kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin meningkat.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Murdani and her husband live in a village. Prior to breeding pigs, Ni Putu Murdani was breeding chickens. Because its yield is not sufficient she finally stopped breeding chickens and return to breeding pigs. Lately an organization in the village works with Dinari, which provides opportunities for returning effort. Besides receiving loans, Ni Putu Murdani also receive training on breeding pigs the correct way. With this 6-month loan program which is repayable at the end of the period. After receiving funding, Ni Putu Murdani intends to breed 2 pigs and construct a proper pen. Ni Putu Murdani hope to use the loan granted to support her effort. Ni Putu Murdani has 2 children who currently need funding to pay for their education and the increasing family expenses.

Translated from Indonesian by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and construct pen (Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang)

loans.name: Shahnaz Kosar Haider Ali Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz Kosar baji is 41 years old and lives in a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. Her husband, H. A., runs a grocery shop. Shahnaz baji is a mother of four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shahnaz baji is a seamstress with 5 years experience. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery stock and increase the items he offers

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Najma baji requests a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Pathani baji requests a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Shamshad baji requests a loan to buy woods to resell. Rani baji requests a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for grocery shop stock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 12 años no deja de asistir a las ferias de su ciudad, ya que es el lugar donde realiza su actividad económica, la cual es vender condimentos de todo tipo en pequeñas bolsitas y ofrecerlas a las amas de casa. Esta actividad le ayuda cubrir sus gastos, ya que semana a semana sale a vender, le agrada ofrecer sus productos, aunque lo más cómodo seria tener un lugar estable donde venderlos. Pero gracias a Dios, nos dice, la venta de condimentos siempre es buena, porque no hay muchas personas vendiendo lo mismo, además como son muy baratas, vender al por menor es rentable, sin embargo, lo difícil es caminar todo el tiempo  y exponerse al sol todo el día. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará sus productos, ahora por navidad invertirá para vender pasas, las cuales son muy demandadas en esta época.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 38 years old, and lives with her husband and three children. Since she was twelve, she never missed the fairs of her city as this is where she earns her living selling all types of condiments in small bags to the local housewives. This activity helps her meet her living expenses, since she sells every week, and she enjoys offering her products although it would be more practical to have a stable location from which to sell her merchandise. But, thanks to God she tells us, sales of condiments are always good because not many people offer them. In addition, they are inexpensive and selling them at retail is profitable. Regardless, it is difficult to walk constantly and be exposed to the sun all day. This is her first loan with MFP. With the funds she is requesting, she will increase her supply of products. Now, for the holiday season, she will invest in the sale of raisins which are in great demand at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quanity of merchandise that she sells.

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Huot R., 51, lives in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979.  She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. 

She is a good mother of seven childR.: four are single and three are married and live away from home.  To help meet a little more of the family's needs, three of her childR. are employed as wood carving sellers.  She is married to Sok Phan, age 52, who also sells wood carvings that depend on carving from the forest. 

In view of the fact that rice growing is R.'s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, and in order to help her meet the hard physical labor demands of farming work, Huot R. is applying for a loan to buy two cows to use for plowing the fields and also to raise for their offspring.

loans.use: To buy two cows to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeun C. is 40 years old and is a widow with two children; one is a blacksmith and the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Oeun C. lives with her children in Sambuo village in the Kandal province.

Mrs. Oeun C. is a farmer who owns a 0.5 field of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, the field is far from the irrigation system and the soil is infertile.

Mrs. Oeun C. is asking for a loan for a pump machine and fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the pump and to water the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy a pump machine, fertilizer, and fuel

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda Q. is twenty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a girl and three boys. She says her first born is in the junior high school while the rest are in the basic school. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in a small town called Simpa. Simpa is a farming community which is a few kilometers from Tarkwa in the Western Region of Ghana. Matilda works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family.  Her husband trades in gold.
She is a professional hair dresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. A number of them have already graduated. Matilda has been in business for as long as nineteen years.
Matilda wants a loan to procure artificial hair, cream, lotion, weave-on, etc. It is her dream to sponsor her children to have the best education.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair, lotion, cream, etc

loans.name: Vivian Harlen

texts.es: LA SRA. VIVIAN HARLEN TIENE 30 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES CASADA,TIENE UNA HIJA QUE VIVE CON ELLA, CUENTA CON CASA PROPIA. LA SRA. VIVIAN HARLEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES DE YAMBAL Y AVON POR TODA LA CIUDAD HACE BASTANTE TIEMPO POR LO QUE CONOCE BIEN EL NEGOCIO. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA EN LA ZONA YA QUE ELLA CUENTA CON CLIENTES FIJOS QUE LE HACEN LOS PEDIDOS. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA LA COMPRA DE MAS COSMETICOS Y PERFUMES PARA AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE OPERACION YA QUE TIENE VARIOS PEDIDOS POR REALIZAR. LA CLIENTA HA TENIDO ALGUNAS FALLAS EN SU ANTERIOR CREDITO POR PROBLEMAS CON SU VEHICULO QUE LO TRABAJA SU ESPOSO, ADEMAS EL MONTO DESEMBOLSADO EN EL ANTERIOR CREDITO ERA MAS ALTO, PERO DESPUÉS CUMPLIO CON NORMALIDAD SUS CUOTAS.
texts.en:
Vivian Harlen is 30 years old, married and lives with her daughter in their own house. Vivian Harlan has worked selling Yambal and Avon cosmetics and perfumes for quite some time. She sells all over the city, so her business is fairly well known. The competition in the area is low, so she has a fixed clientele that makes orders. This loan is for the purchase of cosmetics and perfumes to increase her operational capital, as she has many orders to fill. The client had some failures in previous credit due to problems with the vehicle her husband uses for work, but the amount of that credit was higher and she was able to complete payments normally.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Paraska

texts.en:
Paraska C. has a barber shop in Beregovo city. Paraska has been in this business for 15 years. Her profit is 2,500 UAH per month. Paraska just loves her business. She treats customers with love and care and has many repeated customers.

Paraska would like to get a loan of 3,500 UAH to remodel and fix her barber shop. This will help her to attract even more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: To remodel her barber shop

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Арипов Алишер проживает в городе Вахдат в возрасте 24-ёх лет, женат имеет одиного сына.Образование среднее, клиен занимается бизнесом уже более 5 лет, он имеет арендуюмую торговую точку, которая находится на центральном рынке города Вахдат.Клиент занимается изготовлением и продажей деревянных изделий. На полученные деньги клиентка хочет закупить древесину.От полученного дохода клиент содержит семью.
texts.en:
Alisher A. lives in Vahdat. He is 24 years old, is married and has one son. He has a high school education. The client has had a business for more than 5 years; he has a rented sales location at the central market in the city of Vahdat. The client makes and sells wooden products. He wants to use the money that he receives to purchase wood. He supports his family using the profits that he receives.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Jemerlin

texts.en:
"I started tilling a one hectare farm. I was just a tenant then, working the farm I never own. I was just renting a lot but it has been a great help, especially in providing the needs of my children," says Jemerlin D.. She is 41 years old and the mother of seven children. "Our harvest is mainly intended for family consumption. Some of the excess is sold to rice traders for additional income for the family," she adds.

Jemerlin is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 20 liters of crude oil to run the farm machinery, sacks of fertilizers for soil improvement, and herbicides as well, for plant protection. The loan will definitely give her family an increased yield and income.

CEVI is helping people to grow their businesses. It provides more than just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 20 liters of crude oil, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Betty Amelia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82752&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Betty es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Betty tiene un negocio de cabina de locutorio y alquila un local que tiene 
Desde que comenzó en Finca, se siente Segura,  por que puede seguir solicitando prestamos, le sirven para su negocio y para dar educación a su hijo.
Betty  necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para el arreglo del local y asegurar su local por que esta muy inseguro. 
El sueño es adquirir otra propiedad y alquilarlo y tener un centro de computo e investigación.
texts.en:
First Kiva loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82752&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Betty is a member of the San Juan Village Bank. She has a call center and also rents out a space she owns. Ever since she started taking out loans from Finca, Betty has felt safe, because she knows she can continue to take out loans that help her run her business and pay for her son's education. Betty needs a loan of 1600 soles to renovate and secure the space she rents out, since it is currently very insecure. Her dream is to acquire another property to rent out and to have her own computing/research center.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate and secure rental property

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29 year old Zuwena J. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, between the ages of 3 and 11 years old. Zuwena has been running a Mobile phone accessories business since 2005. It is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania. This is probably attributable to the fact that it is the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, days per week. Zuwena currently earns about 150USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase more mobile phone accessories. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Zuwena thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel G. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en su anterior crédito, con el cual termino la recamara de sus hijos.
Nueva está solicitando un préstamo para terminar el cuarto que es el de su mama quien vive con ellos, es una persona ya mayor de edad y necesita ciertas necesidades y quiere acondicionarle la recamara lo mejor que se pueda. 
Pero no cuanta con el dinero necesario para terminar el cuarto es por eso que solicita un crédito, el cual pagara con sus ingresos con vigilante y limpieza de una iglesia. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son su mama y su hija quienes nos atendieron ya que el señor Miguel se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel G. is very thankful for the lenders' cooperation in his previous loan, with which he completed his children's bedroom. Once again, Miguel is requesting a loan, this time to finish a room for his mother, who lives with Miguel and his family. Because she is of an advanced age, his mother requires certain amenities. Miguel wants prepare the room for her as best he can, but he doesn't have the necessary funds to properly complete the room. It is for this reason that he requests a loan, which he will repay with his income from watching over and cleaning a church. The people who appear in the photo are his mother and his daughter, who stand in place of Miguel since he was at his job when the photo was being taken.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acabados del interior de su casa

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia es una mujer muy respeta en su barrio, tiene 44 años de edad y está muy feliz de tener 7 hijos, de los cuales 5 viven con ella. Desde los 20 años se dedica a la labrar la tierra en compañía de su esposo, durante todos estos años han sembrado papas y arvejas. Para ello, todos los días se levanta a las 4 de la madrugada para realizar sus labores domésticas y posteriormente, a las 9 de la mañana, ya está trabajando en sus cultivos. A Basilia le falta dinero para cubrir los gastos del colegio de sus hijos, por ello se ha propuesto incrementar sus siembras con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores. Pero en lo que se refiere a la comercialización, ella es insustituible, pues en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma los compradores son muy astutos; pero la experiencia la ha hecho una buena comerciante y no se deja engañar, más aun, le gusta mucho vender porque se distrae mucho conversando y ofreciendo sus producto a sus clientes. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que está muy emocionada, pues nunca antes ha trabajado con este tipo de créditos. Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con los integrantes de su banco comunal que le dieron la oportunidad de incorporase a su grupo, por lo que hace compromisos de cumplir con todos los acuerdos y pagar mensualmente sus cuotas. Con el monto que ahora solicita comprará 8 bolsas de fertilizantes químicos para sus nuevas chacras de papas.
texts.en:
Basilia is well-respected in her neighborhood. She is 44 years of age and is happy to have her seven children, five of whom live with her. For the past 20 years, she has toiled on her land with the help of her husband. Through all those years, they have planted potatoes and peas. Basilia wakes up at 4am to do the housework and by 9am she is already working in the fields. She lacks the money to pay for her children’s education. With the help of her grown children, she hopes to increase the volume of crops that are planted. When it comes to marketing her products, Basilia is an astute saleswoman because the consumers in Tarma are very knowledgeable. Her experience has helped her become a better trader and she is not easily fooled. She enjoys sales because she likes speaking with her customers and offering them her products.

This is her first loan with MFP. Basilia is very excited because she has never worked with credit before. She is grateful to the members of her communal bank for the opportunity to join their group, so that they can help one another meet their commitments and make their monthly payments. Basilia will use her loan to purchase 8 bags of chemical fertilizers for her new crop of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a member of the Embacasy borrower group in Himo,Kilimanjaro,she is 44 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 19,27 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Safina started her own food business selling Banana 1 year ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Safina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more banana for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Safina hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more banana for sale

loans.name: Bishara

texts.en: Bishara A. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur and small businesswoman. She runs a business selling mattresses and pillows at Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the  goods from the wholesale shops in the Kariakoo city shopping center and sells them retail to customers. The business income meets her family's daily needs. She is requesting a loan of TZS 800,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia es una mujer dinámica y muy luchadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa provincia D. Coronel Portillo, tiene 68 años y es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, se dedica a preparar tortas, rosquillas, biscochuelos y otros dulces, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es jubilado. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” desD. hace siete años, donD. se ha caracterizado por ser siempre alegre y puntual. El primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que invirtió en insumos para hacer tortas.

COn este préstamo D. S/ 3,000 soles, comprará harina, manteca, azúcar para elaborar sus dulces .La meta D. Libia es tener una tienda D. abarrotes  bien surtido.

loans.use: Invertirá en harina, manteca, azúcar para elaborar sus dulces.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
M. Salima is a small entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is married with 4 children, who are the reason for her daily fight for a better life. Being the only bread winner in the family she sells women national dresses and trousers in the famous local market called “Korvon”. Salima is a very hard-working woman. She always achieves all her goals and overcomes different challenges with natural optimism. She is requesting a loan of $825 USD to re-stock her inventory. She is hoping to purchase more merchandise at affordable wholesale prices for further retail sale. The only dream of Salima is to ensure her children with a good education and to make them happy. We believe Salima’s integrity and the consistent growth of her venture in the past years can guarantee further stable expansion of her trade and timely loan repayment. The well being of this family is on your hands. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing women national dresses and trousers to increase the range of selling goods

loans.name: Rito

texts.en:
Rito F. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. He is 32 years old. Rito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rito owns and operates a watch repair shop business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Rito has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rito has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen G. is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Helen owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2005, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар Шарипов проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 24 года. Женат, детей не имеет. Диловар имеет экономическое образование. Но он более 3 лет занимается услугой маршрутного такси. Услугу такси предоставляет по городу Душанбе. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины, т.к. эта автомашина является единственным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Dilovar S. lives in Dushanbe. He is twenty-four years old, married with no children. He has an education in economics but for more than three years, he has been a shuttle taxi driver. His taxi service covers the whole of Dushanbe. He is asking for a loan to repair his automobile, because it is the sole source of income.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair Automobile

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda B. is from the town of Balutu, Concepcion Tarlac. She is 49 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen near a school. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and North-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kurbonmahmad

texts.en:
Kurbonmahmad is 58 years old and married. He lives with his wife. They have 7 children, who are almost all adults with their own families.

Several years ago, Kurbonmahmad opened a grocery store in their home, where he, with the help of his wife and children, sells all kinds of basic needs goods like sugar, pasta, flour, dairy, eggs, etc. His business is doing very well because it is located in an area where there is not much competition.

Kurbonmahmad is requesting a loan of 4400 Somoni that he plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of different foodstuffs. The demand for these products is very high and this will help him to increase his profits.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he has to sell

loans.name: Zinunula Group, Mukono

texts.en: M. Janet is a member of the Zinunula group, Mukono. She is a hard-working lady with a retail shop in Nasuuti. She is 27 years old and married with three children. She also takes care of her parents back in the village. Janet says that her biggest challenge in business are the debtors who always take goods on credit and fail or take too long to pay, hence affecting her cash flow. Janet needs a loan to be able to stock her shop with more sugar, salt, cooking oil, bread, sweets and other confectioneries since the profits made will help her save to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Bayanderlger

texts.en:
Bayanderlger is a water distributor in Ulaanbaatar. He lives with his wife and three little children (son pictured) in the northern section of the city where the pollution is the worst. He purchased an insulated ger (traditional nomadic tent) blanket in order to help reduce the air pollution. So far, he is really happy with the ger insulation and feels that he is saving money from spending less on fuel and is keeping warmer than before.


About XacBank Eco Products Program:
Ulaanbaatar is the coldest capital in the world. Winter temperatures can average -20 Celsius. Sixty percent of the city population live in tents called gers, with wooden frames covered by layers of wool felt. On average, households located in the Ger Districts use 5 tons of coal and 1.5 tons of wood per year. Sixty percent of the pollution in the city during the heating season is attributed to coal burned in the Ger Districts. The bottom fifth spend as much as 40% of their monthly winter income on heating fuels.

XacBank has worked with MicroEnergy Credits to launch a line of eco-products consisting of energy efficient stoves and ger blankets, which will reduce energy consumption.

loans.use: To buy a six-layer highly insulated yurt (ger) covering

loans.name: Maria Fortunata

texts.es:
María Fortunata tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el caserío Las Juntas del distrito de Pacora, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.
