Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, como ovejas, chivos y aves de corral. Ella cría sus animales en un corral ubicado a espaldas de su domicilio. Este negocio es muy importante para su economía familiar ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

María Fortunata se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de animales y en el arreglo de su corral, ya que planea ampliar su negocio para captar más ingresos.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada por los vecinos de la zona, su más grande anhelo es darle a sus hijos una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
María Fortunata is 40 years old , married and lives with her husband and three children in the Las Juntas settlement in the Pacora district, located one hour from Chiclayo city. For 10 years she has raised and sold young animals, such as sheep, goats and fowl. She raises her animals in a corral located behind her home. This business is very important for the economy of the family since her husband works in agriculture and this business does not provide a permanent income. María Fortunata is asking for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa of 1500 PEN which she intends to use for the purchase of animals and for the repair of her corral, since she plans to expand her business to earn more income. She is quite well known and respected by the neighbours in her area. Her greatest wish is to give her children a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to increase her business and repair the corral

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en:
Iokapeta F. is 31 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, selling sweets & confectionaries such as cookies & cakes in the local community.  Iokapeta has many years of experience in this business.  Iokapeta needs a loan of WST $1250 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Iokapeta joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Iokapeta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Iokapeta F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Becky

texts.en:
Becky sells foodstuffs, drinks and groceries at retail prices to her customers to make a living. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with customers.

She is 41 years old and married with five children. Her eldest child is 14 years old and her children attend school which makes her happy. She has been in this business for eight years. She hopes to grow her business. Becky is asking for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Turan

texts.en: H. Turan was born 1990. She is single. Turan live in the Absheron region with her family. She has run a consulting business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani manat to improve her business by buying a computer.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 30-year-old businessman operating a charcoal store. He operates his business along the Mtopanga area. He has no children yet but he is married to one wife. He has been in the same business for the last four years, and his monthly profit minus all other expenses is Kshs 5,000. He is also employed, which is to say that he has a basic salary at the end of the month.

Geoffrey has never borrowed from any other institution and was introduced by other members to KADET. He has currently been a member of KADET for three months and now he is ready for his first loan of Kshs10,000. He plans to expand his business by buying three more sacks of charcoal worth Kshs 10,000.

He hopes to become a big supplier of charcoal in Mombasa town.

loans.use: To purchase three bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Nkwenye Ole

texts.en:
Nkwenye Ole K. is 32 years old. He is married to Napilosh K. and is the father of children who go to school. Nkwenye is a farmer. He has been farming his own land for the last five years.
  
He learned about KADET from a colleague who was a registered KADET client in his neighborhood. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend 35,000 KES to prepare his land for wheat farming and the other 30,000 KES to buy some sheep to fatten and sell later. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to reinvest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer both in wheat farming and sheep rearing.

loans.use: To prepare the land for wheat farming and to buy sheep to raise and sell

loans.name: Sampaguita

texts.en:
At 51 years of age, Sampaguita S. is enjoying her career being a wife, a mother, and a businesswoman. Even though she is financially unable to consistently combat poverty and the challenge to supporting her family, Sampaguita has never seen a life happier than hers since her family supports one another through thick and thin. 

Her husband works hard in the field farming rice as a hired laborer. His small and sporadic income is remitted to Sampaguita, being the one in charge of the family budget. A large portion of it goes for the education of her two children in high school.  

Sampaguita really wants her children to graduate from college and have a better career in the future. She was frustrated when her eldest child stopped schooling after elementary. However, she had no choice then because she didn’t have enough income to support her education. With that, Sampaguita learned a lesson. She realized she has to have her own business and supplement the income of her husband. 

This realization led her to ASHI in 2002. Since then she has been receiving loans and has able to put up her own small “sari-sari” (variety) store, selling a small volume of various grocery items, foodstuffs, beverages and other commodities. People would tend to buy things they need from her than going to market and spending carfare. Therefore, Samapguita’s store has acquired a lot of customers from around their village. 

Proceeds from this business have somehow made life easy and enjoyable for her family, especially her children. Because she sees the potential of improving their standard of living once her business has grown, as well as its profit, Sampaguita is applying for a much larger  loan amount from ASHI. Her husband supports her decision for this because he sees his wife enjoying her career running her own business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, foodstuffs, and beverages for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey(Mujeres Trabajadoras) Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña kyre y nace gracias a Varias señoras  que se unieron y decidieron formar un comité en el barrio. 
 Están muy contentas ante la posibilidad de organizarse y progresar de manera comunitaria. 
Ellas solicitan en crédito lo cual invertirán en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales y así cada día poder progresar y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes del comite es la señora Iris, quien es muy trabajadora y luchadora, ella tiene venta de ropas en el mercado, no posee un puesto definido ya que resulta bastate caro adquirir un puesto, es por eso que ella recorre varios lugares para ofrecer sus mercaderias.
A pesar de las dificultades ella tiene muy esperanza en su trabajo ya que ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas para invierno, como, sueter, pantalones, buzos, camperas.
texts.en:
The Kuna Kyre committee was born thanks to several women who came together and decided to form a committee in their neighbourhood. They are very happy with the opportunity to organize themselves and progress in a communal manner. They are requesting a loan which they will invest in the purchase of items that will be sold in their respective commercial activities. Thus every day they will be able to progress and get ahead. One of the group members is Iris, who is very hard-working and dedicated. She sells clothing in the market; she does not have a defined stall as it is rather expensive to buy one. For this reason she travels to different areas to offer her merchandise. Despite the difficulties, she has a great deal of hope in her work, since it helps with household costs. She is requesting a loan to purchase winter clothing such as sweaters, pants, jumpers and jackets.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Winter clothing

loans.name: Cristhiam Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cristhiam lo integran tres mujeres joviales, trabajadoras y emprendedoras quienes entre risas y bromas hicieron más ameno la entrevista. La coordinadora del grupo es María José P. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosmético negocio que inicio hace cuatro años con poco capital con la compra de algunos cosméticos.

Esta señora emprendedora cuando habla de la miscelánea que desea construir se le ilumina el rostro, se  vista chispea y describe con tan emoción y precisión dicha meta en el que habrá un cubico para cosméticos, de ropa y confites según dijo.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Karla Patricia Hernández se dedica al comercio de ropa y productos para niños y Cenia Delfina Pérez Poveda vende variedad de productos desde perfumes, ropa, cosméticos etc.
texts.en:
The Cristhiam group is comprised of three cheerful, hard-working, and enterprising women. Between laughs and jokes they made the interview more enjoyable. María José P. is the coordinator of the group. She has a business selling clothing and cosmetics. She started the business four years ago. She used a little capital to buy some cosmetics. This enterprising woman’s face lights up and she sparkles when she talks about the small general store that she wishes to build. She describes her goal with much emotion and precision. She will have a place for cosmetics, clothes, and sweets. Karla Patricia Hernández, a colleague in the group, sells clothing and products for children. Cenia Delfina Pérez Hernández, another colleague, sells a variety of products from perfume to clothes and cosmetics, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita S. is from Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Angelita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business operating motor transport services. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mbighamen

texts.en:
Mbighamen A. is a married father of two who currently lives in Chuaku, Belo-Cameroon. A. is currently requesting a third loan from GHAPE. He has been with GHAPE since 2008, and he has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by his repayments, consistent attendance at meetings, and support of his borrowing group.

With this latest loan, A. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by his prior loans. He has requested 340,000 XAF in order to purchase seven female goats for 100,000 XAF, 150 chicks for 150,000 XAF, fowl feed for 50,000 XAF, and seedlings for 40,000 XAF. He believes that this business will succeed, because there is a ready market for his product. He hopes to use the profits from his business to build his home, to purchase more land, and to pay his children's school fees. He hopes to improve his children's living conditions in order to avoid the hardships that he has dealt with throughout his life-- struggles such as a lack of education, illnesses, and unemployment.

A.'s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit nongovernmental organization based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and the alleviation of poverty through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase goats, chicks, fowl feed, and seedlings

loans.name: Jay Anthony

texts.en:
Jay Anthony M. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 25 years old, married, and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Jay Anthony owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jay Anthony joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jay Anthony’s 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Foska

texts.es: La Señora Foska una mujer emprendedora que trabaja muy fuerte para mantener a sus pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  en la zona en la que vive, acomodando las prendas a sus clientas con un carisma único que es irresistible no comprarle una prenda de vestir, ella se gana la vida realizando sus ventas diarias que favorecen a sus hijos para que ellos puedan estudiar dignamente gracias al esfuerzo de su madre, es muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería de temporada ya que  esta cerca la temporada de primavera, quiere proveerse de mercadería, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Foska is an enterprising woman who works very hard to support her children. She earns her living by selling clothing in the neighbourhood where she lives. Foska is very charismatic so her customers find it impossible not to buy something from her. She goes to work every day to support her children so they can study properly thanks to the efforts of their hardworking mother. With the loan Foska plans to obtain clothing appropriate to the season since Spring is approaching. She is grateful to the institution for the financial help it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio es un señor de 28 años de edad, reside en el caserío la guaruma en Yamabal, Morazán, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura porque desde pequeño su padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra sembrando Maíz y frijol, su jornada normal de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde.
Don Eugenio está solicitando un crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de fertilizante para abonar su siembra y asi obtener una buena producción. Este crédito ayudara a don Eugenio a mejorar sus cultivos y obtener una mejor cosecha, que ayude a solventar sus necesidades familiares.
Su sueño es trabajar la tierra y que cada vez su cosecha sea mejor para poder algún día comprar un lugar donde vivir con su familia mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 28, lives in La Guaruma, in Yamabal, Morazán, with his wife and two sons who are 5 and 3 years old. He has been a farmer since he was little and his father taught him how to work the land planting corn and beans. His normal work day is from 6am until 1pm. Eugenio is asking for funds to buy fertilizers to fertilize his crops in order to get a good crop yield. This loan will help Eugenio improve his crops and get a better harvest that will help him meet family needs. His dream is to work the land and that each successive harvest is better so that one day he can buy a place to live with his family thus improving their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora. María L. es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el sector de Capulispamba que  pertenece a al parroquia de Sidcay en el cantón  Cuenca. La población de Sidcay está integrada mayoritariamente por niños(as), ancianos(as) y mujeres jefas de hogar, como consecuencia de la creciente migración de la población económicamente activa especialmente masculina. Su población se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de frutas, trabaja de miércoles a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
Doña María tiene de 53 años, es viuda hace 28 años y 7 hijos ya todos  mayores de edad, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven  independientemente, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y colaboran en el economía del hogar. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria L. is a member of the Feria Libre village bank and lives in the Capulispamba neighborhood of the Sidcay parrish of the city of Cuenca.  The population of Sidcay is primarily made up of children, old people, and homemakers as many of the men in the area work outside of the city.  The people in the area primarily work in agriculture and raising livestock.

Maria works selling fruit and works Wednesday to Sunday from 7 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon.  Maria is 53 years old and was widowed 28 years ago.  She has 7 children who are adults; 4 of whom are married and live on their own.  Her three single children work and help to support the family in the home.  Maria lives in a rented home.

She will invest the money from the loan in buying supplies for her home.  Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: William John

texts.en:
William John O., a 43-year-old resident of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda, is married and has five children, none of whom are currently in school. William has a retail shop dealing mainly in agricultural supplies, a business he has operated for less than one year.

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 2.000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more items such as sugar and seeds for the farm. With the help of this loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, William plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more items such as sugar and seeds for the shop

loans.name: Los Arcoiris De Atoto Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Los Arcoíris de Atoto, tiene este nombre porque a la presidenta le gustan mucho los arcoíris, ella dice que los arcoíris son señal de calma y tranquilidad, además este grupo se encuentra en Atotonilco de Tula Hidalgo. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes. María De La Paz Monterubio, es la presidenta del grupo tiene 36 años de edad estudio hasta preparatoria, es madre soltera y tiene un 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, inicio hace 9 años, María de la Paz solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra de zapatos y ropa, la señora María de La Paz espera con ansias este préstamo para poder invertir el dinero en su negocio, ofrecer mayor diversidad de mercancía a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ingresos para ella y su familia, especialmente a su hijo. Roció C., es otra integrante del grupo, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estudió hasta la preparatoria, su estado civil es casada y tiene 2 hijos: un varón y una mujer, ella tiene una lavandería. Tiene 6 años de antigüedad con su negocio, el préstamo solicitado es para poder seguir haciendo crecer su negocio, su meta es llegar a poner su propio local  y hacerlo crecer cada día más para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia en general.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Los Arcoíris de Atoto' (Rainbows of Atoto).  They chose this name because the president really likes rainbows.  She says that rainbows are a sign of calm and tranquility.  This group is located in Atotonilco de Tula Hidalgo and has 11 members.  María De La Paz Monterubio is the president of the group.  She is 36 years old and studied to senior high school level.  She is a single mother and has one son.  She sells shoes and clothes.  She started the business 9 years ago.  María de la Paz is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes and clothes.  María de la Paz is waiting anxiously for her loan so that she can invest the money in her business, offer a wider range of merchandise to her customers and thereby make a better income for herself and her family, especially her son.

Roció C is another member of the group.  She is 43 years old and studied to senior high school level.  She is married and has 2 children, one boy and one girl.  She has a laundromat.  She has had the business for 6 years.  She is requesting her loan so that she can continue to grow her business.  Her goal is to be able to establish her own premises and make her business grown more every day in order to provide her children and family in general with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and grow her business

loans.name: Marinel

texts.en:
Marinel N. is 40 years old and married. She helps support her family by operating a direct selling business as a Natasha Dealer.  She lives in Madasigon, Barangay Balidbid, Santa Fe, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $163. 

Marinel is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marinel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Henriette

texts.en:
Henriette is 46 years old and married with four children aged between 12 and 20. She sells honey in Nyamagabe district in Rwanda. She has been in business for ten years and works from 6am until 7pm.

This is her first loan requested through Vision Finance Company and she plans to buy more products for getting delicious honey. The extra income from this loan will help her to pay school fees for their children in the future.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more honey to sell

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera F. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending / fishing business. She lives in Talusan, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her fish vending/fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP8,000.  Sotera is borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can purchase materials and do repairs on her pump boat. 

This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Sotera aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase materials for fishing boat repair

loans.name: Turatbek

texts.en:
Turatbek B. is 55 years old.  He is married and has four children. After graduating from college and serving in the army, he worked at the local cable plant as an enamel engineer.  After the death of his mother, Turatbek moved into his parents’ house in order to take care of his father. Since his family had been engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivating, he decided to continue this activity.  He worked hard, but his earnings did not cover all the expenses for his growing children.  

In 2007, Turatbek decided to start his business selling foodstuffs.  This has become an additional source of income for his family.  He sold part of his cattle business and rented a small shop.  To maintain that shop, he obtained his first loan from Bai Tushum. This loan was  used as intended and repaid without any delay. 

Now, Turatbek plans to use this loan for 120,000 KGS to broaden his assortment of goods and renew his shelf stands in the rented shop. In the future, he plans to open his own shop and build a house for his family. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that aim to increase employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment for shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Aydee; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de colchones, sabanas y cubrecamas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al público en general, la socia quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender los colchones, sabanas y cubrecamas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Aydee is a member of the “KANTU” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Juana Aydee is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling mattresses, sheets and bedspreads.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner, taking her products to different places such as institutions and also selling to the general public.  She would like to own a store where she could sell her mattresses, sheets and bedspreads.

Juana Aydee is requesting this loan to buy merchandise wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Saidjahfar

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Саидчахфар проживает в городе Сарбанд. Ему 41 год. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Вместе с женой занимается торговлей на центральном рынке города. Арендует торговую точку, де продает мобильные телефоны и панели для мобильных телефонов. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 5 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Saidjahfar A. lives in the town of Sarband. He is 41 years old. He is married, with four children. He has secondary education. He and his wife have a retail business at the central market in their town. He leases a stall where he sells mobile phones and phone panels. He has been in this business for five years. He is taking out a loan in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar N.  is married with three children, two of whom are married.  The family is engaged in farming and land cultivation which helps them pay the university fees for their son who is studying in the capital city. 

Although Gohar is a village school teacher and her husband is a village major, the salaries are extremely low, and it is impossible to survive on them. The farming business is the main source of income for their family.

To meet the high demand for lamb, Gohar is planning to purchase sheep to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
Don José de 53 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor y también le gusta la ganadería, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad, dependen aun económicamente. El negocio lo tiene hace varios años ya que desde joven se dedico a las labores agropecuarias donde aprendió perfectamente, lo cual lo animo a continuar con estas actividades para llevar los ingresos al hogar y cubrir las necesidades.
El está solicitando un préstamo para comprar abono, semilla y fertilizantes, pues quiere realizar la siembra en este tiempo y no tiene los materiales necesarios, él espera con esta compra poder sembrar y recoger una buena cosecha.
Don José tiene como objetivo velar por las necesidades de su hogar, trabajar fuertemente cada día para lograrlo y en un futuro tener mejores comodidades.
texts.en:
Don José is 53 years old and lives in San Rafael Oriente, department of San Miguel. He is a farmer and also enjoys cattle raising. He lives with his wife and two children of 20 and 18 years of age, they still depend on him financially. Don José has had his business for many years, since he was young he has been involved in farming and stockbreeding where he learned perfectly the trade and it encouraged him to continue the work to bring money home and to meet his families’ needs.

Don José needs the loan to buy manure, seeds, and fertilizers since he wants to sow his crops during this time and does not have the necessary materials. He hopes that with these purchases he will be able plant and have a good harvest.

Don José has as an objective, to watch over the needs of his home, he does this by working hard each day to achieve his goal and in the future to have better things in life.

loans.use: To buy manure, seeds, and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne K. is 28 years old and married to Edward. They have two children. 

Carolyne has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been running her business for the past four years. Her monthly income is Kshs 12,900. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is also a client. She intends to use the money to buy more clothes to add to her business. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business greatly in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 38 años, es una mujer vanidosa y muy amable. Es separada, vive en casa de su madre en compañía de ella y de sus  hijos de 15 y 8 años por quienes se esfuerza por salir adelante. Desde hace 8 años, apoya en la atención de la bodega de su madre, por lo que es anciana. En todo este tiempo ella también fue invirtiendo, en la adquisición y el incremento de cervezas, y las gaseosas y galletas, son productos y negocio de su madre. Además, de esta actividad, 3 veces a la semana trabaja por las noches, en un taller de serigrafía, en busca de más ingresos a su hogar. Pero el sábado y domingo, a tiempo completo se dedica a su negocio, por ser días de mucha venta desde 15 a 20 cajas de cerveza, resultándole así muy rentable. De esta manera con su madre, ambas se apoyan y tratan de salir adelante. Pero, para está temporada, a sus amigas le han ofrecido vender el paquete completo de útiles escolares, del colegio de sus hijos, y para ello requiere de dinero, y está muy segura, que captará buena rentas, y para el futuro piensa instalar un restaurante, en el mismo local de su tienda. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que quiere cumplir con todas las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permite continuar trabajando. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará cuadernos y todos los útiles escolares, para distribuir a sus amigas y le paguen en partes.
texts.en:
Mónica, 38 years old, is a very friendly women and takes pride in her appearance. She is separated and lives in her mother's house with her mom and her children ages 15 and 8 for whom she works so they can get ahead. 

For 8 years she has helped with her mother's store because she is very old. Throughout this time she also began investing in the acquisition and the increase in beer, soft drinks and biscuits, products of her mother's business. In addition to this job, she works 3 nights a week in a printing workshop in search of more revenue for the home. On Saturday and Sunday she is dedicated full time to her business by having days of heavy selling from 15-20 cases of beer, which is very profitable.

In this manner with her mother, both are supportive of each other and try to get ahead. For this season, she is offering to sell to her friends the complete package of school supplies for their children. This requires money and she is sure that she will get a good income and the future plan is to install a restaurant on the premises of her shop.
 
This is her 9th loan with MFP and she promises to pay her dues punctually, since she wants to honor all of the people who made it possible for her to continue working. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy folders and other school supplies to distribute to her friends and they will pay her in parts.

loans.use: To buy folders and school supplies for her respective sales.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco M. y la señora Guillermina tienen dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando.
Solicitan un préstamo para poder comprar una computadora que sus hijos están necesitando para realizar las tareas e investigaciones que les encargan en la escuela, porque en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar la necesidades que sus hijos necesitan para estudiar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo de constructor de viviendas, ya que su esposa la señora Guillermina Sánchez quien trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de producción le ayudara con los gastos de la familia. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan una mejor educación y  lo necesario para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco M. and Ms. Guillermina have 2 children who are currently in school.

They are requesting a loan in order to purchase a computer because their children need one to do the homework and research projects that they are assigned at school. At this time, he does not have the money necessary to purchase what his children need in order to study.

He plans on repaying the loan with the income that he obtains as a home construction worker. His wife, Guillermina Sánchez, works in the production department of a factory and will help with the family expenses.

He hopes that his children will receive a better education and everything they need so that they can finish their degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 28 years old and lives in the Sinkor area. She has only sixth grade education and is married, with two children aged 2 and 6, one of whom is currently in school.

Bendu has been selling food items such as pepper, onions, spices, etc, for the past 4 years. She likes her business because it makes her independent and she can do things on her own. Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, salt, etc. She hopes to buy land and build her own house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, salt, etc.

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en:
Jesse is aged 34 years and married with two children aged 6 and 3 years, with the first one already attending school. He has been in mixed farming for 10 years, producing tomatoes and vegetables which he sells to the local market. Jesse also works as a technician in the local market, doing mainly welding and battery charging.

Jesse has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump and irrigation pipes to ensure that the water supply for his poultry farm is consistent. He says steady supply of water will cut down his farm running costs and give him steady returns. He hopes to expand his farming activities and even own a tractor in future.

He notes that climatic changes are a great challenge to farming.

loans.use: To pay for purchase of a water pump, irrigation pipes and poultry.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 24-year-old man from Tulkarem. He works in a local development institution. Tareq is recently married and still working on furnishing his house. 
He took out a loan from Kiva partner, FATEN, to purchase a fridge and a washing machine as he was using old ones that he had borrowed from his parents.

loans.use: to buy home appliances (fridge and washing machine).

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 43 years old, married and a father of four.  He runs a butcher shop to earn a living.  He has been engaged in the business for three and a half years.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money with his group members.  He hopes to own a big hotel in the future.  He has requested 40,000 KES to buy meat. Thomas describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is 51 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 18 years old. Adora's husband is a farmer.

Adora helps her husband till the land where they grow rice crops. She also raises chickens and manages their small sari-sari (variety) store. Adora plans to use her loan to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, one sack of chick grower and farm equipment such as a water hose. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of fertilizers, one sack of chick grower, and farm equipment such as a water hose.

loans.name: Yhony

texts.es: Yhony de 34 años de edad, es soltero, él vive en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Desde su juventud, Yhony quería tener un negocio grande, pero no como sus padres los llevaba, sino de una manera más responsable y eficaz, desde luego que emprendió en su actividad agrícola, específicamente en la producción y comercialización de cacao. En el presente produce en cantidades considerables y sus compradores potenciales se sienten satisfechos por la buena producción cacao. Es por ello que trata de mejorar la calidad de sus productos aplicando nuevas técnicas de injerto para sus plantaciones de cacao, y venderlo a un precio competitivo. Por lo general sus ventas los realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma comunidad, y eso le genera buenas ganancias económicas, aunque no se siente satisfecho con lo que ha alcanzado, por ello anhela comprar más lotes de terreno, con la finalidad de extender sus cultivos de cacao y así obtener una mayor producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP por lo que Yhony se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 soles que solicita, Yhony comprará más plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Yhony is 34 years old and single.  He lives in his own home located in the town of Canayre in the Llochegua district.  

Since his youth, Yhony wanted to have a large store, but that was not his parents raised him.  In a more responsible and effective manner, he later began to farm, specifically producing and selling cacao.  Currently, he produces a considerable amount, and his potential buyers feel satisfied by the good production he has.  Therefore, he wants to improve the quality of his products by using new grafting techniques on his cacao crop and then selling it at a competitive price.  In general, he sells his crop at the collection centers in his community, and they are generating him a good income.  However, he does not feel satisfied with everything he has achieved, so he wants to purchase more land so that he can plant more cacao plants and have a larger harvest.

This is his second loan with MFP, and Yhony promises to be on time with his payments.  With the 1500 nuevos soles he requested, Yhony will purchase more cacao plants.

loans.use: to purchase more cacao plants.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín de 60 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia,la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en la provincia de Morropón que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Martín es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y legumbres,una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Martín es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia mejore y tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
60 year-old Martín lives with his family in his own home which only has electricity.  It is located in Morropón province, in Piura department.  This area is noted for the fact that the local people farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Martín is a farmer.  He owns his own farmland where he grows corn and vegetables.  When he harvests his crops, he sells his produce in the different markets in Piura.  In this way, he makes income with which he covers his household expenses.
 
Martín has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy fertilizers in order to improve his land and his crops.  His goal is to sell his produce at a better price so that he can improve financially.  Martín is a father who works so that his family can improve their situation and enjoy some comforts in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his land and his crops

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a 55-year-old married father of five children ranging in age from 27 to 16 years, operates a farm as his primary business and has had a studio as a secondary business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Peter is now requesting his first loan with KADET after having been introduced to it by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer for his farm and stationery for his studio business. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will expand the studio enterprise. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses to boost income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm and stationery for his studio business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Maputo, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 2 a 14 anos de idade. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria no distrito de Boane com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo provincia, é negociante ha mais de 7 anos e tem um rendimento de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum atravez do xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa) e algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( massa, oleo, arroz, feijão, açucar, e outros ).  
Sonha em concluir a sua casa e manter o bom ritmo do seu negocio, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She’s married and mother of 4 children between the ages of 2 and 14. She completed 7th grade and stopped due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never left the Maputo province and has been a businesswoman for more than 7 years. She has an income of 5,000 meticals (MZN) a month which she spends on household expenses and saves through ‘xitique’ (traditional system of rotational savings) as well as in her bank account.

She’s never had loans from other banks. She heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client and this is her first loan with Hluvuku for the value of 13,000 MZN, with which she intends to buy products (pasta, oil, rice, beans, sugar and others).

She dreams of finishing her house and maintaining a good rhythm in her business, for which she intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products (pasta, oil, rice, beans, sugar and others)

loans.name: Batmunkh

texts.en:
Batmunkh is 37 years old.  She is a seller of wallpaper.  She lives with her 3 children and husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

Batmunkh has been running her business since 2000 and owns a kiosk in a bazaar called Bolor-Talst.  One of her sons became severely ill almost a year ago, so he always stays at home. She and her husband both want to cure their son’s illness if they could have enough money for medication. Batmunkh has been planning to solve this problem through efforts to increase her business income.  

Batmunkh needs to raise her current business assets and output.  Therefore, she is planning to purchase a large amount of wallpaper from the building materials market to resell.

loans.use: buy wallpaper to resell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and clothing.

For over 3 years Judith has operated a motorcycle transport business. Her potential customers are neighbors and town dwellers. In addition, she also operates a retail shop selling household products which contributes to her other source of income. Judith faces a major challenge of competition from other motorcycle operators. She dreams of having a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 80,000 KES loan, Judith wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves and washing detergents. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves and washing detergents

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with two children. 
Nelita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for nine years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Nelita has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Dahufa Ndagire's Group

texts.en:
Dahufa's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Dahufa is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Dahufa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap to sell and will help Dahufa generate greater profit and pay for her school fees. Dahufa hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Dahufa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Dahufa's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: German Julio

texts.es:
German Julio tiene 55 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 33 y 29 años de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.

German se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá invertir en la agricultura para aumentar la producción.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño para los próximos 5 años es comprarse una casa para vivir con la familia y un carro para transportar los productos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
German Julio is 55 years old and lives with his common-law wife.  He has two children.  He lives with his wife and his 33-year-old and 29 year old sons in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The San Nicolas community bank is located in San Nicolás, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn.

German is a farmer who grows corn, rice and beans.  He makes his purchases and sales in San Jacinto.  He is requesting this loan to invest in his farming, buying seeds and farming supplies such as urea, Matamonte (a herbicide), fertilizers and weedkillers, to keep his crops in good condition so that he can later sell them at a good price.

This loan will help German a lot as he will be able to invest in his farming and thereby increase his production.  The frequent challenges that he faces are competition, pests and crop diseases.  His dream for the next five years is to buy a house in which to live with his family and a car for transporting his produce.  

In his free time, German enjoys playing indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies such as urea, Matamonte (herbicide), fertilizers and weedkiller

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ocuituco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Ocuituco, está conformado por la señora Elena va a comprar con su crédito cremas, perfumes y cosméticos, la señora María va a comprar frijol, masa, maíz, leña, la señora Mónica va a comprar aceite, azúcar, huevo, crema, yogurt, veladoras, la señora Celia va a comprar cecina para surtir su negocio, la señora Ana Lilia va a comprar catálogos, de temporada y zapatos para surtir sus pedidos. La señora Mónica tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es comerciante ellos tiene 2 hijos 1 varón y 1 mujer los dos mayores de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar veladoras, refrescos, aguas, platos y vasos desechables, sabritas, bimbo, queso, jamón, salchichas, huevo, jabón, café, leches, sopas, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, con un dinero que tenia ahorrado su esposo y fue aprendiendo a trabajar en la tienda, su negocio es importante porque de ahí tiene dinero para algún imprevisto de enfermedad para la medicina y para el doctor, a ella le gusta despachar atender bien a sus clientes platicar con las señoras, su negocio le ha ayudado a su familia para la comida, ella está muy contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir es una ayuda para invertir en su negocio, para crecer la tienda y los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. Sus sueños y esperanzas son ser abuelitos, estar bien de salud, salir a pasear y que sus hijos se superen, que sean felices y tengan sus propias cosas. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos que nos hacen, es un apoyo muy grande que nos proporcionan porque si hay mucha necesidad y con su ayuda podemos salir adelante los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
This group is called “Ocuituco.” The members are Elena who will use the loan to buy creams, perfumes and cosmetics, María who will buy beans, tortilla dough, corn and firewood, Mónica who will buy oil, sugar, eggs, cream, yoghurt and votive candles, Celia who will buy dried meat to stock her store, Ana Lilia who will buy seasonal shoe catalogues to fill her orders.

Mónica is 42 years old, married to her husband who is a merchant and they have two adult children, a boy and a girl.  She has a grocery store and asked for the loan to buy votive candles, soft-drinks, water, disposable drinking glasses and plates, Sabritas brand snacks, Bimbo brand baked goods, cheese, ham, sausages, eggs, soap, coffee, milk and soup.  

She started the business ten years ago with some money her husband had saved up and she gradually learned how to manage the store.  Her business is important because she earns money from it to cover unexpected illnesses, for the money and for the doctor.  She likes tending well to her customers, to chat with the housewives.  Her business has helped her family to have food.  She is very happy with this loan she’s going to get because it’s a help to invest in her store, to make it grow and so that customers can find what they are looking for.

Her dreams and goals are to become grandparents, to be healthy, to go out traveling and that her children get ahead in life, are happy and that they have their own houses.

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “We thank you for the loans you give us; it’s a big support you provide because the need is great and with your help we can get ahead with our businesses and with our families.”

loans.use: to buy votive candles, soft-drinks, water, disposable drinking glasses and plates, Sabritas brand snacks and Bimbo baked goods.

loans.name: Carpo

texts.en:
Carpo is a 46-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He runs a machine repair shop. Carpo also hauls scrap materials to sell. Carpo earns 10,000 PHP per month from his business. He has requested this loan to buy vulcanizing gums, welding materials, and more scrap to recycle and sell.

In the future, Carpo hopes to expand his business and to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy vulcanizing gums, welding materials, and scrap materials to recycle and sell.

loans.name: Nehema Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nehema SHG Group in Western Kenya! Irene is the facilitator of the Nehema SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Irene takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Irene had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Irene was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irene and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Irene will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nehema SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 47-year-old woman from Madaba, Jordan and she is a mother of four children.

Fareeda is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase clothes to sell.

Fareeda is looking to open a shop for her business instead of working from home.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tieng

texts.en: Mrs. Tieng, 43, is a responsible mother of 5 children, living in Dongkor commune, a suburb area of Phnom Penh. She works for a garment factory as a sewing worker to generate income. She is paid monthly. Two of her daughters also work in the same factory. Tieng’s husband is motor-taxi service provider, who works honestly from dawn to dusk. His motorcycle is old, and it often breaks by accident while he’s providing his service. To solve the problem, Mrs. Tieng is asking for some funds from Kiva, through HKL to buy a new motorcycle for her husband. In the future, Mrs. Tieng aims to own a grocery shop in front of the garment factory and serve her meals to all garment factory workers.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan necesita el préstamo para comprar artículos eléctricos para  repararlo y así tener variedad de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes. 
Don Juan se dedica a la reparación y venta de artículos eléctricos desde hace mas de 15 años, cuenta con un local fijo, para realizar su actividad y además los fines de semana vende en diferentes partes de la ciudad,  con lo que solventa los gasto de su casa y gastos personales.
El señor Juan ha tenido cuatro créditos con KIVA los cuales ha pagado puntual y espera contar con su cooperación en este préstamo.
texts.en:
Juan needs the loan to buy electrical goods for repair, and so have a variety of merchandise to sell his customers.

Juan has been repairing and selling electrical goods for more than 15 years. 

He has a permanent shop where he carries on his business, and in addition, on the weekends he sells in different parts of the city. This how he covers his household and personal expenses.

Juan has had four loans with Kiva, which he paid off on time, and he hopes to have your cooperation in this loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah, 34 years old, is married and has three children aged 4, 8 and 12. He has been selling charcoal to earn a living for four years and employs one person. Noah's other source of income is farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Noah has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business to wholesale in the future. Noah has applied for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To  buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tolotea

texts.en:
Tolotea is thirty-five years of age and is married with four children.

Tolotea owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Tolotea needs a loan of WST 1,400 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tolotea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is Tolotea's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Reyder

texts.es:
Reyder es un hombre de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa, a quien ama y agradece todo su apoyo brindado, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Reyder no pudo estudiar para convertirse en Policía, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Tacacho para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Reyder trabaja como agente de seguridad en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y buen desempeño.
Reyder se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de madera, tubos y otros materiales de construcción, los cuales le servirán de mucho para construir un pequeño baño en su vivienda, de esta manera el y su familia podrán contar con los servicios higiénicos básicos, mejorando de esta manera su salud e higiene, así pues Reyder seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Reyder is a 27-year-old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife whom he loves, and he is grateful for all her support. He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Reyder was unable to study to become a police officer, but he would have liked to have done so very much. In his spare time, he likes to cook a rich Tacacho to enjoy with his family. 

On his own initiative, with a lot of resolve and dedication, Reyder works as a security agent for a company in his city. He works every day from the early hours of the morning and can work for approximately 8 hours. He feels comfortable doing his job and he believes that it is going well due to his responsibility and good performance. 

Reyder is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the provided assistance, he will be able to buy lumber, tubing, and other construction materials which will greatly help him to construct a small bathroom in his home. This way, he and his family will be able to have a basic hygienic bathroom, improving their health and hygiene. Therefore, Reyder will continue working and making an effort to get ahead and to achieve his greatest dream of having his own commercial business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Lourdes Yanette

texts.en:
My name is Lourdes Yannette. I have a cosmetics business. I have been doing this for several years and earn enough to cover my family\\\'s expenses including heath and education costs. Actually, I need to supply my business because during the Christmas season the volume of sales in increased.

Loan Use: Purchase lotion for men and women, shampoo, creams, lipstick, compacts, nail polish, deodorants, talcs and other supplies.

Mi Nombre el Lourdes yanette, cuento con un negocio de venta de Cosmeticos, los que distribuyo de manera ambulante, tengo varios años de dedicarmen a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares, educacion, salud y otros. actualmente necesto surtir mas mi negocio tomando en cuenta que ya se aproxima la Navidad, y el volumente de venta es mayor.

loans.use: compra de Lociones para dama y caballeros,champoo, cremas, lapiz labial, polvos compactos,delinadores, esmaltes de una, desodorantes, talcos   y otros.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Auntie Grace sells vegetables and other ingredients used in food preparation. She sells tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, salt, onions and cooking oil from palm fruit. She is unable to provide as much as her community demands because she has no money to buy the items from wholesalers. She is seeking a loan of $750 from Kiva to enable her buy enough items for sale.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Finny

texts.en:
Finny belongs to the Acholi tribe and works with the Charity for Peace Foundation, based in the Gulu District. She is a camp trainer focusing on savings and loans and psychosocial development. She trained as an accountant. She has three children, Oroma Brenda, Bedogwa Brian, and Oyella Sheila. Their father died in the war in northern Uganda.

All Finny's children go to primary school. She provides for her children by running a small shop and working part time with community organizations like CfP and Life in Africa. She loves her job as a trainer so much that it makes her forget her problems. When in the camp training the women, she loves sharing with them and helping them to cope with the prevailing situation, and she makes sure that happiness and love come first in her work. Life in Africa (LiA) is teaching Finny how to become an Internet4change agent who connects people to online loans.

Finny currently operates a small shop selling biscuits, detergents, packaged foodstuffs, and other items. She plans to use her loan to stock sodas, which she currently doesn't carry in her shop, and to rent a freezer to keep them cold. She also plans to hire someone at a salary of 50,000= a month to help her, because she's become so busy with her work in camps and LiA that it's hard to run the business alone. She currently earns 200,000 shillings per month from her business and expects that after this investment she will earn 300,000 shillings per month.

If offered the loan, she plans to repay it in 3 months.

Below is Finny's budget plan

10 crates................................97,000=
,br> 10 Empty crate deposit.....................80,000= Transport....................................5,000=
br> Freezer rental..............................15,000= Salary.......................................50,000= Others.........................................3,000= Total......................................250,000=

loans.use: Buying Sodas

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.en:
Maria del Rosario is married and has three children. Her husband works for a company but his salary is very low. In order to help with household expenses, Maria started her own business five years ago, selling paper and stationery. She started her business after the company she worked for closed. She received her severance payment and with this she bought merchandise and set up a room in her home to start selling. This way she is able to help pay for household expenses while taking care of her small children.

Maria is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise to increase the variety of her products. In addition she started to give handicrafts classes and she needs to set up a workshop. She commits to repay this amount in three months. Please be a part of the growth of this business. Maria and her family are very thankful of your trust and help.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria del Rosario es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, para poder ayudar con los gastos de su hogar Maria inició su propio negocio hace cinco años, donde vende papelería y mercería. Comenzó su negocio después de que cerró la empresa para la que laboraba, recibió su liquidación y con esto compró mercancía y acondicionó un lugar en su vivienda para iniciar con las ventas, de esta manera es como ayuda con los gastos de su hogar sin descuidar a sus pequeños hijos.

Ahora Maria esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar la variedad de sus productos, además ha iniciado a impartir clases de manualidades y necesita acondicionar un lugar de su negocio, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, Maria y su familia agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Phạm Thị Mỹ is 30 years old. She and her family live in Hưng Tây, in the province of Nghệ An. She and her husband have a rice husking business for retails. They also breed poultry and calves using the free land around their house. They have 3 young children and their dream is to be able to provide them a good education. This is the main motivation factor for Mrs Mỹ and her husband. They are requesting a loan of 625 USD which will be invested in the rice husking business and buy more breeding ducks.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Mỹ năm nay ngoài 30 tuổi. Chị cùng gia đình đang sinh sống tại xã Hưng Tây, Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Ngoài kinh doanh xay xát gạo, chị Mỹ và chồng vẫn chăn nuôi vịt và bò để tận dụng khoảng đất trống quanh nhà. Hiện gia đình chị có 3 đứa con nhỏ nên với nguyện vọng cho lo cho các con đầy đủ, vợ chồng chị lúc nào cũng chăm chỉ làm ăn. Xin vay mức 625 USD, anh chị đã thống nhất đầu tư một phần vào việc xay xát gạo tại nhà, một phần dùng để mua vịt chăn nuôi.

loans.use: buy rough rice, husked and sell it

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Fifty years old Angélica has five children, but only two are her dependants. She lives in Poblado Menor de Piscopampa in the Mache district of the Otuzco province in the La Libertad region. Through a partner, she became a member of the Communal Bank “Buen Pastor” of the Manuela Ramos Movement. With her first loan of 300 soles she purchased cereals (wheat, barley, lupin beans, etc.) and with subsequent loans she bought small animals.

She started her business distributing her products among her friends and acquaintances. She was always on the outlook for contacts to increase her clientele and now she sells in Piscopampa, Mache, Julcán and to some Trujillo merchants that go to her community to purchase goods.

The loans are of great help, as they allow her to lead a better life a little better and give her the opportunity to dedicate herself to an activity instead of being a slave of her household. With the recent loan obtained from Manuela Ramos, of approximately $667 and which will be repaid in six months, she will buy cereals, animals and also scrap bronze.

Not having the support of her parents, Ms. Angélica couldn’t finish her studies and was only able to reach fifth grade. She dreams of buying a load cart to be able to distribute her products satisfactorily.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos pero sólo 2 dependen de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor de Piscopampa en el Distrito de Mache de la Provincia de Otuzco Departamento de La Libertad. Por medio de una socia se pudo integrar al Banco Comunal “Buen Pastor” del Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Con el primer préstamo recibido de S/.300 soles compró cereales (trigo, cebada, chochos, etc.) y posteriormente con los otros préstamos compró animales menores.

Empezó su negocio distribuyendo sus productos entre sus amistades y a personas que conocía por medio de sus familiares. Buscaba siempre contactos para aumentar sus clientes y ahora vende en Piscopampa, Mache, Julcán y a algunos comerciantes de Trujillo que van a comprar a su comunidad.

Los préstamos le son de mucha ayuda, ya que puede vivir un poco mejor y tiene la oportunidad de dedicarse a algo y no estar esclavizada a su hogar. Con su reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 ($667 aprox.) y que será cancelado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará cereales, animales y también bronce (chatarra).

La señora Angélica no pudo concluir sus estudios porque no tuvo apoyo de sus padres, y sólo estudió hasta quinto grado de primaria. Sueña con comprar un carro de carga para poder distribuir satisfactoriamente sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals, small animals and scrap bronze.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Ngân is 30 years old. She joined TYM fund when her first child was 3. Her family living condition was very difficult at that time. She contracted a loan of 125 usd from TYM which was invested pig breeding . She has made some money, this has helped her cover the family living expenses. After 3 years, she had switched from pig breeding to selling pork: she has a butcher stand at the market. She buys pork from the butchery in her hamlet or from one of her relatives. She makes about 5 usd a day which is enough to raise her 2 children and put them to school. She's requesting a loan of 625 usd to expand her butcher stand, offering more selection to her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngân, 30 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ khi đứa con đầu mới lên 3 tuổi. Hoàn cảnh gia đình lúc đó hết sức khó khăn, chị Ngân xin vay 125USD đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Kết quả thu nhập từ vòng vốn đầu tiên giúp chị có thể trang trải một phần những chi phí trong gia đình. Từ năm thứ 3 chị đã chuyển sang kinh doanh buôn bán thịt lợn. Nguồn hàng được lấy từ trong xóm hoặc ngay trong gia đình. Mức thu nhập 5USD/ngày hiện nay đủ để chị Ngân nuôi 2 con ăn học đầy đủ. Dự tính chị sẽ xin vay 625USD để tăng thêm lượng hàng bán ra hàng ngày.

loans.use: Buy pork

loans.name: Aap

texts.en: Aap is 36 years old and is married.  She has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things.  She is able to earn $44.50 per month due to the large variety of goods she has in stock.  Aap is requesting a IDR 800,000 (USD $100) loan to fill her shop.  Her husband, A., has no fixed income so she has to work hard for her children's education.  She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Dinora

texts.es:
La actividad de la señora Dinora C. se refiere a la venta de ropa (especialmente ropa interior para dama y caballero) desde hace 20 años en el mercado Central de Chinandega.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en lo interno del mercado en uno de los tramos que por cierto necesita remodelación.

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero otorgándole créditos que los ha sabido utilizar debido a que ha mejorado sus ventas por haber adquirido mayores volúmenes de ropa ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar de habitación. Su mayor necesidad es la adquisición de sus productos y para ello confía en que Ceprodel le apoyará con su necesidad.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

loans.name: Mbonjum

texts.en:
J. is married and has seven children. Unable to meet his family's needs as result of political instability which led to the destruction of his business, and the theft of pigs from his farm, he decided to join GHAPE in 2005.

Given a loan, he plans to rear pigs and fowl on a larger and more profitable scale. He thinks his business will succeed because he is committed and has a large market locally. His community stands a chance of benefiting from his activity as gardeners will have enough manure from his animal farm, thereby increasing their productivity. The profit he gets from the loan shall be used to pay tuition fees for his children and grand children.

He plans to repay the loan in 18 months.

loans.use: Growing and selling of pigs and fowl

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a new freezer for his ice cream business
