loans.name: Halima's Songambele Ukonga B Group

texts.en:
Halima, age 47, married with three children, has a clothing business which she started in 2003. Working from 2 p.m. until 6 p.m. daily, she makes a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Halima took three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to pay for family needs such as school fees and clothing. Having repaid these loans, she now hopes for a new one to purchase more clothing to sell and to pay her children's school fees. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members have businesses dealing in fish, milk, clothing, and general item sales.

In the picture, Halima is at the center.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell and to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 54 years old and a divorced mother with 1 child. She has been selling household cooking wares for the past 8 years by hawking. Currently she wants to add traveling bags and ladies’ hang bags to enable her to increase her income to take care of her child. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags, saucepans, and plastic containers to increase inventory. She is a member of the group called Bethel. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans, bags, and plastic ice containers

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad, 49,  is married and has 3 children. He lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut and he is an auto body painter. He needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,000 to purchase auto body painting inventory. Mohamad has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 6 years and always repays his debts on time. He is a very responsible man whose priority in life is his family.

loans.use: to purchase auto body painting inventory

loans.name: Rokamdin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rokamdin, which means in Temne: "we are all members of the same family." Its members include Isatu K., Pa Molai S. and Sema S.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,100,000.

Their leader is Isatu K.. She is 41. She was born in Gbengbedu N'guwawu, one of the surrounding villages of Makeni. She is married with 7 children. Isatu sells condiments at the Makeni town main lorry park. She now has more than 10 years of experience in the business. She has repaid her previous loan successfully. She is now asking for a new loan. With a new loan, she is expecting to increase the quantity of items in her stall.

loans.use: Expand her business.

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
Facunda Pérez was born in Luque city. She has lived with Aristides Duarte for more than 16 years. They have a son named Rodrigo with whom she works selling cow’s milk within the Yka neighborhood of Luque city.

She began this activity through the group Mujeres Emprendedoras (Entrepreneurial Women) and then acquired the individual financing for her great business plan.

Today her business has grown a lot and the client list who daily receives their product has grown. Many wish to have delivery to their home which is why Facunda wants to acquire a small truck. The loan will be used to help her acquire a vehicle to be able to deliver to more places and more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Facunda Pérez nació en la ciudad de Luque, vive con Aristides Duarte desde hace más de dieciséis años. Tiene un hijo llamado Rodrigo con quien trabaja en la venta de leche de vaca dentro del asentamiento de Yka á de la ciudad de Luque.

Se inició en dicha actividad a través de un grupo de Mujeres Emprendedoras para luego acceder al financiamiento individual por su gran desempeño.

Hoy día su negocio ha crecido bastante y la lista de clientes que día a día adquiere su producto ha aumentado. Muchos desean que se haga un reparto del mismo a domicilio por lo que Facunda desea adquirir una camioneta. El crédito la ayudará a adquirir el vehiculo y con el podrá llegar a mas lugares y clientes.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to sell and deliver milk

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.en: Luciana is the representative of the group "Jehova Es Mi Pastor." This group consists of 10 very ambitious people. Luciana is an extremely determined mother of four young children, all under the age of 11. Luciana is hoping to start a small business selling clothing! She wants to have her own clothing store, and she dreams of having a thriving business so she can better the lives of her children! On behalf of Luciana, the group, and Esperanza International--- We thank you for you support!

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Christine Nalugo's Group

texts.en:
Christine is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 22 years old and married with one child aged 3 years. Her child goes to school. She resides and rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people, and doesn't take care of any additional family members. There is no electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Christine deals in new shoes and operates from Owino park yard, one of the busiest markets in Kampala. Christine buys from supplying shops within Kampala city. She uses public transport from Owino to her home. Christine sells to an average of 5 people a day, selling to men only, and works six days a week. Christine's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises at 30,000/=, accommodation at 25,000/= , food and medication. Christine has been in this business for 2 years. Christine first dealt in second hand shirts and then shifted to men's shoes.

Christine has been with MCDT for 1 1/2 years and is serving her sixth loan. She wants to boost her business and aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can start to sell wholesale and rent a shop.

loans.use: To boost her shoe sale business

loans.name: Sonakhanim

texts.en: Sonakhanim D. lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She is a widow, a kind woman, with two (2) children. She was born in 1966. Sonakhanim is in the business of selling souvenirs and table ware. She is requesting a loan for 970 AZN to purchase supplies of souvenirs and table ware.

loans.use: Purchase souvenirs and table ware

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Se dedica a vender quesos y papas, distribuye en las tiendas al crédito, para luego cobrarles después D. su venta, esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 6 años, y así cubre gran parte D. los gastos dentro D. su hogar. Para María no es complicado su trabajo, por lo contrario es muy tranquilo, ya que distribuye quincenalmente, lo que más le agrada es elaborar estos riquísimos quesos, además le es rentable porque es la única persona que por años ha abastecido a las tiendas D. su zona con estos productos. Lo difícil es trasladar estos productos, y sobre todo ofertar cuando son tiendas nuevas donD. no la conocen. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. María está dispuesta ha abastecer a mayor cantidad D. tiendas, para ello pensó en comprar y vender quesos muy aparte D. los que ella elabora, para satisfacer los pedidos e incrementarlos.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and lives with her husband and their three children. She sells cheese and potatoes, which she distributes to stores to sell. She collects the money after her products are sold. She has been doing this for 6 years and this pays for a large part of her household expenses. Maria doesn't consider her job to be complicated, rather it is very peaceful. She takes her products to the stores every 15 days. What she likes best about her job is making delicious cheeses and this is profitable because she is the only person who supplies the stores in her region with these products. The most difficult parts of her job are transferring the products and supplying products to new stores that do not know her. This is her first loan with MFP. Maria is ready to distribute her products to more stores and in order to do this she would like to buy and sell other cheeses besides the ones that she makes. This will help her fill the orders she has and increase orders in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese and supplies for cheese making

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut K., 42, pictured with her husband above, is married and lives in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer who typically makes about US$ 2 a day. She grows rice two times a year. Her husband works collecting palm juice and refines it into sugar palm. On average, he makes US$ 3 a day. This couple together has four children, three of whom are students. One is too young to attend school.

Mrs. Mut K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 700 to purchase wood and more tools for her husband so he can make more sugar palm.

loans.use: To purchase wood and more tools for palm juice tapping

loans.name: Proeung

texts.en: Proeung R., 50, is a weaver who lives with her husband in Bati district, Takeo province. She typically makes $2 of profit per day, while her husband is a construction foreman in the village, making about $5 each day. The couple has four children, two who are in school and two others who are construction workers. Mrs. Proeung is requesting a loan to purchase more silk to expand her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
El señor Venancio tiene42 años esta casado con la señora Virginia de  37 años tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en el colegio.

Cuando se conocieron el señor era empleado y la señora también.  Adquirió la profesión de pintor de autos(chapista). Con los ahorros abrieron para su  pequeño taller, que actualmente cuenta con varios clientes, a su señora le  abrió una pequeña despensa para tener mas ingresos.

Quiere ampliar su  despensa ya que cuenta con varios clientes ya formados en su mayoría vecinos.
Le gustaría que en el futuro sus hijos se reciban y que sean grandes profesionales ya que ellos no tuvieron la posibilidad de terminar ni siquiera la secundaria.
texts.en:
Mr. Venancio is 42 years old and is married to Mrs. Virginia, who is 37 years old. They have 2 children that are in high school. When they met, both Mr. Venancio and Mrs. Virginia were employed. He learned to be a metal worker. With their savings, they opened their small workshop, which, at present, has many clients. For his wife, Mr. Venancio opened a small store so that they can earn more income. They want their store to grow since they have many clients already, most of whom are their neighbors. In the future, he would like his children to graduate and became important professionals since he and his wife didn’t have the opportunity to finish secondary school.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, sodas, cookies, and other merchandise

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Santa Rosa D. Lima",  presentan  como nexo consanguíneo la señora Nivery Nagako   y la  señora Maria Abigail son hermanas, pero tienen sus ingresos totalmente independientes. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas hacen pan para vender y son promotoras D. cosméticos, otras  se dedican a la confección D. prendas D. vestir, a la  elaboración D. muebles D. madera y a la venta D. comida. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero saben como salir adelante gracias a su entusiasmo y experiencia. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para la compra D. materiales e insumos para mejorar la calidad  D. los mismos para poder hacer frente a la competencia. Efectivamente las socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios ya que se encuentran cursando su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución demostrando honestidad y responsabilidad con sus pagos y fidelidad con su grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the Santa Rosas D. Lima Communal Bank present as a familial nexus Mrs. Nivery Nagako and Mrs. Maria Abigail. They're sisters, but their earnings are totally independent. The members of this bank carry out different activities: some make and sell bread, promote cosmetics, and make clothing. Others build wooden furniture and sell food. As in all commercial pursuits, there's always competition of supply and demand, but these partners know how to get ahead thanks to their enthusiasm and experience.

This loan will help them diversify their products and to purchase the supplies and materials needed to improve these products in order to better compete. These partners have experience in solidarity groups and are now in their second cycle with our institution, demonstrating honesty and responsibility with their payments and fidelity within their group.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Azizahon

texts.ru: Азизахон замужем, ей 32 года, имеет 2 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Азизахон стала заниматься бизнесом уже несколько лет назад. Она любит свое занятие, так как это помогает ей содержать ее семью. Это очень дружная семья и каждые 2-3 дня Азизахон и ее дети разговаривают со своим отцом в России по телефону. На займ который Азизахон собирается получить она хочет расширить свой бизнес и приобрести новый ассортимент одежды.
texts.en:
Azizahon is married, she is 32 years old and has two children. Her husband is a laborer in Russia. Azizahon started her business several years ago. She loves what she does because this helps her to sustain her family. They are a very close family and every two or three days Azizahon and her children talk on the phone with their father in Russia. Azizahon will use the loan to expand her business and purchase a new assortment of clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa has been a fish and khanga (a brightly colored piece of cloth that many East African women wear) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Hakika group loan (Group code 2029). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. She works at her business for 8 hours every day.

Mauwa is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Mauwa is 24 years old, divorced, and has three children: ages 4, 2 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more fish and khanga to sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime E. is managing a small parcel of land. He is 38 years old and has 4 children. He has been a farmer since he was just a small kid. His parents taught him everything how to farm. Jaime is a tenant. He has been tilling the land for 16 years.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase 20 liters of crude oil to run farm machinery and to pay for the labor. The loan will help a lot to grow his business.

CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 20 liters of crude oil and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a retailer of charcoal and vegetables in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Bertha obtains her supply of charcoal from the village of Kasoa and sells it to her customers.

Bertha is 44 years old and married with five children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking and resourceful mother. She wants to use this loan to buy charcoal and vegetables in bulk. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the "Odo ye De" (Love is Sweet) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal and vegetables

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es: Aldo tiene 24 años, es conocido por su nobleza y su buen trato para con sus vecinos, vive con la madre de sus 3 hijos en la casa de madera que el mismo la fabricó. De niño su padre le tenía mucha confianza en los trabajos agrícolas, puesto que demostraba mucha responsabilidad en cada una de las labores encomendadas. Y ahora que lidera su propia familia trabaja con mucho ahínco en cada uno de sus cultivos y más aun en los trabajos jornaleros que realiza donde le pagan 15 soles diarios, dinero que utiliza para cubrir los gastos de su hogar mientras espera que sus chacras se carguen de fruto en forma uniforme y de ese modo sus cosechas le generan muy buenas ganancias. Durante estos años Aldo ha ganado experiencia en el manejo adecuado de cada planta, por ello se muestra muy contento con sus labores, debido a ello se propone ir incrementando sus terrenos, con el anhelo de aumentar sus siembras para que cuando crezcan sus hijos, les brinde las comodidades necesarias y puedan tener estudios superiores, que es lo que anhela como padre. En los ciclos anteriores su esposa era la socia titular de su banco comunal, pero en vista de que Aldo es muy activo, sus compañeros le han propuesto que él fuera el socio titular, por lo que ahora se compromete seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos y de asistir a todas las reuniones de mes del grupo. El dinero solicitado lo va a invertir en la compra de nitrato y urea (abonos) para proceder al abonado de sus plantas cafetaleras y tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Aldo is 24 years old and known as a noble person who treats his neighbors well. He lives with his partner and three children in a house that he built out of wood. Since he was young, Aldo's father has been confident in his son's farming work, given that he demonstrates responsibility in all of his tasks. Now that he is the head of his own family, Aldo works eagerly on each of his crops. He works even harder as a day laborer, where he earns 15 soles per day, which he uses to cover household expenses while he waits for his fields to bear fruit. In this way Aldo's harvests produce very good earnings. Throughout these years Aldo has accumulated experience in the proper management of each crop, and as a result he is happy with his work. Thanks to his efforts he'd like to incrementally increase his lands, with the desire to plant more so that when his children grow up he can provide for them. He'd like his children to attend University. In previous loan cycles Aldo's wife was the title holder in the community bank, but because Aldo is very active his colleagues have asked him to be the title holder in this cycle. As such, he'll attend monthly meetings with the group. The money will be invested in nitrate fertilizer to fertilize his coffee plans and have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Awusi

texts.en:
Awusi is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Through her business, she has supported two of her children to finish junior high school and the others are currently in school. Awusi lives with her husband who is a trader. She is a food vendor and has been selling kenkey as well as maize for fifteen years now.

Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education.

loans.use: For raw materials and firewood

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita R. is from the village of Clarin. She is 62 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Warlita owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Warlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Las Apuraditas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Apuraditas” esta dirigida por  el señor Silvestre y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales se dedica a diferentes actividades entre ellas a la venta D. comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, a la atención en puntos Viva, a la zapatería, chaparía y a la pintura D. interiores D. casas, fumigador D. plagas. A pesar D. la competencia en el mercado los miembros del grupo conocen su negocio y saben como salir adelante ya que D. ello depenD. el ingreso diario que representa el sustento para sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadera, insumos para sus negocios y herramientas D. trabajo. Las socias trabajaron con anterioridad en grupos solidarios por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The group “Las Apuraditas” is led by Sr. Silvestre and is composed of 14 members who are engaged in different businesses such as food sales, cosmetics sales, neighborhood grocery stores, calling services through Viva telecommunications, shoe sales, auto body repair, house painting, and pest control. Despite the competition in the marketplace, the members know how to succeed in their businesses because their families’ incomes are dependent on them.

They will use their loans to acquire merchandise, business supplies, and tools for their work. The members have previously worked in solidarity groups and know how they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is applying for a loan amounting to PHP5, 000 as additional business capital from Kiva lenders.  The loan will be used to improve her general store business by purchasing additional merchandise.  She is 52 years old, married to Domingo, a farmer in their village. The couple were blessed with five children: Heidy, Mary Ann, Loida, Margie, and their youngest is Dennis. Their family is currently living in the simple village of Cutog Grande in Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Felicidad is hoping that her store will improve to gain higher income so that somehow, her family will be free from the hardship of life.  She is hoping that Kiva lenders will approve her requested loan.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: La señora Anita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las mercedes II”,  Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es casada, tiene 42 años tiene 02 hijas mujeres que están en estudios superiores.Su espíritu alegre y su anhelo de ver profesionales a sus hijas, le motivaron a buscar alternativas de generar fuentes de ingresos y gracias a su cualidad de ser una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora le ayudaron a iniciarse en la venta de chupetes a través de jóvenes que le facilitan la labor, le esta yendo muy bien y poco a poco ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad ella abastece a  04 personas, que le compran en cantidad de manera constante, por que ven que el producto que ella ofrece tiene muy buena acogida y sobretodo son atendidos con amabilidad que es lo que a ella le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará ingredientes para la preparación de su producto como azúcar en saco,  cajas de leche, 04 cajas de tecnoport para venta de chupetes, bolsas y vasos en cientos y frutas que a diario necesita para la preparación de los chupetes, quiere tener surtido su negocio, para así poder captar una mayor clientela. Anita, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará ingredientes, para preparar su producto.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es: Sheila es una mujer jovial y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa provincia de Coronel Portillo, tiene 32 años  y es madre de dos menores de edad, cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de yogurt  y golosinas, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan en repartir sus productos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” desde hace ocho años. Su primer préstamo fue de 300 soles que invirtió en gaseosas, en la actualidad necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles que será invertido en golosinas. La meta de Sheyla es tener una distribuidora de productos de golosinas.
texts.en:
Sheila is a cheerful woman who likes to work with others. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Coronel Portillo province. She is a 32-year-old mother of 2 underage children. She has their father’s support. She sells yogurts and snacks for a living. She has two staff members who help her distribute her products. She has been a member of the “Bellavista” Microfinance Institute for eight years. She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan in purchasing soft drinks. She currently needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan to invest in purchasing snacks. Sheyla’s goal is to be a snack supplier.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase snacks

loans.name: Karen Vanessa

texts.es: La señora Karen Vanessa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Rosales”, Distrito de San José de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 20 años y 01 pequeño hijo, que aun dependen de ella.Karen Vanessa, es una mujer que ha a su edad, ha logrado salir adelante. Karen, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de las diferentes líneas como: Esika, CyZone y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.Karen Vanessa, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karen Vanessa belongs to the “Los Rosales” community bank, located in the San José de Sisa district, province of Dorado, department of San Martín. She’s married, 20 years old and has a small dependent child. For a woman her age, Karen Vanessa has been successful. Karen sells cosmetics from different brands including Esika, CyZone and Avon and continues to do so now. With this loan of S/. 500.00, she will buy beauty products for her inventory including perfumes for women and men, creams, pressed powder compacts, lip pencils, nail polish as well as another display case to present her products. Karen Vanessa is an example for other women to follow to see how to start a business and persevere in order to pursue one’s dreams. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her own business and helping other women grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children, the oldest being 6 years old. Abigail owns a general store. She dreams of growing her business because that is where she gets her income. She works hard to give her children proper education.

A new member of CEVI, Abigail can now take advantage of its financial services. She is requesting a loan of Php8,000. With this loan, she will be able to purchase additional goods for her store.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for her store

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Seth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who are all living in Lvea Sa Kraom village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Sokhom S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Sokhom S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows vegetables. Now she wants to grow beans on her field but she does not have enough money to pay for them. Thus, she decided to request for a loan to buy bean seeds and she will use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Sokhom S. is also a teacher in the local school. She is 55 years old and is a widow with a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds and to hire laborers to work on her field

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.en: The committee 'United Women' was formed by women who all live and work in the same neighborhood. All women have their own independent businesses and use their loans to help continue growing them. The group is very solid and organized. All committee members are mothers, whose goal is to strengthen their income and help their families and children. They also focus on sustainable development of their businesses and hope to continue growing through taking out small loans.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new tires

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is a very hard-working woman. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria, with her family. She is married to a civil servant. Iyabo is 35 years old and has 3 children; the eldest is about 13 years old and they are all doing well.

Iyabo sells children's clothes, bags and shoes. She has been in this business for over 10 years and with LAPO Microfinance for 2 years. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Iyabo is requesting a loan of 70,000 to purchase more clothes, bags and shoes to sell in order to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags and children's wear to sell

loans.name: Ffena Tugagawale Group 1, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Kanaabi is 40 years old and a single mother with six children, four of whom are still in school. 

N. has been running a business of selling produce, mostly matooke (steamed green plantain), from Kame Valley for 25 years. Ever since she started using loans in her business, she is able to make about $208 a week in profits. 

She is thankful to her creditors because she is able to have enough stock on hand for her customers all the time, hence making more sales and more money. She hopes to expand her business further by offering additional products.  

With this loan that N. is seeking, she hopes to restock her business with more matooke, as well as to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale and paying school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamd is 23 years old, single and lives with his mother and sister. He went into business seven years ago, when his father died and he became his family's sole means of support. He bought a compressor and started a company that prepares building sites for construction crews to work on. He has applied for a loan for $1,200 to buy a car in which to transport items, because this will mean a big increase in his productivity.

loans.use: to increase the productivity of his business by buying a car

loans.name: Sigifredo

texts.es:
Sigifredo M. M., tiene la edad de 74 años, está soltero, y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono, fertilizantes, cal y herbicidas, para darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café, y así lograr una mejor calidad y obtener un mayor ingreso cuando sea tiempo de la cosecha. El tiene sembrada una hectárea de café.No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Sigifredo tiene más de 25 años de trabajar en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Sigifredo M. M., 74, is single and living alone. He needs this loan to improve his farm, specifically to grow coffee beans. He plans to purchase soil amendments, fertilizer, lime and herbicides for the optimal cultivation of the coffee plants for better quality and higher income at harvest time. He has planted one hectare with coffee. This is not his first loan through FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services provided. Don Sigifredo has worked in agriculture for more than 25 years. He hopes in the future to improve his quality of life and have greater economic stability, to keep growing both as a person and as a provider.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for coffee agriculture

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 35 years old and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Since 2000, he has owned a bakery from which he sells mankoucheh, a food that looks like a folded pizza. The most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese), and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.
Ahmad is successful in his work because he is known for his good and tasty mankoucheh. His customers are his friends and neighbors. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. Rashid decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, he plans on expanding his bakery.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell pagnes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: M. Catherine est mariée à TOSSAVI Romain, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, deux restent à la charge de Catherine  et de son mari. Catherine vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Catherine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille, Catherine vend des bambous à Agla. Catherine s’approvisionne à Dogbo et à Adja au Mono. Catherine a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Catherine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits et accroître sa clientèle, afin de se faire plus de revenus. C’est pour cette raison que Catherine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Catherine M. is married to Romain Tossavi and is the mother of three children; all of her children attend school. Catherine and her husband still have two of their children at home. Catherine lives with her children and husband in the neighborhood of Agla in Cotonou, the financial capital of Benin. The couple takes care of the family's various needs. Catherine never attended school. In order to take care of her needs and contribute to her family's expenses, Catherine sells bamboo in Agla. She supplies herself in Dogbo and Adja au Mono. Catherine has received two previous loans from ALIDé, both of the loans were fully repaid. She would like to increase the stock of her products and grow her clientele, and therefore earn more money. It is for this reason that Catherine is requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bamboo

loans.name: Cruz Del Pilar

texts.es:
Doña Cruz del Pilar es una mujer activa, de edad de 55 años, durantes estos años logro tener su propio negocio, una sastrería el cual aprendió el oficio junto a su esposo ya que era sastre.  Ha sido su fuente de trabajo en donde han apoyado a sus cinco hijos. Han logrado captar clientes ya que hacen una variedad de costura, hacen uniformes a empresas, ropa de colegio, vestidos y lo que le soliciten ya que se han perfeccionado con la experiencia. 

Este préstamo quiere invertir en telas variadas como: ciento ochenta yardas de casimir para traje, treinta yardas de seda y tela tica para poder cumplir con la demanda. Mediante estos financiamientos ha logrado equilibrar su negocio ya que por temporada bajan los pedidos pero no se deja de vender. Sus planes es lograr alcanzar el crecimiento y mejoramiento de recursos. Todo esto con el objetivo de vender más a sus proveedores y tener ganancias mejores.
texts.en:
Cruz del Pilar is an active, 55-year-old woman. During these years she was able to have her own business, a tailor’s shop in which she learned the trade together with her husband, since he was a tailor. It has been their source of work in which they have supported their five children. They have been able to attract customers since they do a variety of sewing – they make company uniforms, school clothing, dresses, and what they are asked, since they have perfected with the experience.

She wants to invest this loan in a variety of fabrics such as: 180 yards of cashmere for suits, 30 yards of silk and Costa Rican fabric to be able to meet demand. Through these funds she has been able to balance her business since the requests go down by season but they don’t stop selling. Her plan is to be able to achieve growth and improvement of resources. All of this is with the objective of selling more to her suppliers and having better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fabrics to make different style suits.

loans.name: John  Yator

texts.en:
John is a 28-year-old, single man. He is a maize farmer who began farming three years ago. John’s farm is near the road, which makes it easily accessible, and on fertile land. His clients are residents of Kaptallam in Kabernet. The crop gives him a monthly profit of Kshs 1,200. He also keeps livestock from which he gets additional income.

He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 10,000 from KADET. A friend who is a KADET client introduced him to this organization. This is the first financial institution from which John has ever borrowed a loan. He will use this loan to purchase maize seeds and other farm inputs. 
 
If this loan boosts his business he will use the extra profit to improve his living standard. He dreams and hopes to be a famous farmer within his community. He aims to achieve this by having a big farm. John describes himself as a staunch Christian who is humble, hardworking, and ready to face any challenge in order to be successful.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 27, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is a worker at a shoe factory for an income of about $1.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to open a grocery store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. is pictured with her family.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: La Pinada De Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Grupos Solidario La Pinada de Santa Lucia
La señora Nicolasa Álvarez es la representante de este Grupo, el negocio que ella tiene desde màs de año y medio es una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite, sal, huevos, gaseosas, golosinas, además también tiene una venta de tortillas , ella es muy dinámica y trabajadora por eso es muy  conocida en el lugar donde vive, y esos le ayuda ya que  sus clientes  saben dónde buscarla y es por eso que ha tratado de hacer crecer su negocio, y conforme sus clientes le piden nuevas cosas ellas trata de tenerlos para poder quedar bien con ellos, por ejemplo además  vende regalos para diferentes ocasiones ya que las personas se los pedían, ella ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable ya que en el tiempo que FAPE le ha brindado crédito ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, ella dice estar muy contenta porque tiene muchos planes que quiere lograr es por eso que solicita este crédito para invertir en su negocio.  Doña Marìa Eduarda Garcìa quien es otro miembro del grupo tiene su venta de tortillas, huevos, salchichas, longanizas, tomate y otros productos que le solicitan sus clientes, ella tiene 5 niños y ella nos cuenta cómo es que está animada en querer hacer crecer su negocio para que pueda ayudar junto con su esposo a poder darles una educación a sus hijos ya que todos van a la escuela, ha sido una mujer emprendedora y responsable, ya que como ella dice siempre debe dejar bien su nombre porque también es un ejemplo para sus hijos, y doña Beronica T. es la tercer miembro del grupo, ella cuenta con una venta de regalos, cosméticos, zapatos, ropa para bebè y una diversidad de detalles que sus clientes le piden, ella cuenta que ha estado luchando por cuatro años en este negocio y se ve como poco a poco va mejorando, es una persona muy servicial y ella dice que quiere quiere tener otra sucursal de su negocio en algún punto màs central del pueblo donde vive, actualmente tiene 2 niños y dice que sus sueños son poder darles a ellos una buena educación y mejorar la oportunidad para ellos.  Las miembros de este grupo sin lugar a dudad son mujeres trabajadoras que saben lo que quieren y diariamente demuestran con su trabajo que cuando se quiere se pueden lograr las cosas, ella sin lugar a duda tienen muchos planes para este capital que solicitan a KIVA.
texts.en:
The La Pinada de Santa Lucia Group Nicolasa A. is the group's representative. For more than a year and a half she has run a store where she sells basic products such as sugar, oil, salt, eggs, soft drinks and candy. She also sells tortillas. She is very dynamic and hard-working and because of this she is well-known in her neighbourhood. This is helpful, since her customers know where to find her. She is trying to expand her business, and when her customers request new items she tries to get them to satisfy her customers. For example, she also sells gifts for different occasions as they are requested. She has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible woman, as she has been very punctual with her payments during her time with FAPE. She says she is very happy because she has many plans that she wants to achieve, so she is requesting this loan to invest in her business. Maria Eduarda Garcia, another group member, sells tortillas, eggs, sausages, spicy pork sausages, tomatoes and other products that her customers request. She has five children and tells us how she is working hard to expand her business in order to, along with her husband, offer her children an education; they all go to school. She has always been an enterprising and responsible woman, as she always says that she has to make a good name for herself because it is an example for her children. Beronica T. is the third group member. She sells gifts, cosmetics, shoes, baby clothing and a variety of items that her customers request. She says that she has been working hard in this business for four years and sees how, little by little, it is improving. She is a very obliging person and says that she wants to have another branch of her business in a more central area of her village. She has two children and says that her dream is to give them a good education and to improve their opportunities. These group members are, beyond a shadow of a doubt, hard-working women who know what they want and daily demonstrate with their work that when you want to, you can achieve things. Without a doubt they have many plans for this loan they are requesting from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investing in their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To supply their business's with added merchandise

loans.name: Elsie Gallardo Group

texts.en:
Elsie G. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Elsie is the group leader of a two member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elsie is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns a business venture in the food sector making and selling food consisting primarily  of delicacies.  Elsie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, Reside en el municipio de Santa Elena, Departamento de Usulután, es casada tiene una hija de dos años de edad, vende productos de primera necesidad (Tienda).
El negoció está ubicado en la casa de habitación, atiende l negocio en un horario de 6:00am- 8:00pm tiene dos años de experiencia con el negocio, ella necesita un préstamo para compra de productos como son: Aceite, frijoles, azúcar, Jabón para baño, papel higiénico, jabón para lavar, gaseosa y embutidos. Esto contribuirá a mejora el negocio, atraer clientes, generar ingresos para cubrir necesidades básicas.
Los sueños de Rosa son tener un negocio grande, atraer clientes, continuar con el espíritu emprendedor para mejora las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old. She lives in the municipality of Santa Elena, in the Department of Usulután. She is married and has a two-year-old daughter. Her work is selling basic necessities (general store). Her business is located in the home where she lives. She operates her store from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm. She has two years of experience with the business. She needs a loan to buy products such as cooking oil, beans, sugar, bath soap, toilet paper, washing soap, soft drinks, lunch meats and sausages. This will help her improve her business, attract customers and generate income to cover her basic needs. Rosa's dreams are to have a large business, attact customers, and continue in an entrepreneurial spirit to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cooking oil, beans, sugar, bath soap, toilet paper, washing soap, soft drinks, lunch meats and sausages

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Norah has a bar business, which she has had for 4 years.    

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more drinks like beer.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Norah hopes to generate greater profits to buy food and educate her children.  In the future, Norah hopes to own a house and to see her children go up to university.  

<b>Note to Lenders:<b/>
BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive microfinance loans to expand their small businesses.

These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional microfinance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans to give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in microfinance.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like beer

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la imagen es la esposa.
El señor  Omar G. se dedica  a la  albañilería desde hace 30 años y solicita préstamo para construir un techo al frente de su casa; el comenta que en temporadas de intensas lluvias el agua entra a su vivienda, lo cual ocasiona que algunas de sus cosas materiales se mojen. Para que su casa quede cubierta el necesita comprar el material ya que por su larga experiencia en la albañilería el solo lo podría hacer.
texts.en:
The person in the photo is the borrower’s wife. Mr. Omar G. has been a bricklayer for 30 years. He is asking for a loan to build a roof on the front of his house. He comments that during seasons of heavy rainfall water comes into his house which causes some of his belongings to get wet. So that his house will be completely roofed he just needs to buy the materials since his long experience as a bricklayer will allow him to do the labor himself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on the front part of his house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita C. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari (general) store, a food vending business and a transportation (tricycle) business. She lives in Prk. Mahogany, Brgy Magsaysay, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard at her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $95. Teresita is now borrowing 19,000 PHP so that she can purchase more inventory to sell in her general store and at the same time to fully pay the balance on her motorcycle with sidecar that shuttles passengers in their area for a fee. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
 
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, D. 53 años, es una mujer alegre y fuerte, está casada con Nicanor, D. 52 años, ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 D. ellos, Madai D. 18 y Vian D. 7 años, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la selva central (Yurinaki). DesD. que era niña se dedicó a la agricultura, “el campo es mi vida”, afirma. En esos tiempos ayudaba a labrar la tierra, pero cuando era joven ahorro lo suficiente y a los 19 años compró su propio terreno D. cultivo. DesD. entonces se dedica a la siembra D. café, plátano y maíz. Actualmente Elva tiene una pequeña casa en la comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani, ahí viaja todos los fines D. semana para cuidar su terreno D. cultivo, ya cuando están maduros los venD. en el mercado central D. su ciudad (Yurinaki). En los próximos meses juntará el capital necesario para comprar un auto, D. esa manera podrá trasladarse constantemente a su terreno D. cultivo. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porqué le ayudan a invertir y progresar. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. abono para el café que esta sembrando, asimismo pagará al personal que le ayudará en la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elva, 53, is a strong and happy woman.  She is married to Nicanor, 52 years old.  Together they have six children, but only live with two of them: Madai, who is 18 years old and Vian, who is seven years old.  They live in a rented house in the central jungle (Yurinaki).  Since she was a child, Elva has dedicated herself to agriculture, “the fields are my life,” she affirms.  Back then she helped work the land, and as a young person she earned enough so that at 19 she bought her own plot of land.  Since then she has planted coffee, plantains and corn.    

Presently, Elva has a small house in the native community Centro Pumpuriani.  She travels there every weekend to take care of her plot of land.  When her crops are ripe, she sells them in her city's (Yurinaki) central market.  In the coming months she will put together the necessary capital to buy a car so that she will be able to regularly transport herself to her land.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma].  She likes to work with her communal bank because they help her invest and progress.  With the requested loan, she will invest in fertilizer for the coffee that she is cultivating.  She will also pay the staff that will help her in the next crop planting season.

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilizer for coffee planting and to pay staff that will help her in the next planting season.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en:
Chen H., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. H. sells flowers, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. Her husband is a "tuk-tuk" driver, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month.  

H. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. H. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Triunfo Comun Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Triunfo Común las Señoras le pusieron así porque son unas Triunfadoras y común porque buscan que sea crecimiento mutuo. Está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. Yolanda Valdés es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 49 años, estudió hasta la Universidad la carrera de Turismo, es comerciante de manualidades y tiene en total 3 hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón).  Ella se dedica a la venta de manualidades que inició hace 15 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en mercancía y poder realizar sus figuras y manualidades. Sus clientes son personas de la misma comunidad que le encargan novedades para fiestas.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para invertir y sacar más modelos. También espera poder llevarse a sus hijos de vacaciones a la playa. Esta foto fue tomada en la  casa de la Sra. Yolanda, se pueden ver las manualidades que vende en la foto.
texts.en: This group is called 'Triunfo Común' (Mutual Triumph).  The women gave the group the name 'Triunfo' ('triumph') because they are winners and 'Común' ('mutual') because they are seeking mutual growth.  The group is in the State of Mexico and has 10 members.  Yolanda Valdés is the group's president.  She is 49 years old and studied tourism at University.  She is a merchant who sells manual crafts.  Her customers are people from the same community who order novelties for parties.  As she requests her loan Yolanda feels happy.  She would like to use this loan to invest and obtain more designs.  She also hopes to be able to take her children on holiday to the beach.  This photo was taken in Yolanda's home.  The novelties which she sells can be seen in the photo.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise and make her novelties

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 3, Brgy. Tayawan, Bayawan, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a  piggery and a sugar cane farming businesses. Her husband Rosalito C., who is 38 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 5 to 17 years old. 

Maribeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maribeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. Maribeth C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of a piggery

loans.name: Abdul Rahman

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Abdul, who is married and has one eight-year-old child. In 2005, Abdul established his used clothing business in order to become self-reliant. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1663200 every month.

Abdul is requesting a loan of Le 3000000 to buy additional used clothes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 332640. In the future, Abdul plans to be an international businessman, build a house and live a comfortable life. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothes

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is a married woman who lives in Purok Toong, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating one business venture: buying and selling religious articles.  Her husband Leopoldo P., who is 55 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 19 to 29 years old with 3 of their children having their own family while the youngest one is currently going to school. 

Violeta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Violeta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future and cover their family's needs. 

Violeta P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Yeni Jackeline

texts.es: Yeni Jackeline D. M. de 27 años de edad, vive junto a su madre, dos hermanos menores de edad y un hijo de 7 años, quien depende por completo de ella. Yeni reside en Puerto el triunfo en Usulután, un lugar lleno de muchos turistas debido a sus hermosas playas. Ella posee una venta de  productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación y así mismo es la única tienda en la zona, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos. Yeni solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, de manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es de mucha importantita para ella ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a su único hijo.
texts.en: Yeni Jackeline D. Mejia is 27 years old and lives with her mother and her two younger brothers, and her young son who is 7 years old and completely dependent on Yeni.  They live is Puerto el Triunfo in Usulutan, a place which is full of tourists who come for its beautiful beaches.   Yeni runs a small general store where she sells snacks and groceries, and every day items such as bread, eggs, milk and others.   The business has a good location and is the only shop in the area, which helps Yeni a lot, and enables her to count on a wide customer base.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more products to offer her customers.   This business is very important for Yeni, and it is her only source of income to care for her son.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her general store.  The store provides her only source of income and lets her care for her young son.

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín es  cliente nuevo la actividad a la que se dedica es la de llantería, hace parchado de llantas venta de llantas usadas, el se dedica a esta actividad hace bastantes años, El vive en casa de su hijo mayor con su esposa el señor es bastante dinámico es por eso que en sus momentos libres se dedica a la fabrica de hojotas de caucho(que son las abarcas, sandalias que usan la gente del campo), el destino del créditos es precisamente para comprar material para esta segunda actividad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr Agustín is a new client. His business is a tire service shop. He repairs tires and sells used tires, and has had this business for many years. He lives with his wife in the home of his oldest child. This man is quite dynamic, and so in his free time he makes rubber hojotas (which are sandals worn by people in the countryside). This loan will be used to purchase material for this second business. He is a very hard-working and responsible person, and he is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of rubber for making sandals

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a single woman with four children. Two of her children attend school, and two have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has operated a business selling sunflower seeds and nuts for the past six years, selling at a nearby schoool to school children. Nyevu faces a major challenge of seasonality. During high season, when schools are open, the demand for cashews and groundnuts (peanuts) is high. During the holiday season, when schools have closed, the demand goes down. She hopes to expand her business and supply as wholesale in the future.

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of sunflower seeds and groundnuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of efficiency of the loan products.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sunflower seeds and groundnuts

loans.name: Ena Josabeth

texts.es:
Ena reside en Alegría departamento de Usulután, tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su esposo y una hija de 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender plantas, este negocio lo tiene en su casa hace 5 años, lo atiende de 9:00am a 5:00pm, todos los días de la semana, este negocio se lo enseño su madre.
Por el momento Ena necesita invertir en el negocio, comprar plantas frutales y ornamentales, también semilla,  por lo que solicita un préstamo y con los fondos de este adquirir las plantas que sean necesarias para fortalecer el vivero, también semilla para cultivar diferentes plantas y árboles frutales, esperando que esta inversión le ayude a recibir mejores ingresos para su familia.
Sus sueños y aspiraciones son que a través del crecimiento del vivero sus ventas sean mejores, que su situación económica sea más solvente para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ena lives in Alegría, in Usulután department; she is 29 years old and she lives with her husband and their 7-year-old daughter. She engages in selling plants, an activity she started in her own house 5 years ago. She works there from 9 am to 5 pm every day of the week, and it was her mother who introduced her to this activity.
At the moment, Ena needs to invest in the shop by buying fruit and ornamental plants, as well as seeds. For this reason she is requesting a loan with which to purchase the plants she needs to strengthen the nursery, as well as seeds to grow different plants and fruit trees; she hopes that this investment will help her gaining a better income for her family.
She aims at improving her sales thanks to the growth of her nursery, and she dreams of finding herself in a more respectable economic situation in order to improve her family’s standards of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds and ornamental and fruit plants.

loans.name: Komlan  Apeleté

texts.fr: Monsieur  Komlan a 26  ans. Il  habite  quartier  Avepozo.   Il fait la  vente de friperie.  Il  a débuté en 2007 cette activité et  s’approvisionne  au marché  de hédzranawoé.  Ensuite il  les  revend  au  marché d’avépozo.   IL  demande   un  prêt  pour  acheter  4   balles  de Jeans  et  2  balles   de  chemise.
texts.en: Komlan is 26 years old. He lives in Avepozo. He sells used clothing. He started out in 2007 with this business and he makes his purchases in Hedzranawoe. He later resells in the Avepozo market. He requests a loan to purchase 4 loads of jeans and 2 loads of shirts.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Liberthe

texts.en:
Liberthe is 41 years old and married with five children who are between 18 and 21 years old. Liberthe is commonly known for selling drinks (PRIMUS and MITZIIG,VIN) and she has been in this business for about five years. Liberthe opens her shop from 7am until 9 pm every day.

Liberthe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company hoping that she can increase her profits by expanding her business. With the use of this loan, Liberthe will also start roasting meat to sell to her customers. A large number of her customers have requested this. Liberthe hopes that through the expansion of her business, she will start creating some other sources of income as well creating more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy more beer and start roasting meat to sell.

loans.name: Yanira Ana

texts.es: Yanira Ana M. R. de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas, en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una sala de belleza en su vivienda la cual es una de las principales fuentes de ingreso para su hogar; la zona es muy concurrida y como realiza un excelente trabajo a la hora de dar sus servicios tiene mucha demanda por parte de la gente, además ella para seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes también trabaja a domicilio. Yanira necesita comprar productos de belleza como cremas, espuma, vitaminas para el cabello, esmaltes, shampoo, acondicionadores  y otros importantes que pueda vender a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo le permiten mejorar la calidad de su trabajo. Yanira es mujer, madre y trabajadora entusiasta que espera que su trabajo le permita sacar adelante a sus hijas y así mantener la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en:
Yanira Ana M. R. is 41 years old.  She lives with her husband and two daughters in San Salvador department.  Yanira has a beauty salon in her home which is one of the main sources of income for her household.  Her area is very busy and, as she does excellent work, there is a lot of demand for her services.  In order to continue meeting the needs of her customers, she also works in people's homes. 

Yanira needs to buy beauty products such as creams, foam, hair vitamins, nail polish, shampoo, conditioners and other important products that she sells to her customers and which also allow her to improve the quality of her work.  Yanira is a hard-working and enthusiastic woman and mother who hopes that her work will enable her to get her daughters ahead in life and also help support her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, foam, hair vitamins, nail polish, shampoo and conditioners

loans.name: Ines De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Inés G. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad desde 1999 gracias a su hermoso centro histórico, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, cuenta también con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.
 
Doña Inés se encuentra de 46 años, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de 25, 21, 19 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo hijo estudia en la universidad, su tercer hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales y su ultima hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión sastre, con el trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Inés labora junto con su esposo en su taller de sastrería, esta actividad la desempeña hace 12 años, realizan todo tipo de arreglos y costuras, laboran de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su noveno crédito y a invirtiendo todos los créditos en su taller, este lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc.

Su mayor sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Inés G. is a member of the 'Loma de la Cruz' community bank.  She lives in Sinincay parish, in the city of Cuenca.  This city was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 thanks to its historic center.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions and its cuisine is very wide ranging.

Inés is 46 years old, married, and has four children aged 25, 21, 19 and 14.  Her eldest child (a daughter) is married and lives independently.  Her second child (a son) is studying at university.  Her third child (a son) works to cover his personal expenses and her youngest child (a daughter) attends high school.  Her husband is a tailor and, through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Inés works together with her husband in his tailor's workshop.  She has been in this business for 12 years and together they do all kinds of repairs and sewing.  They work from Monday to Friday but don't work fixed hours.

Inés is receiving her ninth loan through her community bank.  She has invested all her previous loans in her workshop.  She will invest this loan in buying raw materials such as fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, etc.

Inés' biggest dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Amara

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Amara. He is married and has three children. He has two additional dependents who live with him because they lost their parents. In 2001, Amara established his tobacco business. He began his business because he believed the income he would generate from this business would enhance his independence. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 700,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Amara now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, Amara plans to buy a house and establish a big tobacco shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco for his business

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is from the village of Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 66 years old, married and has four adult children. To make a living, Flor runs a business venture in the agriculture sector, specializing in flower gardening. 

Flor has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. Flor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Flor is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP with which she will purchase fertilizers and flower seeds for her flower-gardening business. This will be the second loan taken out by Flor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and flower seeds for her flower gardening business.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is 35 years old and married with one child.   She makes and sells shoes and belts made of leather.  She has four years of experience in the business.  She runs her business with three employees.  She hopes to buy a piece of land in five years.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy leather.

loans.use: to buy leather

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 25 years old, married and has one child, who is not currently in school. He has a stationery business, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Isaiah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stationery materials, such as books, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Isaiah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and basic necessities for his family. In the future, Isaiah hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery materials, such as books, for resale.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Arlene is 32 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Arlene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional  fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios.
Desde hace cuatro años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de  S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de bebidas refrescantes y compra y venta de animales como ovinos y vacunos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 2,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará seis unidades de ovinos para su respectivo engorde por dos meses.  Nos cuenta que los compra en Huacullani y los vende en la localidad de Yunguyo.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su mamá.
Su sueño es seguir operando en el negocio y tener más ganados, de esa forma tendrá más ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the communal bank “Virgen de la Asunción,” located in the district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno. She is 22 years old, single and has no children. She has gone to high school.
