She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for four years. Her first loan was for the sum of 500 Peruvian soles, a loan she invested in her business selling refreshing drinks, and the buying and selling of animals such as sheep and cattle. 

With this new loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles she will buy six head of sheep for their respective fattening for two months. She tells us that she buys them in Huacullani and sells them in the locality of Yunguyo. She works in the business along with her mom. 

Her dream is to continue operating the business and have more livestock, so she will have greater earnings. What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of acquiring a loan and the punctuality.

loans.use: to purchase six head of sheep.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en: Kristine lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the town of Maralik.  Even though Kristine has a university education, the difficult economic times have forced her to be a farmer for the past nine years.  She is the proud mother of three children: a five-year-old daughter and two sons (nine and ten years old).  Kristine would like to increase the number of livestock with a microfinance loan.  She expects that this investment will increase the family income by 25%. Kristine and her husband hope to continue growing the family farm and purchase new equipment. They can develop the business and later pass it on to their children. Kristine enjoys living in Maralik. She knows all the townspeople and has relatives close by.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 56 years old. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and six children; five sons and one daughter. Hai earns an income to support her family by running a shop in front of their house selling women's and children's clothes, beauty products and souvenirs. Hai began her business in 2001.

Hai would like to take a loan to expand her business by purchasing more clothes, cosmetics and souvenirs to provide better products for her customers. She believes that the loan will enable her to purchase better quality products at more competitive prices and increase the income that she earns from her business. She hopes that this, in turn, will enable her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase women and children clothes, cosmetics and souvenir products.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is unmarried and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase more items to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
This is Felicitas, 43, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eufemio, her business partner, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Felicitas operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,000 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Felicitas hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 58 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

Yolanda has a handicraft business selling crocheted products and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase products for her handicraft business.

Yolanda has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Yolanda hopes to promote her business.

loans.use: to purchase more crocheted products to sell

loans.name: Oyuntungalag

texts.en:
Oyuntungalag is 45 years old and lives with her 23-year-old son and  her husband in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in an outer ger district (district without basic infrastructure) of the city. Her son works at a local company while his father works as a security worker. 

Oyuntungalag is very experienced in business.  Since 1997, she has been operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. In 2003, she owned her rental stall and today her working capital is approximately two million MNT(Mongolian Tugriks).  Usually, she imports her products from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

She requesting a 1,200,000 MNT  loan to purchase more clothes to sell at her stall this autumn. In the future, she wants to expand her business.  She is very thankful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Henry Mauricio

texts.es:
Henry Mauricio tiene treinta y tres años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija de siete años de edad en el cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.
Henry se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. 
Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos y posterior venderlos a un buen precio.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda para adquirir los productos e insumos para preparar la tierra para sembrar.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño para los próximos 5 años  es tener un buen estilo de vida.
En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Henry Mauricio, 33, lives in a common-law marriage and has a daughter.  He lives with his wife and seven-year-old daughter in Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos.

The San Nicolás communal bank is located in the San Nicolás neighborhood, Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  This communal bank is devoted to short-cycle agriculture, growing corn.

Henry works in agriculture, growing corn, rice, and beans.  He buys and sells in San Jacinto.

He is requesting the loan to invest in agriculture, to buy seeds and agricultural products like urea, brush killer, fertilizers, and weed killer to keep the crops in good condition and, later, to sell them for a good price.

The loan will be a big help in acquiring the products and ingredients to prepare the land for planting.

The challenges he frequently faces are competition, pests, and crop disease.  His dream for the next five years is to have a good lifestyle.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, brush killer, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 42 years old with two children who are in secondary school and high school. She is managing a small shop that sells fresh fruits at retail. Her business started in 2009. One year later, she got a loan from SEDA micro credit program.  Her business has developed further from that time and it creates a stable income for her to manage her family life.  During her participation in the program, she is always a good repayer. For the new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 9,184,000 VND.  With this amount of money, she will buy more kinds of fresh fruits to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fruit to sell

loans.name: Mildred Sobeyda

texts.es:
La Sra. Mildred, es casada, comerciantes desde hace catorce años,  su negocio es de venta de ropa, siendo la mas fuerte la ropa femenina  y de niños, puesto que sus clientes los a conquistado de las distintas empresas en el área administrativa, donde tiene su mayo demanda, las cuales le hacen los pedidos mensualmente.    

Por eso doña Mildred se acerca a nuestras oficinas para solicitar nuevamente su crédito y de esta manera cubrir la demanda, también por la temporada en estas fechas las cuales con muy buenas.

Cabe mencionar que ella considera que este préstamo  le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, y mayo calidad de vida a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mildred is married and has been a merchant for 14 years.  Her business is selling clothes; her strongest sellers are women’s and children’s clothes because most of her regular customers where demand is highest are administrative personnel in various firms who place monthly orders.

Because of this, Mildred has come by our offices to once again request a loan to meet demand and also because the season these days is very good.  It’s worth mentioning that she believes that this loan will help her improve income and her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's slacks, blouses, purses, sandals and children's outfits.

loans.name: Harapan 3 Group

texts.en:
Suryati is 39 years old and married with two children. Her children are going to school. She has been selling "nasi uduk" (Indonesian coconut rice) in front of her house for three years. Her husband helps her run this business. The business is going well but she needs more capital to increase the sales volume. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she plans to use this loan to buy more rice and coconut to produce more "nasi uduk". Also she wants to provide more variation of dishes. 

In the future she wants to have a restaurant so she can have a better income to continue giving her children a good education.

Other group members plan to use their loan to sell clothes on credit, sell snacks and sell mobile phone minute refills.

loans.use: to pay for more rice and coconut to produce more "nasi uduk" (Indonesian coconut rice) to sell.

loans.name: Soda

texts.fr:
Soda est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans  mère de 12 enfants.

Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis le 02/09/2008 ou elle occupe le poste de présidente.
Soda fait parti du groupe de solidarité ande liguey et elle pratique du commerce plus précisément la vente de poissons frais.
Avec son nouveau prêt de 400000 elle va acheter 40 paniers de poissons qu'elle va revendre au détail  au niveau du marché de son quartier.
A l 'aide de ses bénéfices elle va acheter du riz de l'huile du sucre et payer des fournitures scolaires à ses enfants .
texts.en:
Soda is a 44-year-old married mother of 12.

Since September 2, 2008, she has been a member of the “banc villageois,” where she sits as president.  Soda is part of the Ande Liguey solidarity group and she works in sales, specifically selling fresh fish.

With her new loan of 400,000, she is going to purchase 40 baskets of fish, which she will then sell retail in her neighborhood market.

She will use her profits to purchase rice, oil and sugar, and to pay for school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for retail sale

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: Fernando, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está en casado y vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. el con el crédito pretende comprar unas herramientas eléctricas indispensables que le hacen falta para poder elaborar sus construcciones. El tiene ya varios años de desempeñarse en estas labores y necesita ir perfeccionando su acabados por lo cual para facilitar su trabajo y su desempeño en calidad el necesita esta maquinas como el patín de cortar madera, metao y otros más. El con estas maquinas le dará a su clientes mayor eficacia en su trabajo para así complacer a sus clientes con lo que le pidan. El con esto pretende ser contratado por más clientela para la construcción de las necesidades de los clientes a su vez así generar una aumento en las ganancias para el bienestar de su familiar cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Fernando, 36, is married and lives with his three children and his wife who are his greatest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy indispensable electric work tools that he needs for his construction work.  He has been working in this type of work for several years now and he needs to be improving his work to ease his labor and produce better quality work; he needs these machines like an electric saw and others.  With these machines he will be able to provide more efficient work to his customers thus satisfying them in whatever they ask for.  He intends this way to be contracted by more customers for their construction needs and this way he will generate higher profits for his family’s wellbeing every day.  This is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR gave him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Josephine has been in this business for six years. Josephine earns additional income from her food vending and dried-fish vending businesses.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rafaela Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela  Emperatriz  se dedica a la venta de  antojitos como es quesadillas, tacos  dorados ,tacos blanditos y las sabrosas empanadas.
También se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres meses.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comparar mas ingredientes como es : cebolla,jitomate,aguacates,verduras ,carne ,maíz para la masa y elaboración de tortillas.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir triunfando en la vida.
texts.en:
Rafaela Emperatriz engages in selling snacks such as cheesecakes, fried tacos, soft-shell tacos and tasty meat pies.
Three months ago she also started a clothes selling activity.
She has requested a loan to buy more ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, avocados, vegetables, meat and maize - for the dough- to prepare tortillas.

She thanks the foundation for the support provided in keeping on succeeding in life.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, avocados, vegetables, meat and maize to prepare her snacks.

loans.name: Sari Usaha Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is applying for a new loan to continue her business. Currently, the schools of her children will cost quite a lot because it is near the exam. Doing her pig-raising business greatly helps to meet those costs. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy three superior piglets with feed purchased with her own money from last period's profit. She hopes that in the next six months her business will run smoothly so that it can pay for school fees.

loans.use: To buy three superior piglets.

loans.name: Ngoma Tukole Group

texts.en:
Efuransi is a 49 year old hardworking married woman with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a member of Ngoma Tukole Group. She deals in the brewing and selling of highly nutritious local porridge called Bushera and this helps her earn income and sustain her family. Apart from that, she also practices crop growing to supplement on her earnings. She loves having a family with educated children around her that is why she works hard to expand her business to get more profits and educate her children. However, Efuransi faces challenges of high inflation rates and inadequate capital in trying to pursue her goal
.
She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and millet to make porridge for selling.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and millet to make porridge for selling.

loans.name: Mairambubu

texts.ru: Майрамбубу, 59 лет, замужем, многодетная мама 6 детей, вся семья с радостью помогает по хозяйству. Майрамбубу около 32 года назад Майрамбубу стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Майрамбубу на сегодняшний день у нее есть 10 коров, 50 овец, 6 лошадей. Также на собственной земельной доле мерою 10,0 ГА она выращивает люцерну, заготавливая корма для скота. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрамбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и перепродажи. Гульнарахон планирует и дальше расширять ее бизнес и дать образование ее детям и внукам.

loans.use: to purchase some calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.en: Katiuska runs a small store where she sells medicines to the locals. She started this business with her ex-husband who worked as a medicine distributor in the city. 2 years ago he left her and the business. She now runs it on her own and is seeking a loan to make it grow. Katiuska wants to invest in new products geared towards infants like formula and bottles. She sees this business as her future and she is happy to be self sufficient. She hopes this loan will allow her to make her business grow without having to borrow from loan sharks who charge extremely high rates.

loans.use: Buy medicines for her small pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Karina Del Rosario

texts.en:
Karina has been making furniture for 13 years. Her two brothers and a nephew work beside her a workshop established by her father more than forty years ago. She is the single mother of two, a seven-year-old and a ten-month-old. She cannot count on the support of her partner and must provide for the children on her own. Sadly, her father passed away, so Karina must help provide for her mother as well. She has good experience and makes high-quality furniture which is much in demand. She needs a $750 loan to purchase lumber, nails, paint and varnish. Please help her grow this business and improve her family's quality of life. They would sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Alexis Hult

Karina trabaja en la carpintería desde hace 13 años, este negocio lo inició su padre hace más de 40 años, aquí también trabajan dos de sus hermanos y un sobrinos. Karina es madre soltera de dos hijos, de 7 años y de 10 meses de edad, no tiene el apoyo de su pareja y tiene que solventar los gastos de sus hijos ella sola, lamentablemente su padre falleció y también tiene que ayudar económicamente a su madre.

Con base en la experiencia, los muebles que fabrican son de muy buena calidad y los pedidos por sus productos se han incrementado, en estos momentos necesitan de un crédito por $775 dólares que destinará a la compra del material que requiere para la elaboración de su trabajo, como madera, pintura, clavos y lacas. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som S. is a widow and lives with her 3 children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes a living by running a grocery store near a market, where she makes a moderate revenue of about $3/day. Fortunately, 3 of her children are married and assist her in selling goods. Currently, Som S. needs a loan to add more grocery products to her stock in order to meet her clients’ needs. She hopes to expand her business as well as giving her family a better quality of life one day.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita lives in the Calle Pujio zone of Villa San Juan. She has four children, ages 9, 7, 5, and 3. She works creating blankets, for which she acquires raw material at wholesale. Her husband works as a boat driver at a tourism agency in Titicaca Lake in La Paz province.

Margarita would like to request a loan for the purchase of whole rolls of raw material, that is, wholesale, in order to lower her costs, which would affect her net earnings.

This is her first loan with Impro, and the evaluation conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Margarita vive en la zona de Villa San Juan calle Pujio. Tiene cuatro hijos de 9, 7, 5,3 años, se dedica a la elaboración de frazadas para lo cual adquiere su materia prima, al por menor. Su esposo trabaja como conductor de bote en una agencia de turismo en el Lago Tititcaca del departamento de La Paz.

Margarita desea solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima por rollos enteros, es decir al por mayor y así lograr costos mas bajos lo cual influirá en su ganancia neta.

Este es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Luisa Julia

texts.es:
Luisa is 56 years old and she completed high school. She lives in the Salpo district, Otuzco province, Liberty state. She has only one son that depends on her. Today she buys basic necessities in Trujillo and also from some carriers that arrive at her locale to supply her store. She also has other businesses: a restaurant, she rents rooms, showers, and bathrooms.

Thanks to the invitation of a friend she joined the Communal Bank "Virgen de las Mercedes," and with the first loan from Manuela Ramos of 200 soles (approximately $96) she bought rice, sugar, and oil in small quantities. She noticed also that the workers in this area didn't have a place where they could meet some of their basic needs; so she decided with the next loans to open a resaturant called "La Amistad" (Friendship), and she arranged her house to rent rooms and bathroom services; recently she installed a phone booth business too.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos of 2300 soles (approximately $767), which will be paid in 6 installments, she will buy 6 beds for the bedrooms and more cell phones for the phone service. Luisa is President of the Mothers Club and belongs to the community health support committee. She dreams of buying a small van to be able to transport the merchandise that she buys outside her district and she hopes to improve the rooms of her house to meet the expectations of whomever wishes to use her facilities, in other words to offer greater convenience and customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luisa tiene 56 años de edad y estudió secundaria completa. Vive en el distrito de Salpo de la Provincia de Otuzco del Departamento de La Libertad, tiene solo un hijo que depende de ella. Actualmente compra productos de primera necesidad en la provincia de Trujillo y también a algunos transportistas que llegan al lugar para surtir su bodega. Paralelamente tiene otro negocio de restaurante, alquiler de habitaciones, de duchas y servicios higiénicos.

Gracias a la invitación de una amiga se integró al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 (aproximadamente $96) compró arroz, azúcar, aceite en pocas cantidades. Observó también que los trabajadores de la zona no tenían un lugar donde puedan satisfacer algunas de sus necesidades; así que decide con sus siguientes préstamos abrir un restaurante llamado “La Amistad”, y arregla su casa para alquilar habitaciones y servicios higiénicos; recientemente a emprendido el negocio de locutorio.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela ramos de S/.2,300.00 ($ 767 ) el mismo que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 6 camas para las habitaciones y más celulares para el locutorio. La señora Luisa López es Presidenta del club de Madres y pertenece al comité de apoyo del centro de salud.. Sueña con comprar una camioneta pequeña para poder transportar la mercadería que compra fuera de su distrito y desea mejorar las habitaciones de su casa para cubrir las expectativas de cualquier persona que desea el servicio, es decir brindar mayor comodidad.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and communications equipment.

loans.name: Ocih

texts.en:
Ocih is 41 years old and the mother of a 13-year-old daughter. She has a small shop that sells snacks, vegetables and household goods. She can earn about $25 per day.

Her husband, O., has a fish farm and usually earns $50 a month. However, she still needs a $50 loan to buy more goods and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.es:
Anatolia is 38 years old and has 3 children; Maria is 28 years old and has 2 children; Nelida is 31 years old and has 3 children. Anatolia, Maria and Nelida belong to the communal bank Urpicha (which in Quechua means "little bird"), for 3, 2, and 1 year respectively.

In their communal bank they learned to save and invest money, manage their business and avoid illnesses.

Anatolia has been selling fruit wholesale in the market "Nery Garcia" for 15 years. Maria has been selling second-hand clothing in the San Juan Bautista fair for 4 years, and she also sells new clothes upon requests of friends and relatives. Nelida has been selling dried maize (a product which is used to prepared the dishes typical of the region) for two years.

Anatolia, Maria and Nelida need loans of 600 soles, 600 soles, and 1000 soles respectively. These will be invested in buying pineapple, yucca, firewood, lime, and second-hand clothes such as shirts, pants, and children's clothing. They will use their savings to educate their children, buy appliances, and build a house.

The dreams of Anatolia, Maria, and Nelida are to have a good capital, their own locale, buying a car to transport their merchandise and buying land to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Anatolia tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, mientras que Nélida tiene 31 años y 3 hijos. Anatolia, Maria y Nélida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Urpicha (palabra quechua que significa Pajarito), desde hace 3, 2, 1 años respectivamente.

En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a cómo invertir su dinero, cómo manejar su negocio y cómo evitar enfermedades.

Anatolia vende frutas al por mayor en el mercado “Nery García”, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años. Por otro lado Maria vende ropa de segunda mano en la feria de San Juan Bautista, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, además vende ropa nueva por pedido a amigos y familiares. Mientras Nélida elabora maíz pelado (producto que es utilizado para preparar comidas típicas de la región), actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años.

Anatolia, Maria y Nélida necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra de piña, yuca, leña, cal y ropa de segunda mano como polos, pantalones, ropa de niños. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la educación de sus hijos, compra de artefactos y en la construcción de la casa. Los sueños de Anatolia, Maria y Nélida son tener un buen capital, local propio, comprar un carro para el traslado de su mercadería y comprar un terreno y construir su casa.

loans.use: buying pineapple, yucca, firewood, lime, and second-hand clothes such as shirts, pants, and children's clothing.  ( compra de piña, yuca, leña, cal y ropa de segunda mano como polos, pantalones, ropa de niños.)

loans.name: Juana Hilda

texts.es:
Eight years ago in the city of León, Mrs. Juana R. decided to invest her and her husband’s savings in a small cheese business in order to provide for their three children, who are underage and need a lot of support from their parents.

Mrs. R. is in charge of this business. She has been investing in her business space little by little, which is on a plot of land that she owns. Despite this fact, she still needs to invest more into her business, but she needs to have greater financial resources in order to achieve this project.

In order to bring about the improvement of her business, both in expanding the space and increasing inventory, Mrs. R. requests loans from Ceprodel. She has invested in her business buying products such as cream, cream cheese, curd, fresh cheese, and smoked curd. She has requested a total of 11 loans from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 8 años en la ciudad de León, la señora Juana R. decide invertir sus ahorros y los de su esposo en un pequeño negocio de venta de queso para mantener a sus tres hijos que necesitan un gran apoyo de sus padres por ser menores de edad.

La señora R. , se ha encargado de administrar este negocio y ha ido invirtiendo poco a poco en su localidad el cual es un terreno propio pero a pesar de esto, el negocio aun necesita de que se le invierta mas dinero y por ende se necesita tener mayores recursos financieros para realizar este proyecto.

Para llevar a cabo esta mejora en su negocio tanto en ampliación física como en aumento de productos, la señora Juana realiza créditos en Ceprodel habiéndolos invertido directamente en su negocio y adquirido otros productos como crema, queso de crema, cuajada, queso fresco y cuajada ahumada. Su record crediticio es de 11 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese from suppliers

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
This is 46 year-old Rosemary R.. She is married with four children, aged 10, 17, 20, and 25, and has two other dependents who live with her because their parents died of HIV/AIDS.

In 2005, Rosemary established a clothing business. Working one to four hours a day, seven days a week, she earns about $170 per month from this business. Rosemary has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase ten dresses, ten sarongs, 20 pieces of traditional African cloth, and ten handbags. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $130. In the future, Rosemary also plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase dresses, sarongs, traditional African cloth, and handbags for her clothing business.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha sells shoes by catalog. She started this activity 2 years ago because of the need for additional income to that of her husband, who works as a handyman and whose salary was not enough to cover the school expenses of their 2 children.

She now needs a loan of US $350, which will be repaid in 4 months, to purchase more merchandise to offer to her customers. With your support she will be able to continue paying for the education of her little ones.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Martha se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo esta actividad la inicio hace 2 años dada la necesidad de obtener ingresos adicionales a los de su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil ya que el sueldo de el no eras suficiente para solventar los gastos de la escuela de sus 2 hijos.

Ahora necesita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder ofrecerla a sus clientes. Con tus aportaciones ella podrá seguir pagando la educación a sus pequeños.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: If God Agree Group

texts.en:
Fatmata S., the leader of the group is 40 years and married with 3 children. The group members live in Senekedugu village and it is their home land. Faming is their occupation, but they could not grow enough, due to lack of loans to enable them purchase farm inputs.

When Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) introduced agricultural loans for subsistence farmers to increase food production, the group approached the institution for a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($875 USD) , Le.500,000 ($175 USD) for each member, to purchase farm supplies. Their future plan is to develop an agribusiness.

The group needs to improve their agribusinesses so that they can feed their families and pay for family expenses. In order to do so they need a loan to buy inputs and pay labourers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay labourers

loans.name: Isauro

texts.es:
Isauro started his business because of the family tradition. Since his entire family has been in this business, this spurred him to start in the business also. For 15 years he has had a butcher shop and he also enjoys preparing braised pork. He started in Cadereyta, when on trying some braised pork he noted that the flavor and preparation were not like in his home town. Knowing how to prepare them better, he decided to start his business in that town.

He needs a loan of $775, which will be repaid in 6 months, to improve his location and maintain his van.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Isauro inició el negocio por tradicion familiar, puesto que toda su familia se dedican a eso para el fue un estimulo para iniciarse en el negocio, hace 15 años tenia una carniceria y despues le gusto la preparacion de las carnitas. Comenzó en Cadereyta, cuando al probar unas carnitas noto que el sabor y la elaboracion no eran como en su ciudad natal, por lo que al saber elaboralas decidio inicar su negocio de este giro.

El necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para mejorar el local y mantenimiento de la camioneta.

loans.use: To remodel his butcher shop and repair his van.

loans.name: Haroution

texts.en: Haroution, 53, lives in Bourj Hammoud which is located in Beirut. This year, he took  out his first loan from Al Majmoua to open a new shop selling Hummus and Foul, traditional Lebanese cuisine. At present, Haroution needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,200 to purchase aluminum display cases for his shop. This step up will allow Haroution to expand his business by attracting more clients.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum display cases

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es:
Julia is a woman who has gone through tough times despite of her young age. When she was a child, she suffered the loss of her father, and shortly after she was separated from her mother due to lack of economical resources. This did not allow her to finish her secondary education (high school). Life granted her the gift of motherhood, but her husband and father of her child abandoned them without any logical explanation and without a financial background to shelter her. Since then she has done different chores to provide for her son. Now she sells socks, "chullos" (Peruvian knit hats with ear flaps), gloves, and other merchandise offered in the travelling business in one of the main streets of the city of Juliaca, always accompanied by her son. The wish that this diligent and young mother cherishes in her heart is to offer her son a better life. She is sure that increasing her merchandise, her business and her income will also increase.

Translated into English by Patricia Yanez, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es una mujer que a su corta edad atravesó por momentos muy difíciles, de niña sufrió la penosa perdida de su padre y al poco tiempo tuvo que separase del lado de su madre por falta de recursos económicos, esto no le permitió concluir sus estudios secundarios, la vida le concedió el regalo de ser madre, pero al cabo de poco tiempo, su esposo y padre de su niño la abandonó sin ninguna explicación dejándola sola y sin ningún respaldo económico con que ampararse, desde entonces se dedicó a diferentes oficios con el fin de que su pequeño niño no pase privaciones. Ahora se dedica a la venta de calcetines, chullos, guantes, etc., mercadería que ofrece en forma ambulatoria en una de las principales y concurridas avenidas de al ciudad de Juliaca, siempre acompañada de su hijo. El deseo que cobija en su corazón esta diligente y joven madre es ofrecerle una mejor condición de vida a su niño y está segura que aumentando su capital de inversión en su negocio logrará mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To increase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Arsacia

texts.en:
Arsacia is 56 years old and has been married for 41 years. She and her husband have 12 children, the youngest of whom is 19 years old and studying at the University. Arsacia already has 10 grandchildren, but expects many more as five of her daughters have not yet married or started a family.

Arsacia and her husband grew up in the country and lived for the first twenty years of their marriage on a farm, where they grew vegetables and sold milk and eggs. Twenty years ago they moved to the city, and Arsacia opened a small grocery/variety store. Today her store is very successful, mostly because of the good prices she offers. All 12 of Arsacia's children work as well, and one of her sons owns a barber shop next door to her shop. Arsacia is asking for a small loan in order to re-stock merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to re-stock merchandise in her store

loans.name: Las Legionarias Group

texts.en:
The Las Legionarias (The Legionnaires) group consists of 13 women and one man who live in the tropical Santa C. region of eastern Bolivia. The group members all know one another from their neighborhood. None of them are related, though they do share similar last names, like many Bolivians.

Each of the group members has his or her own business: some sell clothing, cosmetic products, food, white majao (a traditional dish from eastern Bolivia maD. with jerky, sausage, bananas, tomatoes, rice and yucca), and medications; others work as radio taxi drivers, manicurists, or cell phone company reps; and some do filming and proviD. amplification services. Most have between one and five years of experience in their respective businesses, though some have as many as 15, and Teofilo has 20 years of experience as a musician! The group members say they will use this loan to buy more raw ingredients with which to make their products or to buy tools or equipment to use in their businesses.

Most of the group has previous experience with group loans at other Bolivian microfinance institutions. They have promised to make all of their payments on time, as scheduled.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients/materials to make various products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 28 years old and married with two kids. Her kids are currently in school. To support her family, she has been hawking cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. She says that selling cosmetics is very lucrative and, therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to sponsor her children's education. Elizabeth is a member of the group called St John. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina O. sells second-hand shoes and bags. She has been in this business for the past three years. She travels once a month to purchase second-hand shoes and bags. Justina needs the loan amount of N99,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. As the festive season is fast approaching, the demands for her second-hand shoes and bags will increase.

Justina is 34 years old and married to Mr. O., who is a taxi driver. They have two children who are aged 5 and 7 years respectively. She hopes to assist her husband in caring for their children. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Originaire d'ALLADA,dame H. Louise est née en 1961 à Cotonou. Elevée par sa tante , elle aidait cette dernière dans la vente d'akassa (pâte faite à base de maïs) .En 1979, elle alla en apprentissage de couture gràce au soutien financier de sa grande sœur. Elle reçut son diplôme de fin d' apprentissage après 09 ans.Elle a ouvert son atelier de couture et exerça le métier pendant 3 ans avant de se lancer dans le commerce  de maïs ,huile rouge et céréales. Depuis 12 ans ; elle s'est mise dans la vente des oeufs frais et produits de soldes (liquidation):plats,tasses et autres .Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt de 150000fcfa d'une durée de 10 mois pour renforcer son activité .Mariée à TOSSOU Martin, cordonnier ,elle n'a pas d'enfant.
texts.en:
A native of Allada, Mrs. Louise H. was born in 1961 in Cotonou. Raised by her aunt, she helped the latter sell "akassa" (a porridge made out of maize). In 1979, she was apprenticed to a seamstress, thanks to financial help from her big sister. She received her diploma in that trade after 9 years.

Louise opened her own workshop and plied her trade for three years before beginning to sell maize, red palm oil, and cereals. For 12 years now, she has been selling fresh eggs and articles on deep discount: plates, cups, etc. She is requesting this third loan of 150,000 F CFA with a term of 10 months to bolster her little business. Married to Martin Tossou, a shoemaker, she has no children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 10 cartons of 4 dozen cups and plates; 50 trays of eggs

loans.name: Mrs. Lim Soeurng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fifteen people who live in Tang Krong Village in Kampong ChhN. Province. 
Mrs. Lim S., the village bank president, was selected by the members. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to the villagers and visitors to the local village. Her husband, Mr. Mi Reth, sells firewood. 

Although they work very hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide better living conditions for the family. They also live in an old house in poor condition. To improve their circumstances, Mrs. Lim S. is asking for a loan, which she will use with her savings, to build a new house for the family. Mrs. Lim S. is 45 years old and the mother of five children who attend the local school. 

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon S. is 40 years old and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. To earn income for her family, she grows rice and many other kinds of vegetables and sells it to the market. As a result, she earns around $2 each day. 

Her husband is a police officer and makes approximately $3 a day. She and her husband have three children, all of whom are in school. Mrs. Chuon S. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation needs. This bike will be used to transport rice and for her husband to commute to work as well.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to help the family commute to and from work and school.

loans.name: Sagastume 3 Group

texts.es:
la Sra. Rosa Elia M. es la cordinadora del grupo tiene 54 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de lociones, cremas, ropa de dama, caballeros y niños, tambien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales en su casa de habitacion, esta actividad tiene varios años de hacerla y con ello a podido levantar su casa.  
 La Joven Veronica L. de 37 años de edad la cual se dedica a la sastreria, ella confecciona ropa de dama, vestidos para novias, pantalones, actividad que realiza desde varios años, ella tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion.  La joven Kare G. de 26 años de edad se dedica a la elaboracion de collares, anillos y pulseras de piedras y plata, actividad que realiza hace 3 años y que tiene bastante demanda, este producto se vende bastante ya que las mujeres ahora usan mucho la fantasia, cabe mencionar que las 3 integrantes del grupo han salido adelante con sus negocios y han podido dar el sustento en sus hogares, tanto en alimentacion como estudios y salud. ellas estan solicitando un credito para poder invertir en sus negocios y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Elia M. is the coordinator of the group. She is 54 years old and works selling lotions, creams, and clothing for men, women, and children. She also works selling tamales in her home, an activity she has done for many years, which allowed her to build her house. Miss Veronica L. is 37 years old and works as a tailor. She has made ladies' clothing, wedding dresses, and pants for many years. She has her business in her home. Miss Kare G. is 26 years old and works making necklaces, rings, and bracelets of stones and silver. She has done this for 3 years and there is plenty of demand and these products sell very well since the women wear lots of costume jewelry. It stands to mention that the three members of the group have been able to get ahead with their businesses and have been able to provide sustenance to their homes in food, studies, and health. The are asking for a loan to be able to invest in their businesses and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The buy men's women's and children's clothing, silver bracelets, and tamales

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni, nació en el distrito de Saylla de la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 45 minutos de la misma ciudad en auto, carretera asfaltada.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años de edad y es casada; ella tiene 2 hijos, (14 y 9) años de edad, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, y un depósito de cervezas en su casa, ella está construyendo su casita en material noble con el dinero que le ingresa de su negocio de abarrotes y de la venta de las cervezas, ella invertirá el préstamo otorgado en la compra de mayor número de cajas de cerveza para tener mayor ingreso y así seguir mejorando su casa.


La socia está muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y está comprometida a pagar el total de la deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The member Marleni, born in the Saylla district in the province of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco by car via paved highway.

Our member is 33 years of age and is married. She has two children (14 and 9 years of age); she has a small grocery store and beer stand in her home. She is working on her home using quality materials with the money she earns through her grocery store and sale of beer. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a greater number of cases of beer to be able to increase her income and to continue improving her home.

The member is very grateful for the provided loan and promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Provisioning of her store and beer stand

loans.name: Ni Nengah Wiratna

texts.id: Tidak terasa waktu sudah berlalu. Enam bulan sudah Ni Nengah Wiratna bergabung dengan program ternak babi yang ada di Dinari. Selama eman bulan ini, Ni Nengah Wiratna sudah dua kali panen babi. Karena Ni Nengah Wiratna memelihara babinya hanya tiga bulan, lalu dijual. Dari dua kali panen ini,  Wiratna mendapatkan hasil yang lumayan. Kini Wiratna mengajukan pinjaman lagi untuk menambah modal usahanya. Kini Wiratna baru mempunyai 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Rencananya Dia akan menambah beberapa ekor lagi dari uang pinjaman yang diberikan Kiva melalui Yayasan Dinari. Dengan harapan usahanya memelihara pengemukan babi guling ini dapat berkembang. Sehingga Dia dapat membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Terlebih lagi kebutuhan gizi anaknya yang baru berusia 1 tahun.
texts.en:
Ni Nengah Wiratna participated in Dinari pig farming program six months ago. During that period she was able to harvest her piglets twice. She earned a considerable amount of profit from this business.

At the moment she still has 3 piglets. She is planning to participate in her 2nd Dinari loan program so she buy more piglets to raise.

She is hoping to earn more money she can help her family's economy, in particular to ensure enough money to buy nutritious food to raise her one year old baby.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 27 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Katoma Mercy Kobusigye Nzera Group

texts.en:
K. Nzera is age 45 and married with five children and five dependents, all schooling. She has been selling groceries (sweet bananas, tomatoes, onions, etc.) for over ten years.

Nzera is using the loan to purchase grocery items such as sweet bananas, tomatoes, onions, etc. Her dream is to purchase a motorcycle for daily income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as sweet bananas, tomatoes, onions, etc.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua O. is a thirty-four-year old woman. She is married with a child. She sells jewelry and bottled ice kenkey. She sells iced kenkey to the community’s manual workers in the afternoon. Bottled ice kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, boiled, mixed with sugar and milk and refrigerated. It is enjoyed with bread or meat pie. Many Ghanaian manual workers enjoy it as lunch.

Efua wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, sugar and soft drinks to increase her sales and make additional income. She is a member of the community group called Sharp Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and to exert peer pressure to repay loans.

loans.use: Buy more ingredients and soft drinks

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel S. is from the village of Biasong. She is 29 years old. Ritchel is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Ritchel owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ritchel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Ritchel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jenny Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Jenny es socia del Banco Comunal San Martín. Ella tiene 29 años, es divorciada, y tiene dos hijos: un varón de 11 años y una niña de 7 años, además ella actualmente está embarazada de 4 meses. No sabe el sexo de la guagua todavía; piensa que puede ser otra mujer pero independientemente ya está feliz con tener un varón y una mujer, así que será feliz con cualquier de las dos opciones. 
Jenny es estilista en su propio gabinete de belleza, donde hace cortes, colores y pinta las uñas de sus clientes. Lleva 10 años con este negocio. Antes tenía un local donde atendía a sus clientes, pero como está embarazada ahora no puede trabajar tanto como antes, porque le ha dado un poco de depresión y tiene que descansar. Entonces, ha decidido cerrar su local por un tiempo y trabajar de casa en casa por un tiempo. De esta manera ahorrará en el arriendo del local pero todavía mantendrá a su base de clientela.  
Jenny pidió un préstamo de $550, el cual será invertido para pagar la escuela de su hija y pagar el arriendo de su casa (la cual alquila de su mamá). Su ex marido debería pagar la educación de su hija, pero se ha atrasado un poco en el pago de la pensión de la niña y por eso le toca a Jenny pagarlo. 
Jenny tiene como meta para el futuro comprarse un pequeño terreno para construir una casa propia. Lleva ya un año sacando préstamos de la Fundación Espoir, y dice que le gusta porque es más fácil y le piden menos papeles que en un banco tradicional. “Me ayuda bastante,” dice.
texts.en:
Jenny is a member of the San Martín Community Bank. She is 29 and divorced. She has two children, an 11 year old boy and a 7 year old girl. She is four months pregnant. She does not yet know the sex of the baby; she thinks it might be another girl. Regardless, she is happy to have a boy and a girl, and she will be happy with either of the two options. Jenny is a stylist in her own beauty salon where she cuts hair, colors hair, and gives manicures to her customers. She has had this business for ten years. Before, she had a place where she took care of customers. But, as she is now pregnant, she cannot work as much as before. The pregnancy has given her a bit of depression, and she has to rest. Therefore, she has decided to close her place for a while and work from house to house for a while. This way she will save on the rent of her local, but she will still keep her customer base. Jenny has asked for a $550 loan, which she will use to pay her daughter’s school and pay the rent for her house (she rents from her mother). Her ex husband should pay for their daughter’s education. But, he is a little behind in paying support, so it falls to Jenny to pay it. Jenny’s future goal is to buy a small piece of land where she can build her own house. She has been getting loans from the Fundación Espoir for one year. She likes it because it is much easier and they ask for less paperwork than a traditional bank. “They help me a lot,” she says.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her daughter's school and rent for her house

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Vith M., who is forty-eight years old, resides in a medium-size stone house with her family members, located in Phnom Penh City, where she earns a living selling fresh fish and some vegetables. She sells her goods in Psa Takmao Market, which is a very busy place. She is married and has seven children, most of whom are employed in different jobs. Her husband helps with the responsibility of providing the family’s daily food by repairing vehicles. Vith M. is taking out a loan, of which 60% will be used to improve her business and the rest to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To improve her business and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Elizabeth Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil casada y es madre de 1 niño, ella tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta (educación).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir fideos al por mayor.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar fideos todas las variedades al por mayor.

Su sueño es poner comprarse una casa y educar a su hijo.

A ella le gusta mucho la unión en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a member of the community bank “The 30th of August” in the district of Llave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 24 years old, is married and has one child. She has studied at the college level but does not have a degree. She has worked with the “Manuela Ramos Movement” for four years. Her first loan was for 300.00 new soles, money that she used to purchase noodles wholesale. Actually, Elizabeth is asking for an additional loan of 3,000.00 new soles. She will use the loan to buy a variety of noodles wholesale. Her dreams are to buy a house and provide an education for her child. She very much appreciates her involvement in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale noodles.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine E. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 26 years old. Geraldine is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Geraldine operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Geraldine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is thirty – nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. All are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Joyce is a food vendor. She sells rice porridge in the mornings in her locality. She prepares the food in her house of residence and hawks to sell. Joyce buys her bags of rice and other ingredients from Kumasi at affordable prices. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es:
El señor José Javier López es padre de familia y tiene cuatro hijos de deferente edad el deponer un techo de madera la frente de la casa para cubrirla del sol.
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabaja.
Don José Javier planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene por su trabaja como jardinero en una compañía.
texts.en:
José Javier López has four children of different ages. He needs to put a roof on the front of the house to cover it from the sun. That is why he is asking for a loan to buy the material. He will undertake the improvement with an additional schedule at work. José Javier plans to pay for the loan with the income he gets for his work as a gardener for a company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a wood roof on the front of the house

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon T. is 61 years old and a resident of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She currently sells natural medicine to earn a living. The medicine is made from many kinds of root trees. She normally buys the root from the people who carved from the forest and then she makes the medicine them and sells it to patients. She earn an average of $4 per day, and she has been in the business more than four years. Chhuon T. has three children; two of them are married and the other one is single, who works for a garment factory. Chhuon T. said that her family living conditions are not so comfortable, because her house often cracks down during the falling heavy rains. To solve this obstacle, she is looking for a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. (pictured with her daughter), is a widow and has four children. One of them was married and now lives outside the family home. Two other children are garment factory workers and another one is in school. She lives along national road number one, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sopheap has been selling vegetables for 20 years. She buys them from farmers in her village for resale in the local market. By the way, the supporting pillars of her house are old and broken. Sopheap is asking for her first loan of $500 to build new pillars of her house and replace the older ones.

loans.use: To replace the supporting pillars of her house.

loans.name: Marcelita

texts.en:
Marcelita is engaged in a retailing business in which she sells different kinds of frozen foods such as tocino (a cured meat product native to the Philippines, usually made out of pork and similar to ham and bacon), longganisa (sausages flavoured with indigenous spices), hot dogs, and so on.

Her products are very consumable in their village and, for this reason, she would like to obtain additional revolving capital of Php 8,000 to increase her products as well as her profits. She hopes to expand her business to meet the demands of her customers. According to her, she will increase the number of frozen foods that she retails whenever her loan is granted.

Marcelita is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is already married and has children of school age and hopes to be more profitable in her business to support the needs of her growing children. She and her husband are working hard just to attain their dream for their children which is that they finish their studies and have a good future someday. With their business, they know that they can reach their dreams.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 30-year-old single man. He has owned a special shop for car interiors since 2004 to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Today, Mohamad is asking for a loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a sewing machine specialized for car interiors in order to develop his business.

loans.use: purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris F. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Maricris is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maricris owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Maricris has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maricris joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Maricris is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Maricris from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José González Casco  es de Jejui, es casado, tiene 47 años, con casa propia,  esta casado con la señora Francisca Báez Godoy de 45 años de edad.

         Tiene despensa con 7 años de funcionamiento que es atendida por su señora, el señor trabajo como vendedor ambulante, vende artículos farmacéuticos y de mercerías en general, tiene una motocicleta en el cual se desplaza, También se dedica a la agricultura ( maiz y sesamo ).
Este crédito fue solicitado para la compra de mercaderías para abastecer la suba de demanda de estas épocas de fiestas.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose G. Casco is from Jejui. He's married, 47 years old, and owns his own home. He is married to Francisca Baez Godoy who is 45 years old.

He has a store that has been operating for 7 years, which is run by his wife. He works as a street vendor, selling pharmceutical items and general merchandise. He has a motorcycle he gets around in. He also works in agriculture (corn and sesame). This loan was requested for the purchase of merchandise to meet the rise in demand during this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of general merchandise such as sugar, flour, baked goods, ingredients.

loans.name: Aris

texts.en: Aris was born in 1953. He is married and has four children. He lives in the Absheron region with his family. He has transported loads for seven years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manat to buy spare parts for his truck to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Claudia Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene mucha responsabilidad con su familia, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para llevara el pan de cada día su hogar. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa, ella tiene una hija de 13 años, es la razón más fundamental por la que ella lucha y trabaja fuertemente para proporcionarle a su hija estudios dignos, sufragar los gastos de su familia. Por lo que su esposo también contribuye mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues el brinda los servicios de mecánico juntos contribuyen a mejorar sus condiciones. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, tallas extra granes, vestidos, camisas formales y pantalones de vestir que es lo que más le solicitan sus clientes. Su deseo es tener una tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina has many family responsibilities, but she has always enjoyed working to provide for her family. Her job is buying and selling clothing. She has a 13-year old daughter who is the main reason why she puts in a lot of effort and works hard to provide her with a decent education and pay for household expenses. Her husband, who is a mechanic, also contributes to household income. Together they are improving their lot in life. Marina is asking for a loan to buy pants, extra-large garments, dresses, dress shirts and pants--the items most requested by her customers. Her greatest wish is to have a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Preventiva

texts.es:
Preventiva, de 37 años, vive en una casa alquilada, en compañía de su pareja Guillermo (36), quien es albañil, y de sus dos hijas; Jackye (13) y Ana Luz (6).
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza de animales; como cuyes, conejos, carneros y pollos, a los que cuida con mucho esmero hasta que crezcan y engorden y los pueda vender a los comerciantes de los mercados de su localidad. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que se entretiene mucho con los animales y no es difícil, además tiene la ayuda de sus hijas. Con las ganancias obtenidas puede ayudar a su esposo con los constantes gastos del hogar, además paralelamente siembra papa y maíz, cuya cosecha comercializa en los mercados de su zona.
Siendo una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de animales, ya que sabe que este negocio es muy rentable.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que sabe que solo así podrá acceder a otros préstamos en adelante. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de carneros, cuyes y pollos, los que engordará para luego comercializar.
texts.en:
Preventiva is 37 years old and lives in a rented house with her partner Guillermo (age 36) and their two daughters, Jackye (age 13) and Ana Luz (age 6).

For the past four years she has been raising animals such as guinea pigs, rabbits, sheep, and chickens. She takes great care in looking after her animals until they are large enough to be sold to merchants at the local market. What she enjoys about her work is that it is easy and the animals keep her entertained. At the same time, it helps her support her daughters. The money she has earned has allowed her to help her husband with the constant household expenses. Preventiva also grows potatoes and corn, which she sells at the local markets. Being an enterprising woman, she has plans in the future to buy more animals because she knows this business is very profitable.

This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to complete her payments on time because that is the only way for her to access additional loans in the future. With the money she is requesting, Preventiva will buy more sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens to fatten so that she can sell them later.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Since June 2007, Beatriz has been running a hog-raising business.  She is 53 years old with three children.  Her business helps in providing the basic needs of her family.  She needs more capital to continue with her piggery business and plans to make an expansion.  She’s requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for buying feed and piglets.

loans.use: feed and pigs

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Sebastiana L. del Barrio San Rafael D. Ciudad del Este. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la Zona.
Actualmente el comite se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante con mucho ezperanza en salir adelante todas juntas, ellas tienen mucha ayuda D. los asesores D. la Fundación Paraguaya, en cuanto a capacitaciones y sesoramiento sobre sus actividades. 
La Señora Señora Sebastiana se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesas y gaseosas, para lo cual desD. ya muy tempranas horas se moviliza; para la compra D. los ingredientes necesarios para la hamburguesa, panificados, huevos, verduras, etc., al mismo tiempo D. controlar y recibir las bebidas que revenderá.
texts.en:
Ms. Sebastiana Leguizamon from the San Rafael neighborhood of Ciudad del Este started this committee. She contacted her friends and neighbors to form this committee in the area. Currently, the committee is working together with a lot of hope for success. They have a lot of help from the Fundacion Praguaya's advisors in regards to training and advice about their activities. Ms. Sebastiana works selling hamurgers and soda. She is on the move very early buying the ingredients needed for the hamburguers: bread, eggs, veggies etc., while managing and receiving the beverages she'll resell.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquiring ingredients such as meat, bread, vegetables and pasta.

loans.name: Surangika

texts.en:
Surangika is a 27-year-old married woman who has a daughter and lives in Kekanadura, Matara.

With the help of her husband, Surangika has operated a business for five years now producing ice cream. 

She has asked for a loan of 30,000 LKR from BRAC Sri Lanka to buy a deep-freezer and she hopes to buy a vehicle in future to distribute her ice cream.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy a deep-freezer

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 38 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Iván (40), que es chofer, y de sus 4 hijos menores de edad.

Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la comercialización de granos verdes (habas y alverjas) en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. El negocio al que se dedica es muy rentable, ya que le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten solventar los constantes gastos del hogar, junto a su esposo.
Manifiesta que no le agrada mucho despertarse todos los días muy temprano, pero el sacrificio tiene recompensa con las ventas diarias. Además puede estar libre todas las tardes para dedicarse a la crianza de sus hijos y a las labores del hogar. 
Edith tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como por ejemplo instalar un negocio en su casa para atenderlo durante sus ratos libres, además quiere ampliar su producción para vender en mayor cantidad en el mercado mayorista. 

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues es un grupo bastante organizado y no se atrasan en el pago de sus cuotas. Edith tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de más mercadería para abastecer mejor su negocio y así continuar vendiendo granos verdes.
texts.en:
Edith, 38, lives in her own home with her husband, Iván, 40, who is a driver and their four minor children. She has sold raw grains (broad beans and peas) for the last 7 years in the city’s wholesale market. Her business is quite profitable because it generates good profits that allow her to meet, with help from her husband, household expenses. She says that she doesn’t enjoy having to get up so early every morning but the sacrifice is rewarded by her daily sales. Besides, she can then be free in the afternoon to concentrate on raising her children and doing her household chores. Edith has many plans for the future, for example: setting up a business in her house that she can tend to in her free time; she also wants to increase production to have larger amounts to sell in the wholesale market. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people that make the loan possible that will allow her to stay in business. She is also very satisfied with the work in her communal bank because it is quite organized and they don’t fall behind with their payments. Edith plans to use the requested funds to buy more stock for her business and thus continue selling raw grains.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains.

loans.name: Francis Koem

texts.en:
Francis Komen C. is a single, 26-year-old, commercial farmer. He started his business 2 years ago and makes a monthly profit of Kshs 3,600. 

He has received a loan of Kshs 10,000 from KADET. This loan will be used to expand his farming business as he plans to buy more farm inputs to expand production. Francis has never borrowed from another source before KADET. A friend, who is a KADET client, introduced him to this organization.

Francis‘s farm is in Kaptallam. His clients are business women who sell groceries to the nearby college.

If this loan boosts his business, Francis will use the extra profit to improve his living standards. He hopes and dreams of transforming his farming from crop to livestock. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Tum H., 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. She is a food seller with an income of 8 USD per day. Her husband helps his wife in the business.

H. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly tiene 43 años, es madre soltera con 4 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que su actividad necesita ya que la mayoría de sus clientes le realizan diferentes pedidos. Por lo que es una mujer que demuestra que salir adelante para ella y su familia es muy importante. Este el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de materia prima como calzado, ropa para damas, jóvenes, vestidos, faldas y pantalones.
texts.en:
Nelly is 43 years old and a single mother with 4 children under her care. She is involved in clothing purchases and sales and has been in this business for more than 21 years. This is not the first time that she is requesting a loan. She is always waiting to see what her business needs since the majority of her customers make different requests. She is a woman that shows that helping her family to progress is very important. This is why the loan is for the purchase of raw material such as shoes, clothing for women and teenagers, dresses, skirts and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres De Deborah 3 Group

texts.en:
