Luz, 60, is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Deborah (Women of Deborah), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with four dependents.

Luz is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado (general store) by purchasing rice, beans and canned goods to sell.

She will use the profits to repair the roof to her home.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en:
In Krang Roluos village, Kandal province, these four members make up this group loan. Mrs. Pao C. has been selected as the leader by all the members. Each member will use their portion of the loan for their own purpose to support their family.

Mrs. Pao C. is a farmer who owns one hectare (2.5 acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family; she is also a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Boeurn Bou, owns a rice mill and he is also a rice wine maker. She is a mother of a child who is helping them with their businesses.

Mrs. Pao C.’s problem is that her pigs are too small to sell. So, to solve her problem, she is applying for a loan to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: A. Juliette est née en Novembre 1959 et vit depuis cinquante et un an à Enagnon, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Juliette est mariée à DABOUTON Latifou et est mère d'un enfant. Le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Juliette subvient avec son mari aux différentes charges de la famille. Juliette n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Juliette vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons, etc.) à Cotonou. De façon secondaire, Juliette vend des produits de brasserie (boissons). Juliette s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et dans les dépôts de Cotonou. Juliette exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et a déjà obtenu un prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Juliette désire élever le niveau de son activité et augmenter sa production, pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Juliette sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Juliette A. was born in November, 1959 in Enagnon, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she's been living for 51 years. She's married to Latifou DABOUTON, and the mother of one child. The couple has two other children to support. Juliette provides for the family with her husband. Juliette only attended elementary school. To provide for herself and for her children, she sells food (corn paste with fish sauce, etc.) in Cotonou. As a secondary business, she also sells beer. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, and in warehouses in Cotonou. Juliette has been running this business for three years, and already obtained a loan, which she repaid without problem. She would like to bolster her business and increase her production, in order to better meet customer demand. This is why she's seeking a second loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, condiments for sauce, fish, and peanut oil

loans.name: Otgonbat

texts.en: Otgonbat L. is 32-years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. While her husband helps her out with her business producing wooden items in their town, her two daughters attend a middle school. The business is very family-oriented. Her husband designs and produces their products, such as frames for mirrors and portraits, while Otgonbat paints and decorates them. The couple started their wooden products business in 1997. The business has been successful and they have grown a stable operation. Otgonbat attributes her success to the quality of her products, which are much desired by her customers. Otgonbat says, "My husband and I are planning to expand our business to making ger furniture and assemblies. We are trying our best to finish our new house in which we would be more comfortable than today." She is a hard-working and modest woman that is requesting a loan to purchase more wood and paints for their products business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and paints

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es: La señora Laura Elena M. Hernández esta preocupada por el bienestar de su madre pues esta pasando por una enfermedad, lo cual los doctores le están  requiriendo que sea operada. Laura esta muy agradecida con la persona que la crío desde pequeña y que ahora se ve en circunstancias muy ajenas a ella. Laura recurre a esta institución para que se le apoye en el problema que ella tiene, aunque su esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi no cuentan con todo el dinero que le están pidiendo para hacer la operación.
texts.en:
Señora Laura Elizabeth M. Hernández is worried about her mother's health, as she is ill and the doctors say she must have an operation. Elizabeth is very grateful to her mother, the woman who raised her since she was tiny and whom she now sees in a state so unlike herself. Laura has come to the field partner Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP) for help. Although her husband works as a taxi driver, they would not be able to find enough money for the operation on thier own.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An operation for her mother

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. is a widow taking care of six dependents. She has not acquired any form of education.

Ama sells bags of charcoal at Elmina and uses her income in providing the basic needs of the family such as food, clothing and shelter. She will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to meet the demand of her customers.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to complete her storehouse.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Nitty

texts.en:
Nitty D. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 58 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her husband also spends time transporting people around their community. Nitty said they bought his motorcycle to have another source of income.

Nitty joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nitty is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 48 years old. Marilou is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, lotion, soap & powder in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying damask cloth

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom S. is 54 years old and a resident of Battambang Province. She is married and has five children, four of them are single, and the one remaining is married and living in her own house. Yom's husband’s name is Morn Meit. He works as a farmer, and he is also a fisherman.

Yom earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house. She raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. This family can earn a profit of approximately $2 per day. 

Currently, two of her children have an opportunity to work overseas, but they need money to pay for the document fee. Because her savings are not enough to make it possible, Yom S. would like to use her loan to pay for her children's document fees.

loans.use: To pay for document fee

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
Since 2004 S. Ikromjon has been a livestock farmer. He breeds sheep and cattle. He is married and he has 3 children for whom he needs to support and give a proper education. Ikromjon has improved his financial situation considering that his father is also cattle breeder and from his childhood he has gained a rich experience in the livestock business. Currently, his biggest dream is to expand his business and therefore, his biggest need is to get a loan in order to buy more cows. Ikromjon is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to improve his living.  

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 46 years old and married. She has 4 children aged 20, 19, 15 and 13. Elizabeth is challenged to sustain her children's education since all four of them go to school. 

Elizabeth is engaged in farming. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. Elizabeth has been farming for quite some time now. She says her farm helps her family a lot and she hopes to expand her business. 

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina P. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish vending business.  She lives in  Brgy. Bal-os, Basay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Marcelina is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her fish vending business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Marcelina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her fish vending business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila, tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella nació en la distrito de San Salvador provincia del Cusco y actualmente vive junto con su esposo en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Lucila se dedica la elaboración de artesanía de lana de alpaca, llama y oveja, ella elabora ponchos y mantas desde las 11 mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Ya son siete años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien. 

Lucila espera recibir $ 600 USD de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana. El sueño de Lucila es exportar sus productos a otros países. 

Lucila pertenece al banco comunal “Velasco Astete” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el noveno año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Lucila, 52, is married and has three children.  She was born in San Salvador district, Cusco province and currently lives with her husband in Cusco.

Lucila makes woolen crafts from alpaca, llama and sheep.  She makes ponchos and blankets from 11am until 5pm.  She’s been in this business for 7 years now and does quite well.

Lucila expects to receive a $600 USD loan that she’ll use to buy materials like wool, for example.  Her dream is to export her wares to other countries.

Lucila is a member of Asociacón Arariwa’s “Velasco Astete” communal bank which is in its ninth year of operation and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials like wool, for example.

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline A. is from the town of Banga. She is 23 years old. Marline is married and has a 3-year-old child. To make a living, Marline owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs and ducks. Marline's husband is a farmer and she also helps him maintain their rice farm.

Marline joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marline has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marline is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets, ducks and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets, ducks and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, de 29 años de edad, reside en Chinameca departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo y dos hijas de 2 y 8 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender cosméticos y lociones, trabaja de lunes a sábado, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería como cremas, lociones, labiales, bases de maquillaje, shampoo. 
Esta compra le ayudara a disponer de suficientes productos para comercializar, ofrecer a los y las clientes productos de calidad, esperando sean aceptados y comprados por estos.
Su aspiración es que a través del negocio pueda sacar a sus hijos adelante, que se preparen con los estudios, así también estabilizar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, lives in Chinameca in the department of San Miguel. She lives with her husband and two daughters who are 2 and 8 years old. She sells cosmetics and lotions, working from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan at this time in order to buy merchandise like creams, lotions, lipstick, makeup bases, and shampoo.

This purchase will help her have enough products to sell, so she can offer her customers quality products that she hopes they will like and buy.

Her hope is that, through this business, she will be able to help her children get ahead by preparing them for their studies. She also hopes to be able to stabilize their economic situation.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, lipstick, makeup bases, and shampoo

loans.name: Efua Eizabeth

texts.en:
Efua Eizabeth B., who has five dependents, is married to a farmer and together they feed, clothe and educate their children. Efua sells locally-made lamps and food items such as palm fruits at Kokowada, near Elmina. Demand for food items is increasing, so she is requesting a loan to buy extra food and additional items requested by her customers.

Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

In the picture Efua is shown holding a sample of the locally-made lamp,

loans.use: To buy extra food items and additional products requested by her customers.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ar: عزيزة في عمر 44 سنة متزوجة ولها وله اولاد تعمل في محل بيع البسة واحذية اوروبية مستعملة لها في عملها 5 سنوات تحب عملها وتتقنه جيدا دائمة التطور والتجدد فهي نشيطة ومثابرة تحب ان تزيد من مدخول محلها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع المحل من خلالها تطوير عائلتها وتطوير نفسها خاصة انها هي من تساعد عائلتها على زيادة مدخولهم وتكوين نفسهم
texts.en: Aziza is 44 years old and married with children. She works in a store which sells used European clothing and shoes. She has worked there for five years and likes her work, which she performs well. She is always improving and developing her business, as she is very energetic and diligent. With a loan from al-Majmoua she would like to increase her income from the store by buying new merchandise and expanding her store. In doing so, she hopes to develop herself and her family, especially since she is the one responsible for helping her family to increase their income and to shape themselves for the future.

loans.use: To expand her store by purchasing new merchandise

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Duk S., 47, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. Duk sells vegetables, earning an income of about 4 USD per day. Each month the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 40 USD on other necessary expenses.

Duk is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase charcoal to stock for sale. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hayanhyarvaa

texts.en:
Hayanhyarvaa is a 47-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in their own house in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife and daughter, age 23, are unemployed while his son, age 24, helps with his business. He manages a public-transportation service in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 1999 with only one minibus. With 12 years of business experience, he has been able to build a good relationship both with his partners and customers. Now he owns two minibuses and earns 70,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) daily. He also pays 10,000 MNT of salary to his conductors per day and his net monthly profit is 400,000-500,000 MNT. 

Since beginning his business operation, his living conditions have been rising tentatively. He is happy to feel improvements both in his life and in his career. He is a very delightful and cheerful person who was thankful with our bank service. He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to repair his house in order to make his life much better.

loans.use: to repair his house

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama T. is a single parent taking care of three children. She is involved in multiple businesses, one of which is the sale of provisions and fish at Abbina near Elmina, a business she has been engaged in for four years. She wants to expand this business, and the funds from this loan will be added to her capital so that she will be able to fill her shop with more items to offer for sale. 

She plans to reinvest the profit back into her business and also to save toward the further education of her children.

loans.use: to add to her capital so that she will be able to fill her shop with more items to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some beverages for resale.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (in-laws). Milly has a pub business. She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days each week. Milly sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Milly has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerry cans of local gin. She also generates additional income through selling onions and cabbages. The main business challenges for Milly include defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big so that she owns a fully stocked bar. Milly lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 25 years old, single and has no children. He has a small retail shop, which he has run for three years.
To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Charles hopes to generate greater profits and take care of himself. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children and has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rosemarie has had her business for three years.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy snacks, bread, and beverages to sell. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread, and beverages

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: Cristian es una joven muy trabajadora para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija ella esta casada con el señor Juan Pablo el cual es obrero ellos tienen una niña de un año, Cristian se dedica a realizar pulseras, collares, aretes de fantasía y también hace accesorios para niñas como moños, diademas y las vende con sus conocidas y en su casa ya que ahí vende también dulces, refrescos y tiene unas maquinitas (juegos de video). Esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para realizar los accesorios para dama  y para surtir su negocio de dulces. Ella comenta que es la primera vez que se mete a un crédito y espera que le baya muy bien ya que podrá hacer crecer su negocio poco a poco. La meta que tiene para el negocio es abrir un local donde pueda vender ropa para dama y zapatos.
texts.en:
Cristian is a woman who works very hard so that her young daughter can get ahead. She is married to Sr. Juan Pablo, a laborer. Their daughter is a year old. Cristian makes bracelets, necklaces, and earrings. She also makes accessories for girls, such as bows and tiaras, and sells them to acquaintances and from her home. In addition Cristian sells candy, soft drinks, and offers video game machines.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials for making women’s accessories, but part of the money will be used to restock her candy business. Cristian says this is the first time she has received a loan and hopes that it will go well so that she can see her business grow gradually. Her goal for her business is to open a shop where she can sell women’s clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to acquire materials for making women's accessories and to buy candy to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 65 años vive en la urbanización los Robles  él es pensionado y hace 4 años se dedica al negocio de restaurante en compañía de su cónyuge y una ayudante. Su Restaurante Yoly   funciona en   en la vivienda de su propiedad,  donde éste reside con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 21 a 28 años.  En este restaurante Samuel vende desayunos y almuerzos a clientes que trabajan en los alrededores de una zona principal donde está ubicado y a vecinos en general.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con el comprará silletería, adecuará el negocio y también comprará materias primas como arroz por bulto, pollo, pescado y tubérculos. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y generar mayores ingresos porque aun presenta  poco capital de trabajo,  ya que sus ventas en general son de contado y maneja pocos inventarios de materias primas e insumos y  las compras que realiza  de contado y casi a diario en graneros del barrio. Esto es justamente lo que resolvería su credikiva, pues le dará la posibilidad de comprar al mayor volumen y disminuir los  costos de transporte, mejorar las condiciones de atención y preparación de alimentos.
texts.en:
Samuel, who is 65 years old, lives in the Los Robles residential area. He is a pensioner, and four years ago he entered the restaurant business with his wife and an assistant. His Restaurant Yoly is in the living area of his property, where he lives with his wife, and he has three children, ages 21 to 28. In his restaurant, Samuel sells breakfasts and lunches to customers who work in the areas surrounding the principal zone where it is located and to neighbors in general. His Kiva loan will be his first financing; with it he will buy a set of chairs, outfit his business, and also buy primary ingredients such as rice in bulk, chicken, fish, and root vegetables. 

His goal is to make his business grow and generate greater income because he still produces little working capital, since his sales in general are for cash and he carries small inventories of basic ingredients and supplies. He makes his purchase for cash from suppliers in the neighborhood almost every day. This is exactly the problem that his Kiva loan will solve, since it will give him the possibility of buying in greater volume, decreasing his transportation costs, and improving his attention to customers and the preparation of food.

loans.use: to buy a set of chairs, outfit his business, and also buy basic ingredients such as rice in bulk, chicken, fish, and root vegetables.

loans.name: Bassel

texts.en: Bassel is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a furniture painter for the past eight years. In 2006, Bassel was able to open his own shop.  He completes his work in a professional way and always meets his clients' demands. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new paint and an air compressor. In the future, he is looking to invest in new materials to further expand his business. He hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase paint and an air compressor

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua cooks banku, which is made from maize, and she serves it with fried fish and hot red pepper sauce in Abura. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. As part of her responsibilities, she pays the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to obtain fresh fish to fry and maize to cook. Her future plan for her business is to build a shop.

loans.use: to obtain fresh fish to fry and maize to cook.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She has 1 child in school, and she works very hard to provide for her children.

Carolina runs a grocery store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, groceries, etc., in her grocery store.

She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as milk, noodles, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Carolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah has operated her clothes shop for the last three years.  She is 29 years old, married to Peter, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She has been loaned KES 10,000 and she plans to use the loan to buy a sewing machine so that she can start making her own clothes to sell.

In the future, Serah hopes to own a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine so that she can start making her own clothes to sell.

loans.name: Narorn

texts.en:
Narorn is 47 years old and raises pigs. She earns $3 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver who earns $10 per day. They have two children, both of whom are studying. Every month Narorn has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $30 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 
Narorn would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy pigs, and pig food to feed them, which she will then sell. She wants to buy more pigs to raise so she can make a good profit at this time. She also wants to help one of her children to work in Korea where one can make more income than in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig food.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en: Peterson is a focused businessman and is single. For the past year, he has been selling clothes to earn a living.  He has grown his business and thus improved his living standards.  He has managed to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers.  In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. With the 20,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Cecilia Ignacia

texts.es: Cecilia Ignacia tiene 55 años, su actividad es una pulpería que administra desde hace 10 años. Cecilia es una mujer luchadora siempre ha demostrado que le preocupa pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella ofrece los productos de grano básicos, papel higiénico, calzado, bolsos, cremas, tratamientos, sal, huevos, leche entre otros productos. Ella inicia su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche que sus clientes llegan a comprar.
texts.en:
Cecilia Ignacia is 55 years old. She has had a grocery store for ten years. Cecilia is a fighter who has always seen to it that she makes her loan payments on time. 

She sells basic grains, toilet paper, shoes, bags, creams, treatments, milk, eggs, milk and other products. She starts work at 7:00 AM every morning and works until 9:00 PM in the evening in order to be available to her clients.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, toilet paper, shoes, bags, creams, treatments, milk, eggs, milk and other products

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 26 años, a pesar de no tener trabajo estable, decidió emprender su negocio que es una joyería, uno de sus problemas es que su esposo quien se encarga de ayudarle en el negocio pero tiene problemas en la columna y algunas veces no le puede ayudar en su negocio. Ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años a su cargo ella se encarga de proporcionarle lo necesario. Este será su segundo crédito con el que comprara plata, oro, perlas, herramientas entre otros.
texts.en: María Elena, 26, despite not having a stable job decided to start her own business: a jewelry store.  One of the problems is that her husband is the person who helps her in the business but he has problems with his spine and sometimes is unable to do so.  She has a 7-year-old son in her care and she takes care of providing everything necessary for him.    This will be her second loan and she’ll use it to buy silver, gold, pearls and tools, among others.

loans.use: to buy silver, gold, pearls and tools, among others.

loans.name: Jydyzkan

texts.ru:
Жылдызкан  42 года, не замужем, воспитывает двоих детей. Жылдызкан по специальности – преподаватель и проработав учителем в местной школе в течении 15 лет,  зарекомендовала себя как активный, ответственный и трудолюбивый человек.
	К сожалению, зарплата преподавателя в сельской местности не высока, и в поисках пути обеспечения достойного будущего для своих детей, Жылдызкан решила заняться откормом и перепродажей скота. Начав со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день Жылдызкан имеет доход в сумме 5,000 сом раз в два месяца. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдызкан обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В будущем, она планирует продолжать свой бизнес в животноводстве, который даст возможность Жылдызкан  оплатить высшее образование для своих детей.
texts.en: Jydyzkan is 42 years old, single and is raising two children. Jydyzkan is a teacher and has been working at the local school for the last 15 years. She has a reputation of an energetic, responsible and hardworking person. Unfortunately, a village teacher's salary is not very high and to be able to provide for her children's future Jydyzkan is supplementing her income by raising cattle. She started with a small amount of money, 5000 som (KGS) and now her business yields a profit of 5000 som every two months. In order to further expand her herd Jydyzkan has turned to "Bai Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) so that she can purchase more cattle. In the future, she is planning to expand her livestock business so that she can collect enough money to pay for college education for both of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en: Nihad is a 36 years old young man. He is married with two sons and two daughters. He is a taxi driver with low income. Nihad wants to repairs to his taxi such as: painting, changing the engine, changing the tires, etc, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay for all of this, so he needs to take a loan of amount $2,000 from FATEN. When Nihad gets the loan from FATEN, he will be able to make all the necessary repairs his taxi needs, the taxi efficiency will increase, and Nihad will work extra hours to increase and improve his income. All of this will enable Nihad to provide better living conditions for his family. Nihad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1964 à Sikasso, Madame Aminata est mariée et mère de huit enfants, elle vit chez son époux avec ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Mancourani I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initiée depuis plus de  vingt ans à cette activité génératrices de revenus. Elle jouit d’une grande réputation dans cette activité de vente de condiments, qui a lieu, à la maison et au marché de Mancourani I dont elle dispose une place.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cessait d’accroitre, elle décida ainsi de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ 2 années. Après 2 prêts individuel tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter  5 seaux de pâtes d’arachides, 4 cartons maggie, 3 cartons concentrée de tomate,  3 sacs d’oignons et 3 cartons de moutarde, à Sikasso 
Madame Aminata vend  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. 
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1964 in Sikasso, Aminata is married and mother to eight children. She lives with her husband and children as part of a large traditional family in Mancourani I, one of the popular neighborhoods of the town Sikasso (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

After having managed several businesses without success, she started this business which generates revenue over twenty years ago. She enjoys a good reputation in this business selling condiments, both from home and in the Mancourani I market where she has a stand. Wanting to satisfy her clientele which kept growing, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso approximately two years ago. After two individual loans both correctly reimbursed, she is on her third individual loan which will allow her to expand her business by purchasing five buckets of peanut paste, four cartons of maggie, three cartons of tomato concentrate, three bags of onions and three cartons of mustard, in Sikasso.

Selling to customers from all sectors of society, Aminata accepts both cash and credit. With this loan, she envisages making a profit of 95 000 FCFA which she will use to contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and has two school going children. He supplies building materials within the town; a business he has run for the last four years. 
Besides this, he also owns rental houses. Dickson learnt of Milango from a friend and joined the organization to obtain credit.
His major challenges include lack of capital and competition from established entrepreneurs. Dickson is applying for a loan of Ksh 80,000 to purchase building materials. He will use the extra income to meet other family needs.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn is 32 years old and has one child who is in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Regina Group

texts.es:
Regina es el nombre de un grupo que esta integrado por nueve mujeres alegres y muy trabajadoras cada una de ellas tiene una actividad económica la cual desarrollan para ayudar a sus esposos a sacar adelante a sus familias y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo esta ubicado en una región Cañera y su clima es cálido ya que esta comunidad se desarrollo a las faldas de los cerros.

La señora Bety es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio una carrera comercial y es madre soltera de tres hijos pero actualmente solo depende de ella el mas pequeño de nombre Jose Carlos de 13 años de edad que estudia la secundaria. Doña Bety platica que ella siempre ha tenido que trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles estudios, ella inicio vendiendo artículos para el hogar (trastes, ollas, basos, platos y toperes) con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad pero conforme fueron pasando los años sus hijos crecieron y los gastos aumentaron y tenia que buscar la manera de obtener mas ingresos asi que como ella cocina muy rico decidió iniciar a vender antojitos mexicanos y comidas corridas desde su hogar y algunas veces hace entregas a domicilio,ella dijo  "ya tengo 6 años de vender articulos del hogar y 3 de vender comida y Gracias a Dios tengo mis clientes y hay vamos poco a poco buscando la manera de salir adelante".
Doña bety necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, crema, queso, aroz, frijol, variedad de frutas y verduras para realizar sus comidas y en la compra de artículos del hogar. 
Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio continue progresando ya que sus planes a futuro son poner un pequeño restaurante.

los miembros de este grupo agradecen ala fundacion el apoyo que les esta dando por medio de este credito para que su negocio y calidad de vida mejoren.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Cristina venta de ropa 
Dulce maria reposteria 
Beatriz venta de joyeria 
Alma delia venta de joyeria 
Margarita venta de Perfumeria
Maria elena venta de pan  
Erika venta de fruta y verduras 
Esmeraldaventa de cosmeticos
texts.en:
The name of this group of 9 cheerful and hardworking women is "Regina."   Each woman has an economic activity that they are developing in order to help their spouses and get ahead with their families, providing them with a better quality of life.  This group is located in a sugar-cane producing region with a warm climate, as this community has developed in the foothills

Bety is one of the  members of this group.  She is 49 years old, and has a business degree.  She is the single mother of 3 children, but now only one of them is dependent upon her - the youngest, 13, who is named Jose Carlos and is in middle school.  

Bety says that she has always had to work in order to provide for her children and give them an education.  She started out selling items for the home (dishes, pots,  glasses, plates and containers) to her friends and neighbors in the community, but as the years went by her children grew and their expenses increased and she had to find a way to increase her income.  So, as she was a very good cook, she decided to start selling Mexican snacks and fast food from her home, and at times she also delivers them to people's homes.  She said "I've already been selling household items for 6 years and selling food for 3, and thanks to God I have my customers, and so gradually we are seeking a way to get ahead."  Bety needs this loan to invest in the purchase of chilies, tomatoes, onions, meat, cream, cheese, rice, beans, and a variety of fruits and vegetables to make her food, and also to buy some household products.  She hopes that with this investment her business will continue to make progress, since she plans in the future to establish a small restaurant. 

The members of this group are grateful to the Fundacion for the support that they are getting in the form of these loans for their businesses so that their quality of life can improve.  The other members of the group are:

Cristina, who sells clothing
Dulce Maria, who makes pastries
Beatriz, who sells jewelry 
Alma Delia, who sells jewelry
Margarita, who sells perfume
Maria Elena, who sells bread
Erika, who sells fruits and vegetables
Esmeralda, who sells cosmetics

loans.use: to buy chilies, tomatoes, onions, meat, cream, cheese, rice, beans, and a variety of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Veronica Del Socorro

texts.es: Verónica es una emprendedora que se le ha brindado apoyo con el financiamiento su negocio a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Verónica  como toda madre busca el bienestar de sus hijos dándole lo mejor. Verónica ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable y con ganas de superación. Verónica actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercadería en general como ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y cosméticos entre otros productos que más demandan.
texts.en: Verónica is an entrepreneur who has availed herself of support with financing.  The business she’s in is general merchandise sales.  Verónica, like all good mothers, seeks her children’s wellbeing providing the best for them.  Verónica has shown herself to be an honest, responsible person who wants to get ahead.  She is currently asking for a loan to invest in her business buying general merchandise like clothes for women, men and children and cosmetics among other products she is asked for.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Pueblo Mágico Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pueblo Mágico decidió el nombre pues querían expresar la sensación de vivir en la localidad de donde son originarios. Es un lugar lleno de encanto, cultura, tradiciones y riqueza natural pues a principios del siglo pasado era de las principales zonas mineras del país. De igual forma, es preferido como destino turístico por su mezcla entre los rasgos autóctonos y los coloniales. Una de las principales atracciones es su carnaval celebrado en la Semana Santa; dicho festejo se caracteriza por un desfile que recorre las calles principales donde, sobre carros alegóricos, personas disfrazadas bailan y conviven con los demás participantes. 
   Esta población es denominada como un centro artesanal pues los lugareños tienen una gran maestría trabajando la cerámica de barro cocido, los tejidos de lana, la orfebrería, los muebles tradicionales y los licores típicos de la región como, por ejemplo, la Chiva. 
   Doña Remedios, o Reme como le dicen de cariño, es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre tiene una actitud entusiasta. Es parte del grupo y siente un profundo cariño por su pueblo y sus tradiciones, “ese vagón solo fue un cachito del tren se quedó ahí pero ahora funciona como restaurante la gente lo conoce muy bien, lo mejor del lugar son los ricos cafés” comenta al referirse a un local muy querido por los habitantes. 
   Elabora uniformes escolares desde hace más de 25 años; “inicialmente era empleada en un taller donde realizan uniformes por eso aprendí; después le enseñé a mi esposo y ahora él sabe más que yo” expresa con una sonrisa y agrega “nosotros iniciamos con una maquina sencilla, sólo elaborando vestidos para niñas”. El taller que abrieron creció gradualmente gracias a los préstamos ofrecidos por VFMéxico y KIVA. En esta ocasión desea comprar tela, hilos, resortes, calcetas y dar mantenimiento a sus máquinas de costura. Su única meta es solventar los gastos de su hogar y dejar un patrimonio a sus hijos. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Natividad María de Jesús quien invertirá en ropa interior; Ruperto, en abarrotes; Guadalupe, en carpintería; Leticia, en ropa y Jonathan, en serigrafía. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Doña Reme ella es quien viste un chaleco color verde.
texts.en:
Pueblo Magico, full of enchantment, culture, traditions; what characterizes this town is its history. It enjoyed great fame in the years around 1900 due to its mineral wealth, which made it worthy of its name.

A mountainous tourist destination with noticeable English and French influences whose three main streets shine like a European villa. A carnival is celebrated during Holy Week, amidst the "Fiestas de El Oro." This party is made up of a parade that runs through the main streets of town, displaying floats and costumes, horseback riding, horse races, and other popular spectacles captivate the town.

In the town center the locals of El Oro offer crafts of all kinds, including ceramic, baked clay, woven wool cloths, handmade gold items, local liquors like "Chiva", and colonial-era furniture, amongst others. The town is also well-known for a carriage that functions now as a restaurant.

Reme states: "That wagon was just a train car that was left there but now functions as a restaurant. People know it very well; the best that is offered are the delicious coffees."

Doña Remedios, or as she is affectionately know, Reme, is a hard-working woman. Always upbeat, she has always had a great entrepreneurial spirit. She is very dedicated to her home. She is 48 years old and has been married to her husband for 27 years. Together they have formed a family with three children, one of whom is still studying in high school.

Reme works making school uniforms and has done so for the last 25 years. "At first I was employed by someone that also worked making school uniforms. That is how I learned. Then I taught my husband and now he knows more than me. We started with just one simple machine and we only made small dresses for girls," Reme recalls. Bit by bit her sewing shop grew thanks to the loans of another financing agency. After a long time working with that lender she learned about VFMexico and Kiva and decided to change. She is now requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic bands, and socks. She will also use her loan to repair and maintain her sewing machines.

She works making uniforms but usually only for orders that the town schools submit, as well as neighboring communities. Besides her special clients, she has an employee that helps her with the fulfillment of all these orders. She buys her materials in Mexico City as often as she needs, usually every 15 days or monthly.

It seems she does not face any roadblocks; her only goal is to grow her business in order to continue paying her bills. Although her children may not finish school and it is her greatest wish that they can do so, now she has a family business where they can all work with no problem.

The members of the group are Natividad Maria de Jesús, who sells underwear, Ruperto who sells groceries, Guadalupe who invests in carpentry, Leticia in clothes and Jonathan in screen printing.

*The photograph was taken in Reme's business. She is in wearing the green vest.

loans.use: to purchase basic supplies like fabric, thread, elastic and other items.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
My name is Martín C. Saucedo. I have 3 years experience selling fruit cocktails here in Nuevo Laredo, and in the summer I sell ice cream. I know the main selling points here in Nuevo Laredo very well and where can I obtain better sales in places like, schools and offices. For that reason I want to buy 2 vehicles (three-wheel) and use them to sell my product. I know that my business can grow, because my fruit cocktails are delicious and famous here in my city. The investment that Mr. Martín C. requires is $ 800.00. he wants to repay in a term of 12 months.

Español

Mi nombre es Martín C. Saucedo; durante 3 años me he dedicado a la venta de fruta de temporada y cuando hace mucho calor aquí en Nuevo Laredo (frontera con USA) vendo helados también; conozco muy bien la ciudad y los puntos donde puedo lograr mejores ventas como son; escuelas y oficinas entre otros; por ello quiero comprar 2 vehículos (triciclos) y surtirlos de los alimentos que vendo; sé que mi negocio puede crecer pues la preparación de mis “cócteles de frutas ya son famosos por su higiene y calidad. La inversión que requiere el Sr. Martín C. es de $ 800.00

loans.use: buy tricycles

loans.name: Filiga

texts.en: Filiga has six children: two passed away, and four stay at home.   Filiga runs a canteen and sells ice-cakes and other snack items.  She sells some of her products at her village school and some at her home.  Her canteen really helps her contribute to the needs of her family.  She struggles most of the time, but she has succeeded.  She receives more than a hundred tala (US$30) a day for running this business.  She is confident about doing everything that will improve her business.  She will use her loan to buy things that she needs (e.g. more products to sell and equipment she needs for her business).  She is delighted about the project she is doing because it gives her money to feed her family.  She has a strong heart and believes that she will become a better businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and additional cooking equipment -- stove, pots and pans for her canteen

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Ms Manuela and her husband, Jose, live on the outskirts of the city of Guachochi in the region of the Sierra Tarahumara. They have two children who attend school. Jose is a musician and works various parties. Their income is very inconsistent due to Jose’s vocation; thus, approximately one year ago Manuela decided to start a small grocery store business with the aim of obtaining an additional income and of helping with her children’s expenses. At the start of her business she began supplying merchandise with her husband’s income and little by little she has increased her sales. Her business is a family endeavor: she manages the business and her children, when available, help her.

She seeks a loan of 475 dollars to supply merchandise to her business now that her sales have increased. She intends to pay back the loan within 6-12 months. Your support of Manuela and her family is greatly appreciated.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Manuela y su esposo Don José viven a las afueras de la ciudad de Guachochi en la región de la Sierra Tarahumara, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela. Don José es músico y trabaja tocando en fiestas, es por eso que sus ingresos son muy variables, debido a ello hace un año aproximadamente Doña Manuela decidió iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con la finalidad de obtener un ingreso adicional y poder ayudarse con los gastos de sus hijos. Al principio de su negocio empezó a surtir de mercancía con los ingresos de su esposo y poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas. Su negocio es familiar, ella esta al frente del mismo y sus hijos le ayudan cuando tienen tiempo.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo por $ 475 USD para surtir de mercancía su negocio, ya que sus ventas se han incrementado últimamente, y piensa pagarlo en un plazo de 6-12 meses. Apoya a Doña Manuela y ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To purchase consumables

loans.name: Bibishoy

texts.en:
Bibishoj is 53. She is married and has 4 dependents. Two of her sons are in Russia and send money for the expenses of their families, who stay with Bibishoj. One of Bibishoy's son got married in Russia and brought his wife to Tajikistan. She stayed some time, bore a child and then left. Now her one-year-old son is with Bibishoj who is looking after the baby.

On the side Bibishoy is managing her business. She has a little shop located on the motorway near her house. Her husband helps her. Her shop is opened all the time for the customers. To increase the assortment of goods, Bibishoj got a loan from Microinvest. Now she hopes to get $1200 for the further extension of her assortment of goods and her business.

loans.use: Add more grocery products

loans.name: Silia

texts.en: Sewing since her mid thirties, Silia enjoys it very much now that she is 50.  It is their source of income to provide for family as well as pay for her children’s education.  Clothes are sewn in any order with any pattern and any style whether it be for men, women, or children.  Schools also recommend her to sew students’ uniforms.  In April, 2007 she became a part of SPBD and appreciates the help the program has given her.  Because she enjoys sewing, she hopes to have a flea market stall in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and sewing equipment

loans.name: Karla Martina

texts.es:
This woman owns a modest clothing stand selling used American clothes (known in Nicaragua as "pacas;" or "bulk clothing.") She has had this business for a bit longer than 12 years, she started it with $105 and the purchase of a small package of bulk clothing. She initially began by informally running her business out of a room of her house, and later moved to the market and began to show her merchandise in a small hut made of wood with a black plastic roof. With the inclement sun in the city of Leon (one of the hottest cities in Nicaragua,) she began to invest in the purchase of the small bulk packages of clothing. Thanks to God (she said herself,) the sales went well enough at first. She had little competition, an inexpensive product, a good location, etc.

The competition increased later on, however, which made things more difficult despite her efforts and sacrifice. Mrs. A. managed to make gradual improvements to her small sales stand, changing the plastic roofing for Zinc to protect her merchandise from the rain. In order to offer better service for her customers, she expanded her space for sales and with some loans she made provisions for her business, little by little. There are still many aspects to improve, however, if we review her business history, the improvement is obvious. Mrs. Karla has 2 children, both are school-aged and studying. Her husband works as an electrician, but it is not a stable job which is why Mrs. Karla's business is the primary source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Esta señora posee un modesto puesto de venta de ropa usada americana (conocida en Nicaragua como pacas) desde hace poco más de 12 años, el cual inició con aproximadamente US$ 105 dólares y la compra de una pequeña paca (paquete de ropa usada), de manera informal en su casa de habitación, luego se traslada al mercado y empieza a exhibir su mercadería en una pequeña caseta hecha de madera y con el techo construido con plástico negro, con el inclemente sol de la ciudad de León (una de las ciudades más calientes de Nicaragua) en ese momento invertía en la compra de dos pequeños paquetes, gracias a Dios (expresa ella misma) la venta le fue bastante bien al principio, poca competencia, un producto barato, buena ubicación, etc.

Sin embargo, luego que la competencia aumentó las cosas se hicieron más difíciles, a pesar de esto producto del esfuerzo y sacrificio por sobrevivir, la señora A. logró ir haciendo mejoras paulatinas a su pequeño puesto de ventas, cambió el techo de plástico por zinc, sobre todo para proteger la mercadería de la lluvia y ofrecer un mejor servicio, amplió el espacio de venta y con varios créditos fue surtiendo poco a poco su negocio. Aún le quedan muchos aspectos por mejorar, sin embargo, si revisamos su historia la mejoría ha sido notoria. Doña Karla tiene dos hijos, ambos en edad escolar y estudiando, su esposo labora como electricista, pero no de forma estable, sino por trabajo. Esto ocasiona que su negocio sea el principal sostén de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (bulk packages of used clothing)

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 35, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia.  She and her husband run a stand selling beef soup and some grocery items to the people in their community, earning around $3/day of profit.  Two of her children work in construction, making collectively $8/day, while the other is a student.  Mrs. Touch S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory and to buy equipment to make wine.

loans.use: To expand her inventory, and to buy equipment to make wine.

loans.name: Maria  De Los Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de los Santos started selling oranges with her mother at the age of seven.

She hopes to grow her fruit business by having a fixed stall in the marketplace which will help her to improve her living conditions. Currently she sells her oranges from a small section of the local market, but she has high hopes for acquiring her own stall and to be able to send her children to school.

Mrs. de los Santos feels that the economic support provided by CEPRODEL has allowed her to build up her busines and to improve the living conditions of her family. She wants to improve her business slowly, but surely.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Purchase oranges

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es:
Julieta has always tried to help her children get ahead. Her husband works in construction, but he does not earn enough income to cover all the household expenses. This is why 2 years ago, Julieta started to sell groceries out of her home. Little by little, she has been accumulating her clientele, and she currently counts on a big group of customers who request various items that she does not offer.

For this reason, Julieta is requesting a loan of $250.00 USD, which she promises to pay back in 6 months. With this loan, she will be able to buy new merchandise and offer a wider variety of products. With your support, Julieta will be able to help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Julieta siempre a tratado de sacar adelante a sus hijos. El esposo de ella, se dedica a la construcción, y lo que gana no es suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de su casa. Es por eso que Julieta hace 2 años, comenzó a vender abarrotes en su casa, y así poco a poco se ha ido haciendo de clientes, actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo mayor de clientes, quienes le solicitan varios artículos con los que ella no cuenta.

Es por eso que Julieta está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Julieta podrá comprar mercancía nueva para poder tener mayor surtido en su negocio. Con tu ayuda Julieta podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Bin

texts.en: Mrs. Bin Y. is a farmer, who grows rice and cashew nut trees, and makes on average around $4.50 per day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Ghet Phoeun, works as a motor-taxi driver to supplement the household income, and normally earns about $2.50 a day. This couple has two children. To provide better living conditions for their family, they are now requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motor bike for the elder son to run as a business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike to run as a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Maurina

texts.es:
Maurina is 45 years of age and started out as an assistant cook in a small restaurant in her native Jaumave, Tamaulipas, where she learned to make various types of food. She and her family had to move to this border city due to reasons beyond their grasp. Her husband looked for work upon their arrival and found it, but with the passing of time, his income was not sufficient to cover their household expenses. They then decided to open up a business selling prepared meals, and to this day it has given them good earnings. Together with her husband’s income, they have enough to cover their expenses.

She now needs a loan for US $575, which she is willing to repay in 6 months, to purchase prime materials and a refrigerator to slowly expand her business and provide better service for her customers. She has every hope that with Kiva’s support, she will obtain this.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maurina es una mujer de 45 años que inicio como ayudante de cocina en una fonda en su natal Jaumave Tamaulipas, ahí aprendió hacer varios tipos de comidas.Se tuvieron que trasladar a esta frontera por causas mayores, al llegar su esposo busco trabajo el cual lo encontró, ya con el paso del tiempo, pues sus ingresos no le alcanzaban para los gastos económicos. Entonces decidieron poner el negocio de venta de comidas, y hasta hoy en día le ha dejado buenas ganancias y con el ingreso de su esposo ya le alcanza para todos sus gastos.

Ahora necesita de un crédito de US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses, para la compra de materia prima y un enfriador, para poco a poco que vaya creciendo su negocio y así poder atender mejor a todos sus clientes, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase prime materials and a refrigerator to help expand her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene A. is 31 years old. She is married and the mother of 2 children, who are in school. She trades in multiple products, which include cosmetics, maize, meat, and vegetables. She is convinced that the sale of multiple items can enable her to generate more income as a result of variety. She wants to use the loan to buy more cosmetic products, maize, and meat to increase her stock and make more income. Irene is a member of the community group called Adoration Trust Group. The group members guarantee that each member repays her loans and provide social collateral to repay the loan. Irene was at a group meeting when this photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, meat, vegetables, and some cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria started her business because her husband does not have stable work. She decided to take the initiative to sell on her own account to obtain income for the payment of services and maintenance of her 4 children. She began her business 3 years ago, selling cookies and empanadas. Now she makes cakes for festivals, anniversaries and 15th birthday celebrations as well.

She requests a loan of $250, that will be repaid in 3 months, to buy supplies for an event that she has soon. With your support she will move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio ya que su esposo no tiene un trabajo estable y decidio tomar la iniciativa de vender por su cuenta para obtener ingresos para el pago de servicios y manutencion de sus 4 hijos. Comenzó hace mas de 3 años, vendiendo galletas y empanadas, ahora hace pasteles para fiestas, bodas y XV años ademas de pays.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima para un evento que tiene proximamente. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy baking supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Enisa

texts.en: Enisa is a 32 year old woman, living in the suburbs of the town Travnik.  She is married, and her husband has a full time job.  They also have 2 children, who are in the 3rd and 7th grade. She works in agriculture, and has 2 heifers, 2 cows and one bull.  She earns a living mainly by selling their milk at the local dairy.  This is her first loan in the amount of $975.  Enisa will use this loan to buy some food for her cows.  In fact, she needs this loan to keep from selling off her current livestock.  Enisa hopes that one of her cows will get pregnant soon, as she looks forward to expanding her farm. For the future, it is her goal to grow her farm to include up to 20 cows!

loans.use: To buy food for her cows

loans.name: Rosa Constanza

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosa Costanza is married. She studied until fourth graD. in elementary school because her family didn’t have money for her to continue studying. She has seven children, five of whom work and two who are high school students. For five years, she has been selling caramels in her house in the Salaverry district in Trujillo, La Libertad.

Through a neighbor, she joined “Las Emprendedoras” community bank, and she has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought cookies and caramels, with which she supplied her business.

With a loan of 500 new soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy toilet paper and detergents that were needed in her business. Rosa dreams of having a big grocery business, so that she can support the education of her small children.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa Constanza está casada, estudió hasta 4to grado D. Primaria, porque su familia no tenía recursos económicos para que siguiera estudiando, tiene 07 hijos, 05 trabajan y 02 son estudiantes del nivel secundario. Hace cinco años se dedica a la venta D. caramelos en su casa en el Distrito D. Salaverry en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

Por medio D. una vecina ingresa en el Banco Comunal “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS”, hace un año viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 que recibió compró galletas, caramelos, con lo cual ha logrado surtir el negocio.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 500.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 04 meses, comprará papel higiénico y detergentes que hacen falta en su negocio. La socia sueña con tener un negocio granD. D. abarrotes, para apoyar en la educación D. sus hijos pequeños.

loans.use: To buy personal products to sell in her business

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto is married. He owns his house which has all the comforts necessary to make a home. He has 7 children. They live in the Itapua Poty area. Roberto is the owner of a shop that repairs light vehicles such as motorcycles. He's operated the business for 18 years which has allowed him to build a good customer base and income.

Roberto is applying for a loan to buy used spare parts so that he can resell them, something that will provide an extra income for his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Roberto L. es casado posee casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias de un hogar el mismo tiene 7 hijos Son de la zona de ITAPUA POTY el mismo es propietario de un taller mecánico de vehículos livianos como de motocicletas. Cuenta con 18 años de antigüedad en rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.

A solicitado de un crédito para comprar repuestos usados para luego poder revenderlos, lo que sería un ingreso extra en su taller.

loans.use: Buy used parts for resale.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeun Y. , 38, is a grocery seller as well as a commune officer in Chomka Somrong Commune. Her husband, Mr. Di Khon, 39, is a motorcycle taxi driver. In addition to her business work, Thoeun is also a good housewife who cares for her two children and cooks food for the family. Thoeun always discusses with her husband when she wants to do anything. To increase her  family's income, Thoeun needs to expand her variety of products to satisfy her customers, but she lacks the money to do so. Hence, she would like to request a loan of US$500 to add grocery inventory to sell for customer satisfaction. The loan will increase her business and attract more customers. The family lives in Chomka Somrong Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To add grocery inventory to sell against customer satisfaction

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en: Savoeurn K. is a 29-year-old rice farmer.  She has been farming since 1990, earning about $5 per day. She is married to Yern Von, 30, a fisherman. Savoeurn has six young children, all of whom are in school.  She spends a lot of time taking care of her family. To improve her farming business, Saveurn needs a loan of 800,000 Riel (US$200) to add to her own money to purchase a pump. She is happy that the loan will allow her to improve her business.

loans.use: To add to her money to purchase a pump

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en:
Oluwakemi has a business where she sells drinks, bottled sachet water and eggs to her retail customers. She has been in this business for the past five years.

Oluwakemi has been borrowing from LAPO MICROFINANCE for the past three years. She has never defaulted and not repayed her loan.

Oluwakemi needs a loan of N70,000 so she can purchase more crates of drinks and eggs to sell.

She is 35 years old. She is married with three children. Her children are in primary and nursery school. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and eggs to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es separada y madre de 2 hijos. Estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. Palomani Nº 192, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales” en Puno. El primer préstamo de S/. 300 lo invirtió en la compra de ingredientes para preparar sándwiches y tortas. A los 8 años empezó a trabajar ayudando a su mamá a vender refrescos y café en Desaguadero, ello la ayudó a que ella pueda iniciar su negocio, ahora vende golosinas, galletas, gaseosas y sándwiches en la tiendita escolar que tiene.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará más productos para su tienda.

Su deseo es terminar de construir su casa y seguir mejorando su negocio
texts.en:
Gloria is separated and the mother of two children. She studied to the fifth year of secondary school, and lives on Palomani Street in the Puno province. She is one of the founding members of the “Diana de Gales” cooperative bank in Puno. She invested her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles into the purchase of ingredients for making her sandwiches and cakes. She started working at the age of eight, helping her mother sell refreshments and tend to a café in Desaguadero. This helped her start her own business and, today, she sells snacks, cookies, sodas, and sandwiches at the school snack store that she has. With this loan of 3,000.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will purchase more products for her store. Her dream is to finish building her house, and to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ismaila Cissé est  un célibataire âgé de 30 ans qui vit chez ses parents dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Medine de la préfecture de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Après avoir fini ses études secondaires Monsieur Ismaila Cissé est resté très longtemps sans emploi. Il a tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite, il décida de mener alors l’activité de jeux téléchargés qui marchent beaucoup avec les jeunes. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami durant plusieurs mois. Actuellement Monsieur Ismaila maîtrise cette activité dans ses moindre details.
Afin d’obtenir un fonds de roulement, indispensable à la bonne marche de ses affaires; il décida de prendre un prêt  auprès  de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 téléviseurs et 2 appareils play station 2 pour les jeux téléchargés. Il ira faire ses achats d’appareils à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et mise sur une clientèle essentiellement juvénile du quartier et même de la ville toute entière de la préfecture de Bougouni.. 
Le moment propisse pour ses activités est très généralement  la période des vacances scolaires, des congés et les week ends.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Ismaila Cissé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise, payer les intérêts du prêt et aider ses parents à subvenir aux charges de cette famille nombreuse.
texts.en:
Ismaila Cissé is a 30 year old single man living with his parents in a polygamous family in the Medine neighbourhoo of Bougouni, Mali. Mr. Ismaila Cissé finished High School, but could not find a job for a long time afterwards. He started a number of businesses, but without success. He then decided to start a downloaded games' business which is very popular with young people, an activity that a friend of his taught him over several months. Mr. Ismaila has now mastered the fine points of this activity. In order to obtain working capital, which he will need in order to make a success of his business, he has decided to ask the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso for this, his first loan. He will use the loan to buy two televisions and two PlayStation 2 devices for the games. He will go to Bamako, the capital of Mali, for this purchase and is counting on the fact that young people, his target customers, make up most of the population of his neighbourhood and in fact of the entire town and prefecture of Bougouni. His business generally does best during school holidays, school breaks, and weekends. Mr. Ismaila Cissé expects that thanks to this loan he will be able to make 30,000 FCFA which he will reinvest in his business, pay the interest on his loan and help his parents to support their large family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two televisions and two PlayStation 2 devices

loans.name: Djiguissémè Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguissémè ont en moyenne 27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles sont toutes mariées  et vivent dans des familles polygamiques dans le village de Zogofina, préfecture de Ségou (quatrième région de la république de Mali). 
Les membres du groupe se sont connus à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage dans le village. Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers les femmes de Zogofina Wêrê qui mènent les mêmes activités génératrices de revenus qu’elles et qui sont dans le système depuis plusieurs années. Fascinées par la modalité de remboursement elles se sont organisées pour intégrer le programme crédit depuis maintenant 3 ans. Elles sont actuellement à leur 5ème prêt  après avoir correctement remboursé les précédents. 
Ce prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 7 sacs de riz et 38  chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe. Elles s’approvisionnent en riz à la foire hebdomadaire du grand marché de Ségou et en bois de chauffe à Songnebougou et à Bounoubougoula. Le riz est revendu au marché de Médine et à domicile au village alors que l’écoulement du  bois de chauffe se vend en ambulant à travers Ségou au comptant, en détail et à crédit  à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 32 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  rembourser le prêt,  la prise en charge alimentaire et le prix du pétrole pour les études des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of this Djiguissémè group have an average age of 27 and on average 3 children.
