They are all married and live in polygamous families in the village of Zogofina, prefecture of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The members of the group know each other because they are neighbors in the village or are related to each other by marriage. They learned of Soro Yiriwaso from the women of Zogofina Wêrê who are in the same businesses as they are and have been in the system for several years. Fascinated by the process of loan reimbursement, they managed to join the loan program 3 years ago. They are currently on their 5th loan, after having reimbursed the preceding ones correctly.

This loan will be used to buy 7 sacks of rice and 38 wagon loads of firewood. They buy their rice at the weekly fair at the big open-air market of Ségou and their firewood in Songnebougou and Bounoubougoula. The rice is sold in the marketplace in Médine and out of their homes in the village, whereas the firewood is sold door-to-door around Ségou for cash, retail, and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 32,500 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan, pay for food and kerosene and for their children's school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rice and firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Rosa M. se dedica a laborar arduamente en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur para suplir la necesidad de su familia y de su casa de habitación la cual requiere de una mejora en la infraestructura por lo que ya ha sido maltratada tanto por los años como por los fenómenos naturales.

Actualmente la señora Blanca requiere de un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para la reconstrucción de su casa y es por este motivo que ha buscado el  apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un financiamiento para llevar a cabo esta obra y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación y de su pequeño hijo que hoy más que nunca requiere del apoyo de su mamá.
texts.en:
At the Municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Ms. Blanca M. works really hard to support her family needs and house expenses. Her house needs structure improvements because it has suffered from aging and the strike of natural disasters.

Currently Ms. Blanca requires a loan to purchase building materials so as to rebuild her house; this is the reason why she has looked for Ceprodel support to obtain financing and get down to business. By doing this, her house conditions will be improved and her little child's too, who needs the mother's support more than ever .

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya F. owns a small rice field in their village. She is 42 years old and has 4 children. She started her business 20 years ago. She uses her 3/4 hectare farm to grow rice and support her family well. Gilbert Fajagutama, her husband, is a farmer. Together they work hard to clothe and feed their children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. The loan will definitely help Ligaya increase her yield. In that way, she believes that she could easily pay for the books, tuition and other miscellaneous school fees of her children.

CEVI gives Ligaya credit to run her business. She also receives training and insurance coverage to help her small business to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bulendga Twekembe (B) Group

texts.en: Annet is a used clothes saleswoman.  She specializes in women’s skirts.  Each week she travels to Kampala and, one by one, she chooses skirts to sell in her shop.  She can buy a skirt at about 2,000 USH and she can resell it at about 3,500 USH.  Usually she sells her skirts at the local market where she pays 500 USH rent per day.  Annet has been in this business for about 10 years now.  She works alone at her location, but her husband has a different stall at the market.  The work that she and her husband do, supports their four children. Since their children range from ages 17 to 5, they are all currently in school.  This means there is a heavy burden for the parents to carry. Annet says that although she could still be in the skirt-selling business without loans, the loans allow her to reduce her expenses. When she uses loans she is able to buy more skirts when she goes to Kampala.  This gives her more selection and reduces transport costs. In this loan cycle, Annet is requesting a loan of 300,000 to purchase a large stock of skirts.

loans.use: To buy skirts to sell.

loans.name: Tai Group

texts.en:
Saada Kasim, age 40, is married with seven children. She started her business in 2004. She sells clothes and weaving. She works from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $170

This will be Saada’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first two to increase her stock by buying more clothes to sell and has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her business and to pay school fees for her children.

Saada will share this loan with subgroup A of the Tai group. The subgroup has six members who are selling food, have salon shops, or sell charcoal. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Saada is second from the left in a pink dress.

loans.use: To increase her business and to pay school fees

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna, who has been a clothes and bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years, belongs to Nia njema group loan (Group code 2003). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40 working each day for eight hours.

Maimuna, 27 years old, married, and looking after five dependents, is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes, wheat flour, cooking oil and other items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, wheat flour, cooking oil and other items for her business.

loans.name: Zansi

texts.fr: K. Zansi est née le 15/08/1969 à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Kpodji. Zansi est marié à KEGNIDE William, un soudeur de profession. Zansi et William ont trois enfants tous scolarisés et avec lesquels ils vivent à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C'est du poissons fumés que Zansi vend. Zansi passe de ménage en ménage, le plateau de poisson sur la tête pour vendre ses poissons. Zansi a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits pour renforcer son activité. Zansi a bien remboursé ces crédits et a pu amener à un stade supérieur son activité. Zansi veut un troisième crédit pour augmenter le volume de son activité. .
texts.en:
K. Zansi was born on August 15, 1969 in Ekpè, in the town of Sèmè-Kpodji. She is married to KEGNIDE William, a welder by profession. Zansi and William have three children, all in school. They all live together in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Smoked fish is what Zansi sells, going from household to household, with a tray of fish on her head. She has already benefited from two loans for bolstering her business. She has repaid these loans and was able to bring her business to a higher level. She wants a third loan to increase her business volume.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five boxes of fish and some firewood

loans.name: Mukaddashon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Тошматова Мукаддасхон- женщина 23 года. Замужем имеет 2-х детей. Мукаддас занимается пошив и оформления женский национальных одежд на заказ. Она училась у хорошей швеи пол года.Теперь она самостоятельно берёт заказы и шьёт разные национальные платья. На полученного займа хочет, купит вышивальную машинку.  Мукаддас надеется,что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mukaddashon T. is a woman of 23 years of age. She is married and has two children. Mukaddas sews and decorates custom women's national dresses. She studied with a good seamstress for half a year. Right now she takes orders herself and makes different national dresses. She wants to use the loan to buy an embroidery machine. Mukaddas hopes that this loan will help her expand her business.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Virgen del Carmen Village Bank in the Peruvian jungle town of Patria, located about eight hours from the city of Cusco. She is fifty-five years old and married with seven children. Elsa sells “anticuchos” (beef heart kabobs) in the market in Patria. She works three days a week (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays), on days when buses from Cusco come through town. She has had her anticucho business for the past ten years. 

Elsa is requesting a loan of 3000 soles. She plans to use half of the money to buy charcoal, meat, potatoes and oil for making anticuchos, and the other half to pay for her son’s education. He is currently in nursing school in Lima, and will finish his studies in just one more month.  

Elsa’s goals for the future are to improve and expand her anticucho business and open a neighborhood bar in her home.

loans.use: Buy meat, charcoal, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Casria

texts.en:
Casria A. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 43 years old. Casria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Casria owns & operates a spare parts business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling spare parts in the local community. Casria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Casria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Casria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Casria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Casria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions her borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia N. tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos familia ya que tiene cuatro hijos que están estudiando y desea que tengan una carera profesional.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía que sus clientes le están pidiendo que venda ya que es la tienda que hay en la colonia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y así poder cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia N. has been selling groceries for more than a year. This business is the source of her family income. Sra. Lucia has four children who are students and she wants them to have professional careers.

Right now she is lacking the variety of merchandise that her customers are requesting. Her store is the only one that exists in the area. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in her business and meet the needs of her customers. She plans to repay the loan with the profits from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Z. Shahnoza is 29-years old and married with one young child. For more than five years, Shahnoza has been running her own business. She has a small saloon where she sells and rents both traditional and national wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large so consequently there are lots of marriages and Shahnoza has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family income. This is her third loan with Kiva partner IMON International. During the previous loan cycle she was accurate and precise in the loan payments. Shahnoza is requesting 5,000 Somoni ($1150 USD) to purchase newer styles of wedding dresses. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase wedding dresses

loans.name: Isela

texts.es: La señora Isela,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años, 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Isela, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua. Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas. Isela, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños.

loans.use: Comprará productos de belleza.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 55 años, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Con mucho sacrificio y trabajo Juana logró instalar un taller D. confección D. zapatos, ella produce zapatos muy novedosos y llamativos, los cuales luego distribuye en las tiendas y puestos D. los mercados más importantes D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, sus productos son comprados muy rápido es por eso que las tiendas demandan mucho sus calzados. Lo que más le gusta a Juana D. su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trasladar su mercadería hasta los lugares donD. los distribuye. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donD. pueda vender ella misma los zapatos que confecciona.
Este es el tercer préstamo D. Juana con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a las demás socias D. su banco comunal, donD. es muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los novecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más materiales para elaborar más zapatos.

loans.use: Materiales para elaborar zapatos

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 40 years old and she is married with 8 children. She sells sarongs of various colours to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more sarongs to meet the requirements of her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 25 years old. She is married to Jason, a tricycle driver. They have two children: Joshua, an 8-year-old in grade 2, and Chandlery, 1. They are living a simple life in the village of Cabaruan, Cauayan City, a semi-rural area. Their house is located 500 meters away from the national highway.

She has managed a typical retail store for almost 11 years. Her mother also sells cooked food inside her stall. Her weekly net income is 1,000 Philippine pesos. For the continuous improvement of her store, she is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP7,000. She will use it to purchase grocery items for her store.  She hopes lenders will grant her request to maintain her business. According to her, industriousness is her key to success.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more goods

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene Q. is a loving mother of four children whose age ranges from 3 to 14 years old. Her husband is a laborer, while she runs a variety store. Mylene wishes that the small business she started will continuously grow until she finally reaches her dream of her children graduating from college. Despite her financial struggle caused by her family's poverty, Mylene has managed to keep her performance in ASHI in terms of repayment and business maintenance very good to be able to acquire a much larger loan amount for her next loan.

Her astute disposition in life and business is supported by her loving husband, because he knows that the profits Mylene makes out of her business are a great resource for the family's expenses. With this loan, Mylene plans to purchase necessary groceries and items to be sold in her store for the convenience of her customers.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase soft drinks, canned goods and other varieties of ready-to-cook food to be sold in her variety store

loans.name: Unidas Para Triunfar 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Benita, 31, is a borrower from Santiago, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Unidas para Triunfar (United to Triumph), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Benita and her family live in a simple house near Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic with a population of over a million people. Life around the city can be difficult, with little access to reliable electricity and running water. It is also crowded and polluted, with insufficient sanitation. Despite any difficulties she may face, Benita runs a successful shop from her home selling clothes. She plans to use this loan, her very first from Esperanza International, to purchase both new and used blouses, shirts, and pants for women and men. She will then sell the clothes to her friends and neighbors at a small markup.

Benita is very grateful for her newfound access to financial services such as loans and savings, as well as health services for her family. She hopes to continue expanding her business, and she hopes to own her own shop one day. Benita has four children, from twelve to eighteen years old, and she also hopes to send them all to university with the extra profits from her business. With your help, Benita will be able to achieve these goals. Thank you for lending to Benita and the Unidas para Triunfar group!

loans.use: Blouses, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
A. Nguyễn Thị (10102050010) is a 44-year-old woman who lives in the town of Đông A. - Hà Nội. A. is the leader of a 2-member loan group loan sponsored by SEDA. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Xóm Hương (3). A. is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, A. operates a family member's livestock business where she raises pigs for sale. A. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1.500.000 VND a month from these activities. In 2004, A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. A. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.148.000 VND from SEDA. She used her previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise & sell. She is now requesting a loan of 6.322.000 VND to buy piglets to raise & sell. This will be A.'s 6th loan from SEDA. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. The other borrower in the group is Trương Thị H. (10102050011), a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.142.000 VND loan to support her service-based business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

 

 

 

A. Nguyễn Thị (10102050010) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông A. - Hà Nội. A. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Xóm Hương (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doA. chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. A. thực hiện công việc kinh doA. này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, A. kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2004, A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doA. của cô ấy/ A. ấy. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.148.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.322.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Trương Thị H. (10102050011) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.142.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doA. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doA. là vận hành công việc kinh doA. trên cơ sở dịch vụ. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DoA. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các dA. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Wale

texts.en:
Wale is 45 years old and is married with 3 children.

He sells electronics at retail prices to his customers. This is the high season for his business, and he hopes to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.

He hopes to expand his business in the future. He loves this business because of the personal interaction that he has with his customers. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eletronics to sell

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Хамидов Бахтиёр проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Хамидов Бахтиёр имеет среднее Техническое образование. Работает в этой отрасли более чем 15 лет. Хамидов Бахтиёр покупает товар и продает в торговой точке. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor H. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Bahtiyor has a secondary technical education. He has been working in this field for over 15 years. Bahtiyor buys merchandise and sells it at a retail outlet. He is obtaining this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica, de 27 años, vive en la casa de sus padres; con ellos, su pareja Manuel de 28 años (taxista) y con sus dos pequeñas hijas: Kiara (10) y Samantha (2).
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales chinos para adelgazar, como infusiones y pastillas que ayudan a reducir la grasa del cuerpo. Este peculiar negocio empezó cuando ella misma comprobó sus bondades y empezó a consumirlos, ante las preguntas de sus amigas sobre cómo había bajado de peso se animó a vender estos productos.
Yessica confiesa que siempre le ha gustado trabajar en diversos negocios, pero éste es muy rentable, pues tiene muchos clientes -hombres y mujeres- que suelen hacerle pedidos con regular frecuencia. 
Paralelamente, trabaja en algunas ferias comerciales de la zona ofreciendo masajes capilares con unos aparatos modernos anti estrés y por esta actividad, que generalmente realiza los fines de semana, también obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que acceda al crédito, pues le permitirá seguir progresando. Yessica tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería (productos chinos adelgazantes) y también quiere adquirir otra máquina anti estrés.
texts.en:
Yessica is 27 years old and lives in the home of her parents with her partner Manuel, who is 28 years old and works as a taxi driver, and their two young daughters, Kiara (age 10) and Samantha (age 2).

Four years ago, Yessica began selling natural weight loss products from China, such as herbal teas and pills that help reduce body fat. She started this business after she learned about the benefits of these products and began using them herself. When her girlfriends asked her how she lost weight, Yessica was encouraged to start selling these products.

Yessica admits that she has enjoyed working in a variety of businesses, but this one has proven to be the most profitable. She has many customers, both men and women, who place orders with regular frequency. At the same time, she works at a few of the trade fairs offering massages using modern anti-stress equipment. Yessica works at the fairs mostly on the weekends, but she generates a good income that allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her first loan with MFP. Yessica is very grateful to everyone who helps to provide credit, since it helps her to continue progressing. She plans to use the money to purchase more merchandise (Chinese weight loss products) and acquire another anti-stress machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase weight loss products & an anti-stress machine

loans.name: Yeat

texts.en: Mrs. C. is a 29-year-old fish seller earning approximately $3.33 per day. Her husband, Mr. Sun Rouen, is 35. He catches fish in the river to sell. They have four teenage children who go to school. C. hopes to earn additional income by investing in a new business but she doesn’t have the capital needed. Therefore, Mrs. C. decided to seek a loan from Kiva to buy piglets to raise; she has already built a stall for them.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. She has a farm where she plants cassava, pineapples and plantains. She is a hard-working woman who loves her farming business and wants to excel at it. She has been in this business for a long time.  Her husband is also a farmer and he also supports their household. Victoria needs a loan of NGN 60,000 to hire laborers to clear her farm for the next planting season. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to hire laborers to clear her farm

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia S. P. vive en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Soledad, al sur de Barranquilla donde tiene una tienda llamada “Donde Patty” allí vende ranchos, víveres, carnes, refrescos, dulces y otros tipos de miscelánea en general. Es casada y tiene  4 hijos en edades de 8 a 26 años. Aunque este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, conoce ya lo significativo y lo útil del crédito para invertirlo en su negocio: su esposo siempre ha tenido vida crediticia y la ha cuidado muy bien, ahora  ella y quiere empezar a construir la suya, con este crédito por valor de $2.300.000 comprará dos mesas con sillas y surtirá su negocio con bebidas y víveres, como arroz y azúcar en mayor volumen.
Patricia proviene de Piedecuesta, municipio del departamento de Santander en el interior del país, una tierra panelera (que produce la panela) donde ella dice, se encuentra gente muy trabajadora y trapichera que “le ponemos el hombro al sol”. Toda la vida trabajó en restaurantes como empleada, hasta que su esposo le propusiera dejar de hacer esta actividad y prestaron un dinero para montar una tienda en Piedecuesta, donde también su esposo trabajaba como técnico de mantenimiento de redes de telefonía y de Internet,  pero  como no le iba muy bien, porque sólo conseguía contratos esporádicamente;  en el año 2001, una empresa importante donde lo contrataron, le propuso venirse a Barranquilla; fue asi vendieron su tienda en Santander y adquirieron la casa en Soledad, donde está  ubicada su nueva tienda. Su desafío más importante es el de hacer unas adecuaciones al negocio para ampliarlo y poder ofrecer servicios a familias mientras consumen en su tienda. Superar este desafío la ayudará a cumplir su sueño de terminar de pagar su casa con sus propios esfuerzos, para vivir estable y contar siempre con buenas condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Patricia S. P. lives in the Los Almendros neighborhood in the town of Soledad, which is located south of Barranquilla. She has a store called “Donde Patty” where she sells foods, meats, soft drinks, sweets, and other miscellaneous general goods. She is married and has 4 children who range in age from 8 to 26. Even though this is Patricia’s first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she already knows that it is both important and useful to invest the loan in her business; Patricia's husband has a very good credit history, and she now wants to start building her own credit history. She is going to use this loan of 2,300,000 Colombian pesos to purchase two tables and chairs, and to stock her business with beverages and foods such as rice and sugar in large quantities. Patricia comes from Piedecuesta, a town in the department of Santander in the country’s interior. This is panela country (an area that produces panela, which is basically a loaf of unrefined sugar), where, as Patricia says, you can meet people who are very hardworking and innovative who “put our shoulders toward the sun.” Patricia worked in restaurants until her husband proposed to her—she then left her job and the two of them borrowed some money so that they could set up a store in Piedecuesta. Her husband also worked as a telephone network and Internet maintenance technician, though that was not going so well since he only occasionally got contracts. In 2001 an important company hired Patricia’s husband, and he suggested that they move to Barranquilla; they thus sold their store in Santander and purchased a house in Soledad, which is where their new store is located. Patricia’s most important challenge is making some adjustments to her business so that she can expand it and be able to offer services to families who shop at her store. Overcoming this challenge will allow her to fulfill her dream of paying for her house through her own hard work, which will in turn help her to live a stable life and have good health.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing two tables and chairs, and stocking her business with beverages and foods such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Margarita Verónica

texts.es:
La señora: Margarita Verónica Jirón G., es comerciante de este mercado desde hace quince años tiene un negocio de productos varios vende vasos, platos, ollas de aluminio, sillitas de Madera, perchas etc.
Es madre de tres niños dos en edad escolar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que el también trabaja en un taller, tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel ella y su esposo se esfuerzan por sacar adelante a sus hijos y que no les falte nada (comida y techo).
Abre su negocio  a las nueve de la mañana y lo cierro a las cuatro de la tarde  diario hasta los días domingos Siempre Saco los financiamientos para invertirlos a mi negocio ya que aprovecho a comprar al contado y puedo obtener rebajas y descuentos.
texts.en:
La señora: Margarita Verónica Jirón G., es comerciante de este mercado desde hace quince años tiene un negocio de productos varios vende vasos, platos, ollas de aluminio, sillitas de Madera, perchas etc. Es madre de tres niños dos en edad escolar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que el también trabaja en un taller, tiene tres años de trabajar con ceprodel ella y su esposo se esfuerzan por sacar adelante a sus hijos y que no les falte nada (comida y techo). Abre su negocio a las nueve de la mañana y lo cierro a las cuatro de la tarde diario hasta los días domingos Siempre Saco los financiamientos para invertirlos a mi negocio ya que aprovecho a comprar al contado y puedo obtener rebajas y descuentos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar productos plásticos como: vasos, platos, juguetes

loans.name: Cynthiah

texts.en:
Cynthiah runs a retail shop where she sells cereals. She has been in this business for five years. She also farms to earn extra income to support her family. Her husband is employed in a poultry distributor company.

“Jambo Kisaju” is her group in Faulu Kenya and she is an active member who attends their weekly meetings. Through the group meetings, the members share business ideas, save money, and also guarantee each other’s loans.

Cynthiah has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more cereals and maize flour to sell. She hopes to provide a quality education for her children. For this reason, she strives hard in her business to provide a brighter future for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Patshakul

texts.ru: Худойкулов Патшакул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Женат, имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Патшакул имеет среднее образование. Является представителем дехканского хозяйства. Более 4 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Patshakul K. lives in the Yavan region. He is 53 years old. He is married and has seven children. His wife is a homemaker. Patshakul has secondary education. He is a member of the farmers' collective board. He has been doing agriculture for more than four years. He has a plot of land at his home where he grows wheat and vegetables. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Jovanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jovanna de  23 años , vive en una zona periurbana en Guayaquil, es vendedora Yambal (es una compañía de venta de cosméticos por catalogo que ayuda a las mujeres del Ecuador a ser vendedoras potenciales). Ella vive con su abuela y su hermana para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó como vendedora de cosméticos a los 19 años. 

Durante todos los años que ha trabajado como vendedora Yambal por catalogo ha invertido sus ganancias en mas productos. Trabaja todos los días vendiendo cosméticos, perfumes, cremas etc. Para incrementar sus ventas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas y desodorantes.  

Después de unos años ella quiere tener su propio local de cosméticos y productos de uso personal.
texts.en:
J22-year old Jovanna lives in a suburb of Guayaquil. She sells Yambal products (Yambal is a company that sells cosmetics by catalogue and helps Ecuadorean women become sales agents). She lives with her grandmother and sister so she can help with household expenses. She began selling cosmetics at the age of 19. All the time that Jovanna has been working for Yambal, she has invested her profits in buying more products. She works every day selling cosmetics, perfumes, lotions etc. In order to increase her sales, she wants to use the loan to buy more perfumes, lotions, and deodorants. After a few years she wishes to buy a small store from which to sell cosmetics and personal products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and deodorants

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna C. es una mujer que ha dedicado su vida al trabajo y mas, con la  responsabilidad D. educar a sus dos hijos que ahora tienen  22 y 29 años D. edad y uno D. los cuales  aun estudia. DesD. hace dos años se inició en el negocio D. vender cosméticos y como gradualmente su capital D. trabajo fue rotando con facilidad, le permitió posteriormente agregarle otras mercancías, prendas femeninas y otras,  como en la actualidad lo hace. D. igual manera como conoce muy bien el oficio D. congelados, también  elabora deditos, empanaditas D. carne, queso, pollo o mixtas que venD. y le representan un ingreso adicional. En la actualidad aplica a su sexto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor D. $800.000 COP para comprar una mesa D. acero inoxidable y elaborar sus productos alimenticios D. manera más efectiva,  y  agregaría mayor higiene y calidad a sus procesos con esta adquisición. 
Mirna desD. que está participando en los programas D. la Fundación, ha logrado integrar nuevas actividades y productos que le han permitido una mayor diversidad y un mejor ingreso. Su sueño ahora es adecuar su casa, para montar su gran almacén donD. pueda vender D. todo un poco, porque aprecia su trabajo en su negocio debido a que con él ha podido resolver las necesidades educativas D. sus hijos que ahora son profesionales y la ayudan a hacer crecer su actividad.
texts.en:
Mirna C. is a woman who has dedicated her life to her work and other activities, such as taking responsibility for providing an education for her two children, who are now 22 and 29 years of age, one of whom is still in school. Two years ago, she started a business selling cosmetics. Over time she was able to turn over her operating capital with ease, which allowed her to acquire other types of merchandise such as women’s clothing. At the same time, Mirna became well-known for selling frozen foods and making finger cookies and miniature turnovers filled with beef, chicken, or a combination of meats, and selling them to earn additional income.

At the moment, Mirna is applying for her sixth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in the amount of 800,000 COP to buy a stainless steel table on which she can make her food products. This will proviD. more sanitary conditions and improve the quality of her food preparation.

Since participating in the programs offered by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Mirna has been able to integrate new activities and products that proviD. her greater diversity and help her earn more income. Her dream now is to acquire a house where she can establish a large store so that she can sell a little bit of everything. She appreciates the work she put into the business because it allowed her to proviD. for the educational needs of her children who are now professionals and help her grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stainless steel table for preparing her food products

loans.name: Dionalyn

texts.en:
Dionalyn M. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio. She is 25 years old. Dionalyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Dionalyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, food for snacks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Dionalyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dionalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dionalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Dionalyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dionalyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julieta Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Julieta se dedica a la compra y venta de vestidos para niñas y jovencitas, tiene ya 13 años en esta actividad, lo compra de su hermana que los confecciona y los vende en las zonas comerciales de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en anticrético en Bajo Pampahasi, con su esposo y sus hijos que están estudiando. La Sra. es una cliente muy responsable, ya que trabaja con nosotros en un grupo solidario, es una cliente antigua. El crédito que solicita ahora es para la compra de vestidos bordados, ya que le hicieron ese pedido ya que estos vestidos tienen mucha demanda, la Sra. es  muy trabajadora y responsable, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por  la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Julieta buys and sells young ladies’ and girls’ clothing and has been doing this for 13 years. She buys the clothing from her sister, who makes it, and sells it in the commercial areas of the city of La Paz. She lives with her husband and children, in an “anticrético” apartment, in Bajo Pampahasi. Her children attend school. (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) [Julieta] is a very responsible client, and part of a united group, who’s been working with us for some time. She will use the money from this loan to buy embroidered dresses, since she has had some requests and these types of dresses are in high demand. She is very hard working and responsible and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the opportunity they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom M. dropped out of school.  He began his bar and lodging business in Jinja town 2 years ago. At the relatively young age of 27, he already has 3 children.  He has been meeting the challenge of caring for his children through his weekly earnings of about 100,000 shillings.

With this loan, Tom plans to purchase more crates of drinks for his bar and bedding for his lodge.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for his pub and bedding for his lodge.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La señora Dulce Maria C. tiene ya más de seis años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que desea estar preparada para la venta, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para sacar a delante a sus tres hijos y darles el estudio necesario.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dulce Maria has been selling new and used clothes for the past six years. She is asking for a loan in order to buy winter clothing, as she wants to be prepared to sell these items. At this time she doesn’t have the money to buy these clothes. She is planning on paying back the loan with her business earnings. These earnings are the source of support for her three children and the means of providing them with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fanny Flor

texts.es:
Fanny de 29 años, tiene una local donde vende productos naturales, vive en  una zona urbana “Las Orquídeas” llamado así porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas.

Por la falta de oportunidades y aprender mas sobre la salud del cuerpo humano ella comenzó a vender productos naturales como “Herbalife” empresa que vende productos naturales a un bajo costo para micro empresarios.  Ella inicia en las mañanas a dar charlas a sus clientes y después le ofrece los productos, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas para su negocio y energizantes. En el futuro quiere tener su propio centro naturista para tener ingresos sostenibles.
texts.en:
Fanny is 29 years old and has a shop where she sells natural products. She lives in the urban area of “Orquídeas”. (It was named “the orchids” because a large number of these flowers were found there at the time of its discovery). Due to lack of other opportunities, she decided to learn more about the health of the human body and began selling products for “Herbal Life”, a company that sells natural products to micro-businesses at a low price. She begins by chatting with her customers and then offers them her products. She works from very early in the morning until nightfall. With the loan, she wants to buy display cases and “Herbal Life” energizers for her business. In the future, she wants to have her own naturalistic center so she will have sustainable income.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Display cases, "Herbal Life" energizers

loans.name: Pelagio

texts.es:
Pelagio es socio del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Pelagio es casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Pelagio tiene un carro con el cual se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, además tiene otra unidad que es conducida por un chofer.
Pelagio necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos y neumáticos.
Los sueños de Pelagio son comprar otro terreno para construir una casa y que su hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Pelagio is a member of the Villa Huatatas Community Bank.  He is married and has two children, one of which is still in school.  

Using his own vehicle, Pelagio works as a taxi driver. He also has another transport car, which is driven by a different driver. Pelagio is applying for a loan of 900 Nuevos Soles (~300 USD), which will be invested in the purchase of spare parts and tires.

Pelagio’s dreams are to buy another property to build a house, and that his children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and tires

loans.name: Divina's Group

texts.en:
Divina B. is from the village of Baculod, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 33 years old. Divina is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Divina is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Divina makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling carabao milk candies in the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Divina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Divina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Venus Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas De Progreso.

La señora Venus es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta el Banco por la seriedad y compromiso tanto de sus compañeras como de parte de la Fundación Espoir. Tiene 64 años de edad y está separada pero de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos  todos mayores de edad,  uno de ellos falleció hace ya algún tiempo.

Tiene un local donde prepara y vende hamburguesas, papas fritas, y otras comidas rápidas, además de jugos, batidos, colas y otras bebidas suaves. Trabaja todos los días desde las 18h00 hasta las 23h00, una persona trabaja con ella a la cual le paga un sueldo semanal.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la preparación de los alimentos. Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante ya que eso es lo que a ella le gusta, preparar comida y dice que lo hace muy bien.
texts.en:
The “Damas De Progreso” (Ladies of Progress) meets every two weeks in the San Cristóbal enclave of the city of Portoviejo.

Venus is a founding member of the communal bank.  She likes the bank because of the seriousness and commitment both of her fellow members and of Fundación Espoir.  She is 64 years old and is separated.  The relationship produced five children, all adults now; one of them died some time ago.

She has a stand where she makes hamburgers, fried potatoes and other fast food to sell as well as juices, smoothies, soft drinks and other non-alcoholic beverages.  She is open for business daily from 6-11pm.  She has an employee that helps her and she pays a monthly salary.

This loan is to buy ingredients for her meals.  Her dream is to have a great restaurant because this is what she likes: to prepare meals…and she says she prepares them quite well.

loans.use: To buy meat, bread, potatoes, cooking oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren G. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three-year-old son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son is in a local kindergarten while his wife works as a cook in a local cafe. 

Myagmarsuren owns a taxi service in his town. He started his business in 2008 after purchasing his own car. In his town, there is no public transportation service therefore demand for taxi service is high. After a short period of operation, he has expanded his customer base and earned a good reputation among the local people. He has found success in his business and his earnings have enabled him not only to buy a plot of land and fence but also to start building a house for his familyoin it. Moreover, his family's standard of living has been improving greatly. 

Myagmarsuren is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to finish construction of his house as well as purchase a necessary spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: To finish construction of his house and purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: T. Jeanne

texts.fr: G. T. Jeanne est née le 13 Juillet 1981 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Jeanne est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, mais Jeanne ne vit plus avec son mari. Jeanne vit seule depuis cinq ans environs à Midombo, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Jeanne a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la coiffure, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis environs quatre ans. Parallèlement, Jeanne vend dans son atelier de coiffure, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Jeanne s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. La clientèle de Jeanne s'accroît au jour le jour et pour ce faire, Jeanne désire agrandir davantage son activité afin de mieux répondre aux différentes demandes de ses clients. C'est la raison pour laquelle Jeanne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jeanne a bien remboursé le crédit antérieur qu'elle a reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. T. Jeanne was born on the 13th of July, 1981 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Jeanne is the mother of two children, both of whom are attending school, but Jeanne no longer lives with her husband. Jeanne has lived alone for the past five years in the area of Midombo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. 

Jeanne attended very little school, but learned hairdressing and has been passionately running a  hairdressing business for about four years. Additionally, Jeanne sells goods from her hair salon, such as hair extensions and cosmetics. Jeanne purchases supplies for her business in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Jeanne's clientele is growing every day and, as a result, she wants to further expand her business to better meet the various demands of her customers. That is why Jeanne is requesting another loan from the micro-finance organization ALIDÉ. Jeanne has repaid the earlier loan she received from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To purchase hair care products and beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Usoss

texts.en:
Mr. Usoss T., 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Rim Vorng, 24 years old (pictured together), have been married since 2007. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Usoss has been driving a "Tuk Tuk" taxi for almost five years. He also fishes when he is free. His wife stays at home because she just delivered a baby. 

Usos is asking for his first loan of $700 to repair his fishing gear.

loans.use: To repair his fishing gear

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol A. is from the village of Santa Isabel Sur. She is 26 years old, married and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Marisol owns and operates a specialized retail store selling pork, fish, fruits and vegetables in the local community. Marisol has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Marisol joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marisol is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch P. is 25 years old and lives with his wife in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in his parents' fence. Banzragch operates a meat trading business in his town. He moved to his current town in 2000 and started his meat trading business in 2005 after operating a mobile food products trading business between 2000 and 2004. After years of operation, he has built a stable operation. For the future, he hopes to continue operating his business with stable operation. Banzragch is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of meat to sell as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat to sell as a retailer

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
We do not need to make a lot of mistakes before learning.  At the age of 39, Jennifer learns the ways of both business and life to get ahead.  She is a high school graduate and is happily married to Joseph P., a tricycle driver.  They lived in Habitat, Baseco, Manila.

Jennifer has been managing the operation of their tricycle business for the past two years. She rents out one unit to another driver and earns at least Php200 a day.  Joseph drives their other unit.  Aside from driving, he also repairs motorcycles and bicycles in the community.  From this work, Jennifer and Joseph earn an estimated minimum of Php700 per day.

To help her grow her business, Jennifer would like to request for a Php9,000 loan. She will use this money to buy spare parts (such as tires) to maintain their tricycle units.  She will also use part of this loan to purchase other materials needed for their cycle repair business.

Jennifer does not emphasize any challenges encountered in her life but rather focuses on solutions and acts on them.  Living a simple and practical life, she wants a strong family foundation and an active spiritual life.  She prays that in God's time, they will be blessed with their own baby.  

As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also gain strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: spare parts for the maintenance of their two tricycle units

loans.name: Abaticumugandi Group

texts.en:
Daphrose is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 3 and 8.  She is the leader of the group 'Abaticumugandi'. 

In the photo, Daphorose is on the right side.  Most of the members are involved in selling pineapples.  Daphrose has been doing this for two years and employs one other person to help her.  Her shop is open from 6am until 9pm every day of the week.

Daphrose has requested this loan to improve her business facilities.  Any profits made from these improvements will be reinvested in her shop.

loans.use: To improve her business facilities.

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es:
Sonia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua, se dedica al comercio de elaboración de tortillas con doce años en las ventas, así como productos lácteos como: cuajada, crema, queso, frijoles cocidos, logrando tener mejores ingreso.
Inicio con el objetivo de apoyar  a su familia,  vendiendo solo tortillas, luego con la ganancia y préstamo que Afodenic otorgo comienza a incrementar la producción de tortillas y ventas de lácteos.
Sonia palmea los tres tiempos y tiene  a dos jóvenes palmeando, ya que aumentado su clientela. Lo que invertirá con su nuevo financiamiento el aumento de maíz, compra de leña, frijoles, y lácteos.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua.  She makes tortillas, and has been selling them for 12 years along with dairy products such as cuajada (a soft cheese), cream, cheese, as well as cooked beans, which have helped increase her income.

She began with the objective of supporting her family, just selling tortillas.  Later with the earnings and the loan that Afodenic gave her she began to increase the production of tortillas and to sell dairy products.  

Sonia makes tortillas for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and has two young people who help her since her clientele are increasing.  With the new loan she will buy more corn, firewood, beans and dairy products.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of corn, beans, and dairy products to improve her income

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who is not in school.  Florence has a clinic, which she has had for less than one year.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase medicine for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her self.  In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun L. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. Tun is a farmer, earning an income of 1.5 USD per day. Her husband operates his three-wheeled bicycle to provide transportation services, earning an income of 3 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 25 USD on food and 38 USD on other necessary expenses.

Tun is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD, which will be her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. She wishes to purchase construction supplies for her child to expand his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her child's business

loans.name: Dashdorj

texts.en:
Dashdorj P. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and only child in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. 

His only daughter, age 6, goes to a secondary school. His wife is unemployed. 

He manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a Janjintulag trading center. He started his business in 2003. With eight years of business experience, he has managed to build a strong customer base and good relationship with his partners. 

He collects meat and meat products from countryside residents and transports them to his stall in his mini-truck porter. 

He is a hardworking man who is planning to sell his meat and meat products in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a bigger truck in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger truck

loans.name: Ablavi Hodalo

texts.fr: Mariée à un revendeur, elle est mère d’un(01) enfant et est âgée de 32ans. Depuis 2005 elle a commencé par vendre les friperies, les produits cosmétiques et les chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend dans sa boutique.  Vue les conditions de niveau de vie, Mme Ablavi veut aider son mari, accroitre son activité, avoir sa propre boutique pour revendre s’assurer de l’avenir de ses enfants c’est  pour cela elle sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des bals de friperie, 01 carton de produits cosmétiques et 02 cartons de chaussures.
texts.en: Married to a salesman, Ablavi Hodalo is 32 years old and the mother of one child.  In 2005 she began selling second-hand clothing, cosmetic products, and shoes.  She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them in her boutique.   Given her living conditions,  Madame  Ablavi wants to help her husband, increase her business activity, own her own sales shop, and ensure the future of her children.  This is why she is requesting her first loan to buy bundles of used clothing, a case of cosmetics, and two cases of shoes.

loans.use: to buy used clothing, cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Адашева Мухарам проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Её муж работает в строительной компании. Сама она занимается торговлей на рынке. Она покупает и продает лепешки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 16 лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки. Мухарам решила заняться выпечкой хлеба, то есть лепешек, чтобы получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Muharam A. lives in the Bahdat region. She is 43 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works at a construction company. 

On her own, she engages in trade at the market. She buys and sells flatbread. She has been involved in this type of activity for 16 years. The loan is to purchase flour. Muharam decided to engage in baking bread, more specifically flatbread, in order to receive bigger profits.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Namulanda Development Group

texts.en: Daniel, a hardworking 38-year-old, has been in the retail business for the past decade. He operates from Kayunga. This happily married father of 4 says that to get established in this business, he had to use savings from his agricultural sales business. He still runs his agri-sales business, though it is now a secondary business. Weekly, he says his business generates for him 100,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase more general merchandise retail commodities to resell.  Daniel is the gentleman seated in the front-row with a white shirt.

loans.use: purchase more sugar, salt and so on to resell in the shop.

loans.name: Baptiseurs Plus Group

texts.en:
“Baptiseurs Plus” is a group of 11 owners of small businesses chaired by Noel.  Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Noel’s main activity is to sell general hardware at the market located west of Kinshasa.  He started his business in 1993 selling second hand clothing with a beginning capital of US $10.  Due to the high demand for general hardware, Noel decided to change his business in order to generate more profit and achieve his dream to someday become a hardware provider in his community. 

Having repaid his previous seven loans properly from the MFI HOPE DRC, he intends to use his next loan to buy more general hardware and resell them at profit in order to generate additional profits.  Currently, Noel makes a profit of US $50 per week.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children aged 3 to 14.  Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to purchase more kitchen hardware to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase accessories to include among the items sold in his store.

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara, 45, is the leader of this group. She and her husband, who is a member of a local farm community, have three young kids. She combined her single mindedness with her enormous creative abilities to guarantee her success. She started farming in 1994 during the peiod of privatization. After twelve years of labor on a field she constructed a house and expanded her herd of livestock. 

Today she has been widely recognized with her high quality agricultural products and is in high demand. The loan is requested with the purpose of buying fertilizers and medicine for caring for the potatoes that she planted this spring.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Haydee tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, tiene una tienda bien surtida instalada en su casa, todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, fósforos, sal entre otros productos. Haydee tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos con este préstamo espera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Haydee is 43 years old, married, and has one child. She manages a store in her home that she keeps well-stocked. Every day she wakes up early in order to attend to her customers.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, candy, matches, salt, and other products. Haydee has a wide variety of customers who request different products, so this loan will allow her to meet their demands.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, candy, matches, salt, and other products.

loans.name: Serapie

texts.en:
Serapie is 42 years old. She is married with four children and takes care of four relatives. She earns a living by selling products such as bananas and sweet potatoes. This is her thirteenth successful year in business. Her business is well-organized and she operates her business from 7 am until 6 pm every day. She currently  employs 2 people to help her. 

Serapie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more bananas and sweet potatoes for sale. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business and she will be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as bananas and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es: Rosario de Fátima de cincuenta y seis años de edad, reside en su casa con su hija y dos nietos. Rosario ha hecho de su casa un negocio. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ricas pupusas que día a día ofrece a sus clientes con mucho entusiasmo. Rosario es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y dedicada en su negocio. Muchas personas la conocen y dan referencia de ella y da las deliciosas pupusas que ofrece. Para Rosario lo más importante son los clientes, por lo que se preocupa en atenderlos de la mejor manera posible esto ha hecho que muchas personas la prefieran ya que siempre tiene una sonrisa y mucho entusiasmo para atender su negocio. Desea ampliar la capacidad de su negocio de tal manera que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Para esto necesita invertir en mayor cantidad de insumos que le permitan lograr su objetivo. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar a INTEGRAL este crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios como: maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario de Fátima is fifty-six years old, and lives in her house with her ​​daughter and two grandchildren.  Rosario has created her business from her home. She works preparing and selling rich pupusas (stuffed tortillas), that she offers daily to her customers with great enthusiasm. 

Rosario is an enterprising woman, hardworking and dedicated to her business.  Many people know her and recommend her and her delicious pupusas. For Rosario, the most important thing is her customers, which is why she focuses on attending to them in the best way possible.  This has caused many people to prefer her, because she always has a smile and great enthusiasm for tending to her business.  

She wants to expand the capacity of her business so she can meet increased demand.  For this she needs to invest in more ingredients that will allow her to achieve her goal.  This is why she has made the decision to request the loan through INTEGRAL, so as to buy the necessary ingredients such as corn, rice, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc., in order to increase her sales and income which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mary Cris has a retail shop that sells vegetables like squash, cabbages & eggplants. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Mary Cris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: The Eye Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of "The Eye Group". They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a town near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Regina. Born in Freetown, Regina is 32 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively.  For six years now, Regina has been selling provisions: peak milk, sardines, soft drinks, sugar, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to  buy peak milk, sardines, soft drinks, sugar, etc at wholesale

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 
Vicente provides a motorcycle, or habal-habal, service. He has run this business for three years. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline to run his motorcycle.
Vicente is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's Group is comprised of 4 hardworking women. Rose is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 2 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Rose generate greater profits and help pay school fees for her child. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to own the biggest shop in town. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rose's future prospects by helping to teach her how to save money.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap to resell

loans.name: Olegario Luis

texts.es:
Olegario  de 50 años, un hombre muy trabajador y responsable en su negocio. 
Su negocio es una sastrería ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda, inicio esta actividad hace 30 años.
Su actividad la inicia desde que se levanta hasta la noche, dependiendo de la cantidad de trabajo que sus clientes le deja.

Está separado, tiene 2 hijos pero ya son mayores de edad.El solicita el préstamo para la compra de maquinas de coser y accesorios como: telas, hilos, agujas. Su sueño es mejorar  su negocio, incrementarla y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
