Olegario, 50, is a hard-working man who is very responsible in his business.  He has a tailor shop set up in the back part of his house and has been in business for 30 years.  He works from the time he gets up in the morning until nightime, depending on the amount of work his customers give him.

He is separated and has two adult children.  He is requesting a loan to buy sewing machines and accesories such as fabric, thread and needles.  His goal is to improve his business by expanding it and to carry out home improvements.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and accessories such as fabric, thread and needles.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma es una mujer arriesgada y luchadora, a sus 44 años de edad está casada con César y tiene 4 hijos, de ellos 2 ya tienen familia y viven en la ciudad de Huánuco. Norma cuenta con una casa propia. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, tales como chanchos, vacas, cuyes. Menciona que, compra un chancho pequeño a 100 soles, ella lo engorda y lo cuida 4 meses, pasado ese tiempo Norma lo lleva a las ferias y los vende a 400 soles, cuadruplicando su precio. “Me conviene vender chanchitos, por que siempre se gana, y yo crío de 4 a 5 chanchitos para la venta”, explica. Aparte de ello, también siembra en unas parcelas pequeñas de terrenos  papas, arvejas y habas, cuyos ingresos son para cubrir sus necesidades diarias. Antes de consolidarse en su negocio de ganados, Norma cuenta que las enfermedades mataron a sus vacas, problema que solucionó con veterinarios, pero que al fin y al cabo significaron pérdidas cuantiosas. “Unos años después, si Dios quiere me iré a Huánuco con mis hijos y ahí construiremos una casa nueva”, dice esperanzada. Éste será su préstamo número 8 de MFP, por esa razón ella necesita de su ayuda, para alcanzar sus proyectos, ya que la falta de capital es uno de sus principales inconvenientes.  “Me siento cómoda con mi banco comunal, siempre me ha sacado de apuros”, finaliza. Norma invertirá el dinero en la compra de abonos que cuesta 120 soles la bolsa, de las que necesitará 5; además adquirirá semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Norma is a daring and energetic woman. She is 44 years of age and married to Césary. She has 4 children. Two of these already have their own families and live in the city of Huánuco. Norma has her own house.

Norma is engaged in the purchase and sale of livestock such as pigs, cows, and guinea pigs. She states that she buys a small pig for 100 soles. She fattens and cares for it for 4 months. After this period, Norma takes it to the market and sells it for 400 soles, quadruple the price she paid. “It’s convenient for me to raise pigs because I always make money from them, and I raise 4 to 5 pigs at a time for sale,” she explains.

In addition to this, she also plants a few small parcels of land with potatoes, peas, and beans. The income from this covers her daily necessities.

Norma states that before her livestock business was on a solid footing illness killed her cattle. The problem was solved by veterinarians, but at the end the loss was considerable.

“In a few years, God willing, I will go to Huánuco and we will build a new house there,” she says hopefully.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP. She needs its help in order to achieve her goals since lack of capital is one of her principal hurdles. “I feel comfortable with my communal bank, she says, “It has always given me a helping hand.” Norma will invest the loan money in the purchase of 5 bags of fertilizer, which costs 120 soles a bag. She will also acquire seeds for green peas.

loans.use: to purchase pea seeds and 5 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a vegetable seller who operates her business from her home and sells fresh, quality, seasonal vegetables to her clients at reasonable rates. Her husband operates a Punjabi food restaurant. He offers good quality and tasty food to his customers. Razia is the mother of a daughter and 2 sons. Her daughter is an embroidery expert and her younger son is a mechanic. Her elder son works in a factory.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her vegetable selling business. With the loan investment, she will buy fresh seasonal vegetables that will allow her to offer good quality vegetables to her clients to earn better income. She has been operating her business for the past many years and she has a lot of confidence in herself. She is very much sure that her business will be improved after the loan investment.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia”.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
16 integrantes tiene este grupo D. la ciudad D. Caacupé, el cual está integrado por vecinas y amigas D. esa ciudad, las cuales luchan diariamente por el sustento D. su familia. Son mujeres luchadoras, sacrificadas, quienes ven en el programa D. la fundación una gran oportunidad D. progreso. 
Una D. esas mujeres luchadoras es Norma, quien se dedica a la venta D. joyas, trabajo gracias al cual pueD. crecer como profesional y como persona. Comenta que tiene ya una clientela que siempre prefiere comprar D. ella lo que venD.. Tiene mucha demanda y es por ello que solicita el crédito para poder cumplir con ellas. 
Desea comprar pulseras, anillos, aros, tobilleras y otros tipos D. joyas. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta les fa, pues es muy importante para el crecimiento D. todas.
texts.en: This group in the city of Caacupé consists of 16 women who are neighbours and friends, who struggle on a daily basis to take care of their families,They are determined, self-sacrificing women who see in the Fuindacion's program a great opportunity for progress. One of these determined women is Norma who sells jewelry. Thanks to this work she is able to grow professionally and personally. She says that she already has a clentele that always buys what she sells. Her products are in high demand which is why she is asking for a loan to meet the demand. She wants to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, anklets and other types of jewelry. She is grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity they are giving her as it is very important for the growth of all of them.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, anklets and other products.

loans.name: Fuaifatu

texts.en:
Fuaifatu is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Samata I Uta.  She is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Fuaifatu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting taamu for sale.  Fuaifatu has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2010, Fuaifatu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Fuaifatu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Fuaifatu is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Fuaifatu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to the borrower's house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 43-year-old woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Maha is a tailor working from home and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials. 

Maha is looking to adding a dry cleaning line so that she could expand the scope of her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more raw materials.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 49 years of age, married and blessed with five children. Danilo’s wife is a housekeeper. His five children are all attending school.

Danilo manages his business of repairing farm machinery and vehicles. His shop is along the highway of their municipality. Danilo has been in this business for 30 years. With his eight helpers, he provides good services to his customers. With his initiative to earn additional income, Danilo buys surplus spare parts and sells them to his customers.

Danilo needs additional working capital in his business to extend his services to his customers. He is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy additional spare parts to use in repairing machines and to sell to his customers as well. Danilo wishes to maintain his business and to make improvements for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts to use in repairing machines and to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Raymundo; el tiene 62 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de loseria como platos,ollas entre otros utensilios,el socio ahora tambien tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y habas,por medio de estos negocios el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el local para la venta de loseria y tambien mejorar el negocio de agricultura . El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar tazas,platos y adornos de loza al por mayor y tambien para comprar semillas y ferlizantes para las tieeras de cultivo.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is Raymundo.  He is 62 years old and married with three children.  He continues working selling earthenware plates, pots, and other utensils.  Now he also has a plot of land where he grows corn, potatoes, and beans.  With these businesses he gets his children ahead.  His dream is to expand the space for selling earthenware and also to improve his agriculture business.

He is requesting the loan to buy earthenware cups, plates, and ornaments wholesale and also to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops.

The member is grateful to those who are part of this dream by means of this and pledges to making his payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy earthenware cups, plates, and decorations wholesale and to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: El señor Abelardo es Albañil. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima (ladrillos, cemento, piedra, arena, madera y calamina) para la construcción de una habitación en su vivienda. Abelardo  es casado y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la Ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que trabaja con kiva y con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Abelardo is a bricklayer.  The loan that he needs is to buy raw material (bricks, cement, stone, sand, wood, and corrugated iron) to build a room in his house.

Abelardo is married and has two children.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Alto Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that he has worked with Kiva and with IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy materials like bricks, cement, stone, sand, wood, and corrugated iron to build a room.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old. Elsie is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a fishing business venture. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 2,300 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Elsie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. In 2008, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Alfredo Eduardo

texts.es:
AlAlfredo es un joven de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Alfredo se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Medicina Humana, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alfredo trabaja en su pequeño negocio, el tiene un vivero en su propia vivienda, donde siembra variedad de flores, en especial crisantemos, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 5 horas, Alfredo se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos cuidados que les da a sus cultivos.
Alfredo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la aydua brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y semillas de nuevas variedades de crisantemos, de esta manera Alfredo tendrá sus cultuivos en mejores condiciones, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante, hasta lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional y ser distribuidor de plantas y flores en toda su ciudad.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a 20 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind and hardworking person who really wants to get ahead. Thanks to his efforts and his parents' support, Alfredo is studying human medicine. In his free time, he likes to listen to music and sometimes cook a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca to share with his family.  

O his own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Alfredo works at his small business. He has a greenhouse at his own house where he grows a variety of flowers, especially chrysanthemums. He works every day starting in the early hours of the morning and he can do it for approximately 5 hours. Alfredo is happy doing his work and believes that is going well for him because he takes good care of his plants.

Alfredo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he can buy manure, fertilizer, and seeds for a variety of chrysanthemums. This way, Alfredo will keep his plants in better condition and keep working and striving to get ahead until he attains his dream is having a great career and being a distributor of plants and flowers throughout the city.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Ta-Yokaneh Atima Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Ta-Yokaneh Atima group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. The 49-year-old is married to a trader and they have seven children, who attend schools. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for many years now; she sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil). With her share of this loan, she is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Gibrill, posing with the borrowers).

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en:
Agatha is a provisions seller located in Cape Coast. She has had some form of formal education, as she is a primary school leaver. 

She is married and has five children. Her husband is a trader. She has been selling provisions for quite some number of years now. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, eggs, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand. 

Agatha hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further, and ensure that all her children receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, eggs, biscuits, Milo, milk, and sweets, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Five years ago Alejandra started her business with US$ 50, selling candies among her kids neighbors and little by little she has been able to add more products and obtain a grocery store. She rents a video games machine. Alejandra is married and her husband works at a snack company but his income is not sufficient to support their family expenses, so Alejandra decided to start her own business. At this moment she is planning to increase the number of video games machines because they are popular rentals and she would also like to purchase more merchandise for her store to cover her growing demand. She is requesting for a loan of US$ 475 and offer to pay in 6 months at least.

**"This text has been translated from the following original business description."

Hace cinco años que Alejandra inició su negocio , con un capital D. $ 50 USD, vendiendo principalmente dulces para los niños vecinos, y poco a poco fue agregando mas productos hasta poder ofrecer abarrotes y posteriormente rentar maquinas D. videojuegos en su local. Alejandra es una mujer casada, su esposo trabaja en una compañía D. botanas pero sus ingresos resultaban insuficientes para cubrir las necesidades D. su familia, esta fue la razón que la motivo a iniciar su negocio. En estos momentos ella esta planeando en incrementar el número D. maquinas D. videojuego, ya que han tenido una muy buena aceptación y por otro lado quiere comprar algo D. inventario D. abarrotes para cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, es por eso que necesita un préstamo por $ 475 USD y quiere pagarlo en un plazo D. 6-12 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Matala

texts.en: Matala F. has a stall in the flea market where she sells different kinds of things: clothes, handicrafts, earrings, necklaces, and other products.  F. is a hard-working woman from the village of Moataa.  She goes to her flea market stall and stays there for the whole day to sell her products.  She has two daughters to help look after the business if she’s not available.  Matala earns more than ninety tala (USD 30) a day from selling her products. She is very happy because she has a business to help meet the needs of her family.  Matala will use her loan to buy what she needs to run her business.  She provides her best customer service in order to maintain her customers.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her flea market stall

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.en:
Herlinda is married and has two children in school. Her husband works as an employee in a business. His income didn't cover the children's food and education so she decided to start her own business selling clothing. At first she sold to friends and neighbors, then through referrals her client list grew and now there is good demand for what she sells. She is asking for a loan of $375 to buy merchandise because right now she doesn't have enough stock. She proposes to repay the loan in 6 to 12 months and counts on your support to continue to grow her business and support her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Herlinda es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos quienes se encuentran estudiando, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa. Ella empezó con el negocio por que con el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos, por ello decidió ponerse a vender ropa, inicialmente ofrecía a sus amigas y vecinos y poco a poco fue obteniendo más clientes por recomendación, ahora su cartera de clientes a mejorado mucho y tiene bastantes pedidos de lo que ofrece.

Esta solicitando un crédito de US $ 325 para comprar más mercancía, ya que con el inventario que tiene no le alcanza para surtir a sus clientes y ya a la fecha tiene muchos pedidos que tiene que cumplir, ofrece pagar este crédito en un período de 6 a 12 meses y espera tu colaboración y apoyo para continuar creciendo y educando a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza lives in the city of El Alto. She is single and began working, with very little capital, as a beauty consultant for a cosmetics company when she was quite young. Her income is not enough to cover her needs, even with the programs for incentives and prizes that the company has. She has been with ProMujer for 2 years and she currently has a demonstration and sales shop in the El Carmen market, where she shows her products. Esperanza’s intent is to buy furniture for her shop, which will become the base of operations and the headquarters for a group of beauty consultants that she leads. This will make it possible for her to become a Junior Director of the cosmetics company she represents.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Esperanza vive en la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera, comenzó muy joven trabajando como consultora de belleza en una empresa de cosméticos, con un capital muy pequeño, esto hacía que sus ingresos no cubran sus necesidades pese a los sistemas de incentivo y premiación de la empresa. Ella cuenta con una antigüedad de 2 años en Pro Mujer, y actualmente tiene instalado un puesto de exposición y venta en el mercado El Carmen de esta ciudad donde expone sus productos. La intención de Esperanza es comprar mobiliario para su puesto de exposición y ventas, que se convertirá en base de operaciones y sede del grupo de consultoras de belleza que lideriza y que le posibilitará ser Directora Junior de las empresas que representa.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano R., 56 is married and has three children. She has high school education. Rano R. has been selling eggs for 12 years. Her husband is currently unemployed, her oldest daughter makes a living by sewing, and her other two children are in school. Rano R. started her business with $70. Then, she did not have a permanent trading spot. Since receiving her first MicroInvest loan in 2003, Rano R. expanded her sales volume and purchased a permanent trading spot. Her business assets increased to $300. In the future, Rano R. plans to switch to wholesale trading.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахматова Рано – 56лет. Замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее. Она занимается продажей яиц 12 лет. Муж безработный, старшая дочь занимается шитьём, двое младших учатся в школе. Начала свою деятельность с 70$, тогда она не имела постоянную торговую точку. После получения займа в 2003году она начала расширять товар, приобрела постоянную торговую точку. Сейчас её активы возросли до 300$. В будущем планирует перейти и на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Switch to wholesale trading

loans.name: Sonia Marlene

texts.es:
Sonia is a hardworking woman who can adapt to every kind of job for the good of her children who give her the strength to keep going every day. Some years ago, she and her husband worked in everything involved with sales and repair of cars, but 11 months ago they decided to rent a locale independently. This small space has been giving fruits, since their hard work and the quality of their service has increased their clientele day by day. By the side of her husband, Sonia works as a team; her husband works on auto repair and she works on selling spare parts. In this way they manage to have a solid income that enhances the quality of life of their little ones. She is very happy and wishes to some day be able to own her own house, since right now they live in the same shop where they offer their services so they can cut on costs and consolidate their business. Part of the project they have started includes buying more merchandise to allow them greater sales, and so she is requesting a loan of US $ 375. Make up your mind to support an enterprising woman, keeping in mind that you are not only supporting her, but a whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Sonia es una mujer diligente y siempre se adecua a todo tipo de trabajos por el bien de sus dos hijos que cada día la mantienen con fuerzas para seguir adelante.Hace varios años que ella y su esposo trabajaban en todo lo que se refiere a la venta y reparación de autos pero deciden independizarse alquilando un local ya hace 11 meses, este pequeño espacio de ventas está dando sus frutos ya que su esfuerzo y la calidad de su servicio hacen que cada día cuenten con más clientes en sus instalaciones.A lado de su esposo Sonia ha logrado desarrollar un trabajo en equipo, su esposo se dedica a la reparación de autos y ella a la venta de los repuestos, de esta manera logran tener un sólido ingreso que incrementa la calidad de vida de sus pequeños niños.Está muy contenta y anhela algún día poder tener su casa propia ya que ellos viven en el mismo establecimiento en el que ofrecen sus servicios para abaratar los costos y consolidar su microempresa.Parte del proyecto que está emprendiendo contempla la compra de más mercadería que le permita mayores ventas y es por ello que solicita un préstamo de 375 dólares.Decídete a apoyar a una mujer emprendedora, recuerda que no sólo la estás apoyando a ella sino a toda una familia.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for their family business.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mr. Tong S., 36, lives with his wife and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  To support his family, he is currently employed at a private company as a driver, earning around $7/day.  His wife works selling vegetables at an open-air market, making about $5/day.  This couple hopes to use this loan to expand their inventory by adding more vegetables to meet their clients’ needs, and to repair their house.  Mr. Tong S. is the approved borrower for this loan, but the money will be used to expand inventory for their jointly owned business.

loans.use: To expand inventory by adding more vegetables, and to repair his house.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Vũ Thị Bắc is 33 years old. She lives in Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc with her husband and 3 young children. She is a TYM fund member since 2000. Her main occupation is raising cattle and cultivation. Before joining TYM her family living condition was very difficult. With the loans from TYM, hard work and determination, she has been able to overcome the poverty. Things have changed for the better for her family. After each round of loan, she has been able to put away some savings to buy basic things for her family: tv, motorcycle ... The family income is about 100 USD a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 650 USD to buy a pair of breeding cows. She hopes that after a few months, they would produce calves so that she would be able to recuperate her investment quickly.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Bắc, 33 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con nhỏ tại Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc. Chị là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2000. Công việc chủ yếu của chị Bắc là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Điều kiện gia đình chị trước khi tham gia Quỹ còn rất khó khăn, thiếu thốn. Sau khi được vay vốn từ Quỹ, với sự cần cù chịu khó và tự tin của bản thân kinh tế gia đình chị Bắc đã có nhiều chuyển biến. Sau mỗi vòng vốn vay chị đều tích lũy được một số tiền dùng mua sắm các trang thiết bị, đồ dùng sinh hoạt như trong nhà như: Tivi, xe máy … Cuộc sống gia đình chị đã thực sự thay đổi so với trước. Với mức thu nhập hiện tại là 100USD/tháng, chị Bắc muốn xin vay thêm 650USD từ Quỹ để mua một đôi bò sinh sản. Chị hi vọng sau vài tháng sẽ có được lứa bê đầu tiên để sớm thu hồi vốn.

loans.use: Buy two cows

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
Two years ago, María del Carmen began selling shoes through a catalog after a friend recommended it to her. María needed money to be able to cover all of her household’s expenses, being that her husband’s income as a mechanic was not enough. Little by little she built a customer base that goes to her to buy shoes since María lets them pay for her products by installments.

However, María currently does not have sufficient resources to buy more footwear. For that reason, she is requesting a loan for $300, which she is willing to repay in a 4-month term and which will allow her to buy more merchandise to offer her clients. With your help, María will be able to help her children progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 2 años que María del Carmen comenzó a vender zapatos por catálogo, lo cual lo hizo gracias a la recomendación de una amiga. Puesto que María necesitaba dinero para poder pagar todos los gastos de su casa. Ya que con lo que gana su esposo como mecánico no era suficiente. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientes que la buscan para poder comprarle zapatos. Puesto que María les vende los productos a plazos.

Sin embargo María actualmente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para comprar más calzado. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: Restock her shoe inventory.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
"I am Rehana K., wife of Shah Nawaz. I reside in Lahore, Pakistan with my husband and four kids: two boys and two girls. I [have been] a member of Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan, for the last three years. Therefore I have acquired multiple loans from them, which have served to increase our profits substantially. [The family has a shoe business.] Our biggest achievement is the construction of our own house with these increased profits. I would now again like to have another loan to invest in our shoe business.

"My group members who are in need of loans [include] Khursheeda B., who is also acquiring [the loan] for her son’s shoe business. Shahida P.’s son is a turner. Fazeelat A.’s husband supplies stationary to various shops in the city. Razia B. needs this loan for her husband, who sells candles. Nasreen B.’s husband has a printing press."

The women mentioned above are requesting loans to help expand their families' businesses.

loans.use: Expand the shoe sales business and support the other businesses

loans.name: Ema

texts.es:
Ema Ramírez began preparing and selling tamales one year ago to have an additional source of income to that of her husband’s. She did this due to the increase in her 3 children’s expenses as they grew older, and her husband not having stable employment being that he is a bricklayer and is not always employed.

She is requesting a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months to purchase prime materials and continue this activity which to this day has generated very good earnings. Let’s contribute to the development of Ema’s business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Ema Ramírez comenzó hace 1 año con la elaboración y venta de tamales para poder contar con una fuente de ingresos adicional al sueldo de su marido, debido a que los gastos de sus 3 hijos conforme iban creciendo se incrementaban y su marido no cuenta con un trabajo estable ya que trabaja como albañil y no siempre tiene trabajo.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y continuar con esta actividad que hasta la fecha le ha generado buenos ingresos. Contribuyamos a el desarrollo del negocio de Ema.

loans.use: Purchase prime materials to continue preparing and selling tamales.

loans.name: Natividad Adela

texts.es:
Mrs. Natividad belongs to the Community Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” or Women for Progress, and is dedicated to the sale of bread and cakes. Her stand is located in the central market of the district and province of Yungay, in the “departamento” of Ancash. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 soles (US $375.00), which will be repaid in six months, she will buy 15 sacks of flour and 3 boxes of butter. She is 56 years old, married and has five children. Her income allows her to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Natividad pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta D. panes y pasteles, su puesto D. venta esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará: 15 sacos D. harina y 3 cajas D. manteca. Ella tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for the preparation of her products

loans.name: Qurbonaly

texts.ru:
Qurbonaly T. lives in the town of Nurek with his family. He is forty years old, married, and has four children. He's been in the business of selling construction materials for the last five years. He would like to increase sales turnover by taking out a loan. This will help the business grow. He will be able to repay the loan within six months. Despite many difficulties, Qurbonaly has a very close, supportive family. Everyone helps each other joyfully.

Translated from Russian by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva Volunteer.

Ташрипов Курбонали житель города Нурек. Проживает вместе со своей семьей. Возраст 40 лет . Женат и имеет 4 детей. Уже пять лет занимается торговлей стройматериалов. Хочет увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет развитию бизнеса. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев. Не смотря на все трудности у Курбонали очень дружная и веселая семья. Они все помогают друг другу с радостью.

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=32462&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Liliana is a partner in the Banco Comunal Desarrollo.

Liliana is a 23-year-old single mother who has one daugther. Alongside her mother, Liliana sells fresh and frozen fish from the door of her home under an improvised tarp, which protects her from the sun. She runs this business on Saturdays and Sundays. During the week, Liliana works as a waitress in a "cebichería" (restaurant offering the traditional Peruvian dish).

Liliana needs a loan of 1,400 soles which will be invested in the purchase of fish and shellfish.

Liliana's dreams are to have her own home, provider a good education to her daughter and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=32462&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Liliana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.

Liliana es madre soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hija, Liliana junto a su mamá vende pescado fresco y congelado en la puerta de su casa en una carpa improvisada que le protege del sol, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos, además Liliana los días de la semana trabaja como mesera en una cebichería.

Liliana necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado y mariscos.

Los sueños de Liliana es tener una casa propia, brindar una buena educación a su hija y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Liliana needs a loan of 1,400 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fish and shellfish.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Mrs. Elida is 35 years old, she is married to Isidro Flecha (38 years old), who works in the Paraguari Transport company and helps her to cover the daily expenses.

They have two daughters, one is currently on her second year of Law school and the other one is in High School thanks to the sacrifice of their parents. She started her business in her own home three years ago. She learnt basic hairdressing skills working as a hairdresser assistant. Due to her initiative and her desire to get ahead she got into a Hairdressing institute in the capital so that she could improve her technique and skills.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a backwash unit to diversify her services and provide more comfort to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Elida tiene 35 años, está casada con el Sr. Isidro Flecha, de 38 años, quien trabaja en la Empresa de Transporte Paraguarí; quien le ayuda en gran parte a cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Tienen dos hijas, una actualmente esta cursando el segundo año de Derecho y la otra hija cursa la secundaria mediante el sacrificio de sus padres.

Su negocio se inició hace 3 años en su domicilio. Adquirió los conocimientos básicos siendo ayudante en una peluqueria. Pero por iniciativa y por el deseo de superacion ingresó a un instituto superior de peluqueria en la capital, para el perfeccionamiento de las técnicas y métodos.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de una silla de lavado para la diversificación de sus servicios, y mayor comodidad de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy a swivel chair (backwash unit)

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza was born in 1957. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Agdam region in Azerbaijan, and she has settled in Baku city, Nasimi region. She is married and has 2 children.

Aziza has been working as a music hometutor for 20 years. She teaches her students to play the piano. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to repair her piano and to buy the necessary training aids so she can give the best lessons for her students.

loans.use: to repair her piano and to buy the necessary training aids for improving her business

loans.name: Venn

texts.en: Venn C., 48, a widow who resides with six of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, has a business selling sugar cane juice from her home. Three of her children are students and the other three are employed in different fields. Venn would like to take out a loan of $1000 to create another business such as planting small mango trees to sell and to purchase a sewing machine to earn additional money. She believes that these measures will allow her family to double their income and thereby improve their standard of living

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and grow trees for sale.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe takku liggeye  regroupe quatre (04) membres dont trois femmes et un homme tout mariés et responsable de famille.Leur actvité principale est le petit commerce  de fruitset legumes mais aussi du poisson frais ou sec dans la banlieu de mbour .Chaque matin ils quittent leurs maisons pour se rendre dans les marchés.Le pret obtenu leur permettra de renforcer leur activité de petit commerce.
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey consists of four members, three women and one man, all of them married and responsible for their families. Their main business is small-scale sales of fruit and vegetables, but also fresh or dried fish on the outskirts of Mbour. Every morning they leave their houses to go to the marketplaces. The loan will allow them to bolster their little businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Las Andantes 2 Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "LAS ANDANTES 2" esta representado por la señora Guadalupe, sus integrantes son gente responsable que trabaja unida para sacar adelante a sus familias y sobresalir como un buen grupo D. trabajo, los socios se dedican a actidades D. comercio como a la venta D. carne, verdura, frutas y abarrotes algunos tienen actividades como la costura y la pintura son gente emprendedora y responsable ya que mantienen a sus familias con su trabajo. los miembros del grupo participaron en el anterior ciclo en su mayoría por lo que tiene experiencia en el trabajo con grupos solidarios e incentivan a las  integrantes nuevas a ser personas responsables en sus pagos. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. insumo para la venta y compra D. materiales y herramientas D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The Las Andantes 2 community bank is represented by Sra. Guadalupe. Its members are responsible people who work together to improve the lives of their families and to excel as a team. They own various businesses selling products such as meat, vegetables, fruits and groceries and services such as dress-making and painting. They're hard-working and responsible because they support their families with their businesses. Most of the group's members joined the last [borrowing] cycle so they have experience working together and they offer incentives to new members to be responsible borrowers. The purpose of the loan is to fund the purchase of goods for resale and work tools.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 46 años, vive sola, ya que está divorciada y no tuvo hijos. Se dedica a la venta D. calzados en uno D. los mercados más conocidos D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, el Mercado Tupac Amaru, desD. hace 20 años. Lo que le gusta a Elsa D. su trabajo es vender, ella siempre se ha destacado por tener poder D. convencimiento, lo cual le ayuda mucho en la venta. Las ventas, gracias a que la ubicación D. su puesto es muy buena, son muy buenas, haciéndole pensar en agrandar su negocio. Lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que permanecer en su trabajo durante varias horas al día, y pasar el frió que suele hacer en esta temporada. Este es su 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. mercadería para vender en época naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old, lives alone, as she is divorced and does not have children. She has been selling shoes for 20 years in one of the most well-known markets in Juliaca, Tupca Amaru market. What Elsa likes about her job is selling. She has always stood out for having the ability to convince others, which has helped her a lot in sales. Thanks to the good location of her stall her sales are very good, leading her to consider expanding her business. The difficult part of her work is having to remain at work during various hours of the day and the cold weather of this season. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has been punctual with her payments. With the money she will buy a large quantity of merchandise to sell in the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: Née le 03 Août 1964 à Lomé, dame E. Yolande est originaire du OUIDAH une ville historique du BENIN. Elle réside à Sègbèya l’un des quartiers populaire du capital économique du BENIN (Cotonou). Elle est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille, un dresseur de chevaux au chômage depuis onze ans suite la mort de son employeur. Elle a deux enfants dont l’aîné un garçon est à l’université et la benjamine en apprentissage de couture. Elle vend des casseroles et des bols en série ; des chaussures pour enfants et adultes ; des pagnes et des mèches. Elle exerce cette activité dans son domicile où elle livre ses produits en gros et en détail à ses clientes. Elle va s’approvisionner à Lomé.
texts.en:
Born on August 3, 1964 in Lomé, Yolande E. is originally from Ouidah, an historic town in Benin. She lives in Sègbèya, one of the most populous neighbourhoods of the economic capital of Benin (Cotonou). She is married to Cyrille Gondjou, a horse trainer who has been unemployed for 11 years after the death of his employer. She has two children: the elder is a son studying at university and the younger is a daughter apprenticing to be a seamstress. She sells pans and nested bowls; shoes for children and adults; pagnes (traditional cloth) and hair extensions. Her business is home-based and she delivers her products in bulk or in small quantities to her customers. She will travel to Lomé to purchase her products.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pans and various other items.

loans.name: Soulayman

texts.en:
Soulayman is a 49-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Soulayman has been working in agriculture for twenty-one years. He plants and sells vegetables. His sells his produce to vegetable markets. When he first started his business, his land was small, and he didn’t have a greenhouse. He decided on this business because he learned it when he was young, and he wanted to increase his land.

He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua to purchase polyethylene (plastic covers) for the greenhouse and new tools for his work. Soulayman has been a microcredit client for six years and has always re-paid his loans on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business and his family's financiA. situation. In the future, he plans to expand his land and continue improving his business.

loans.use: Buy materials and tools for his business

loans.name: Nith

texts.en: Mrs. Nith S. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a construction worker who builds houses. Mrs. Nith S.'s has been working in that field for about for eight years and can make USD $2.50 per day. Her husband, pictured here, has been operating a motor-taxi business since 1990; and he is able to earn around $5 per day. This couple has six children, two of whom are in school and two others are employed as workers. Mrs. Nith S. is asking for a loan to raise cows.

loans.use: To raise cows

loans.name: Shaheen Akhtar Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
Shaheen akhtar baji has been a citizen of Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last eleven years. She completed her education through 5th standard, but she couldn’t study further because her school was based on 1st standard through 5th standard. For 6th standard she had to enroll in secondary school, but her father couldn’t admit her because of the high fees charged by the school. Shaheen baji got married to a man whose name is A. G., and he is a driver by profession. He has driven an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for the last five years. Driving an auto-rickshaw became her family's business. Her first two sons are also drivers of auto-rickshaws. Shaheen baji has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to repair her sons' auto-rickshaws so that they will be able to continue their work and earn income. 

She is the group leader of more women from her locality. Saima baji wants a loan to buy paints to sell. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy plastic utensils to sell. Zeb-un-Nisa baji wants a loan to buy supplies (chairs, razors and mirror) for her salon. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair auto-rickshaws

loans.name: Phoung

texts.en: Phoung S., 38, is married and resides with her husband in the Kompong Cham province. She sells grocery items and is able to make US$3 of profit every day. Her husband is a policeman and earns US$2 per day. This couple has two young school-aged children. Mrs. Phoun S. needs to loan from CREDIT to expand her grocery's inventory in order to scarify her customer's needs.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta G. is an ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) member in the City of Hamtic, Province of Antique, Philippines. She is married and the 52-year-old mother to three sons. Her husband is Rodrigo G. a jeepney (small bus) driver and also a hired laborer. Two of her sons already graduated from high school and the youngest is in elementary school.

Loreta was given the opportunity to buy a pedicab when she received her first loan from ASHI. She was privileged enough since, as a means of transportation for people in the city, the use of a pedicab is in demand. As her business is growing fast, her next loan will be used to purchase a second pedicab, and some of the loan will be used as capital in buying 50 chicks and the vitamins and feed for them.

Loreta dreams that someday she and her family will get out of poverty. She hopes to send her children to school so that they are able to find stable jobs and will not suffer the same life that she has had.

loans.use: To purchase a pedicab and 50 chicks plus feed and vitamins for them

loans.name: Zinnat

texts.ru: Зиннат Шокирова  сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Она  торгует канцелярскими товарами. Сезон продаж в школьное время. Но сейчас она продает батарейками и другими необходимыми хозяйствами и принадлежностями. В зимнее время торгует  свечками и спичками, а также фонариками, потому что в зимнее время ограничено электричество, эти все предметы идут на реализацию.
texts.en:
Zinnat S. has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. She sells school supplies. Her sales season is during the school period. But right now she is selling batteries and other necessary products. In the winter she sells candles and matches and also flashlights because in the wintertime electricity is limited; she sells all of these items. .

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Mr. Jose G. T. is 60 years old, and has been married to Mrs. Claudelina Nuñez for many years.  They live in their own home in the neighborhood Arroyo Pora Vivienda from the Cambyreta district. 

Mr. G. is the owner of a stand that sells underwear and socks for men in the lower part of the city Encarnación.  He has been doing this for over 10 years.  Additionally, at night he works as a night watchman for various local businesses in the same zone.  Due to his two jobs, he has been able to sustain his family and has been able to settle any expenses that present themselves. 

This man is currently applying for credit in order to purchase more goods and to increase his capital for work, as he already has a large clientele that buys from his stand.  The amount applied for is 2,000,000 Gs.

loans.use: The purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Саидумар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Саидумар Нумонов проживает в городе Истаравшане. Он занимается предпринимательской деятельностью.У него есть две точки продаж на рынке города. В первой точке он реализует сладости (конфеты и печенья), а во второй точке хозяйственные товары. Вторую точку он открыл недавно, после того как первый раз получил у нас кредит. 
 Он закупил 40 кг. пряников и 36 кг. российского шоколада. Продал товар и получил хорошую прибыль.   
 На доходы открыл дополнительную точку по реализации хозтоваров.
Саидумар обратился в нашу организацию за повторным кредитом, для закупа хозяйственных товаров во вторую точку продаж.В этой точке сын Саидумара будет торговать.
Саидумар преобретает товар у поставщиков, который привозят из Китая.
 Жена Саидумара Махбуба и его невестка помогают ему в его бизнесе.
texts.en:
Saidumar Numonov lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is an entrepreneur, who has two retail outlets at the city market. Saidumar sells sweets (candies and cookies) at the first store and household goods at the second. He recently opened the second store, soon after obtaining his first loan from us. He bought 40 kilograms of pryanik cookies and 36 kilograms of Russian chocolate. He sold the products and made a good profit and then used the profits to open the household store. Saidumar requested another loan from our organization in order to buy household products for the second store. Saidumar’s son will start selling at this store. Saidumar buys his merchandise from suppliers, who bring it from China. Saidumar’s wife, Mahbuba, and daughter-in-law help him with the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household goods

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La señora Edith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cajas Reales”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 32 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 1 hijo,  tiene estudios superiores (Técnico en Enfermería), vive en el Barrio Chanu Chanu en Puno.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 7 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para la compra  de lana.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, lo utilizará para la compra de lanas acrílica de diferentes colores, lana de alpaca al por mayor, y los vende en Lima, a veces atiende pedidos  en artesanías en variedades diversas.
 
Su mayor  deseo es seguir trabajando, y buscar un contacto internacional para exportar directamente.

A ella le gustan la  unión entre las socias, las actividades que realizan y las charlas.
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the Cajas Reales Community Bank, which is located in the Chucuito district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 32, in a common law marriage, and has one son. She has a college education (Nurse’s Technician). She lives in the Chanu Chanu neighborhood in Puno.. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost seven years. She bought wool with an initial loan for 300 PEN. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy different colors of acrylic wool and wholesale alpaca wool. She will sell them in Lima. Sometimes she takes handicraft orders of diverse varieties. Her biggest desire is to keep working and to look for an international contact to be able to export directly. She likes the unity between members, the activities they do, and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy acrylic wool

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia E. C. is 37 years old and has lived her entire life in Boane, Mozambique. She was raised by her aunts. Due to the loss of her parents at a young age, Julia never had the opportunity to go to school. For the past 10 years, Julia has been working selling products in the Boane market. She learned her trade from family members. Her best-selling product is used clothes. She is able to buy a bundle of used clothes for 8,000 MZN and sell them for 10,000 MZN. Julia earns around 3,000 MZN a month.

Julia is requesting this loan to be able to offer more products to her clients. She will purchase products that her clients have been requesting, hoping to expand sales. Julia is the mother of four children ages 12, 16, 18, and 20. Three of her four children are currently in school. In the future Julia hopes to be able to build a home that her family can comfortably live in. To facilitate this, she hopes to see continued growth of her business and will continue to take out loans with Hluvuku.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en Centro Poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos, ella es iletrada, vive en de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 2 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocio de venta de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va adquirir sogas para luego venderlos en las ferias de la zona.  Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor.

Su deseo es dedicarse a la venta de animales y compra de forraje.

A ella le gustan los ahorros las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Gregoria is a member of the community bank “Chijuyo Copapujo”, located in the village of Chijuyo Copapujo, in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She cannot read and lives in Chijuyo Copapujo.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for more than 2 years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which served as capital for her business of selling ropes. Currently she requires an additional loan, which she is requesting for the sum of 500 soles. With this amount, she will buy ropes to later sell in the regional markets. In parallel, she is also breeding small livestock. Her wish is to sell animals and buy forage crops. She likes saving and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ropes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells provisions and drinks. She is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Comfort has been in this business for the past two years. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana Benita

texts.es: La señora Juana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las mercedes II”, Distrito de Bagua Grande, Provincia Utcubamba, Departamento de Amazonas. Es viuda, tiene 70 años, tiene 4 hijos, que son independientes. La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia y de verla superarse, la llevaron a decidirse por buscar una fuente de ingresos, ella inicia su negocio con un capital de S/. 100.00,  comenzó vendiendo poco, compraba y vendía, hasta conocer mas gente, tener mas clientes, finalmente decide emprender con mas fuerza este negocio, ahora, cría en su casa donde tiene una considerable cantidad de animales domésticos. Ella  con mucho esfuerzo y empeño esta haciendo crecer su negocio.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00, comprará mas animales como gallinas y  patos,  para luego venderlos, también comprará productos para su alimentación como, polvillo, maíz y vitaminas, ya que son animales que tienen mayor  acogida por su clientela, sobre todo en los restaurantes donde venden comida de la región, ella compra animales de diversos tamaños para variar sus precios y vender mas, así como también mantener a su clientela satisfecha.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y requiere de mucho esfuerzo para la edad avanzada que ella tiene, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  otras  mujeres que quieren salir adelante.

loans.use: Comprará gallinas y patos bebes.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel I. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de oro City. He is 35 years old and single. To make a living, Rodel works as foreman at a construction site, and at the same time he raises pigs for sale as his additional source of income. Rodel has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately $110 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Rodel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This will be his second loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en: Pictured are Mrs. Chuong S. and her husband, Min Pal, both of whom are 54 years old. To earn a living, this couple is hired by the garment industry to clean up the finished clothing.  For this work the couple can generate a daily income of $2.50. Chuong S. has four married children and one single child. All four of them are employed: two are electricians, one drives a trailer taxi, and the last one is a garment worker. Chuong S. is taking out her loan to pay the cost of connecting new electricity for family use, and she will use the rest of the loan for her child to replace an old taxi that is not attractive.

loans.use: To connect new electricity for family use

loans.name: Botr

texts.en: Mrs. Botr T. is a villager in the village of Trapaing Chrey, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a grocer who sells various goods. Mrs. Botr T. is a 56 years old widow with a child who is a teacher in the local school. Her child is also a pig breeder. Since the business of breeding pigs is doing well, Mrs. Botr T. wants to expand it by purchasing ten more piglets and pig feed for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family living's standard with this loan.

loans.use: Requesting a loan to buy ten more piglets and pig feed for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Pheany Nget Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pheany N. is a group leader of six, who all live in Daom village in Takeo province. She breeds pigs, and is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her field is infertile which is badly affecting her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field and make the crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Srey Sarun, is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Pheany N. is 42 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field and make the crops more productive.

loans.name: Thelma Elizzette

texts.es: La señora Thelma Ramírez trabaja en una empresa como Analista Presupuestaria desde hace un año, a muchos esfuerzos logro concluir su carrera en contabilidad, lo cual desea llegar a ejercer la contabilidad generar. Tiene 36 años de edad, procreo dos hijos que estudian también esta al cuidado de su mama que tiene 70 años y cuida de su salud y sus medicamentos, su esposo es contador. Doña Thelma vende cosméticos y ropa por encargo en su trabajo como en su casa ya que tiene que recoger para poder ayudar a su mama. Con este préstamo lo que desea es poder hacer mejora a la cocina por que la madera esta vieja  como hacer un bajarete para mejor comodidad ya que le da mucho el sol. En un futuro espera lograrla hacer su cocina toda de concreto. Es su quinto ciclo  en Afodenic el cual  ha logrado poder tener mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Thelma Ramírez, 36, has worked as a budget analyst for a company for the past year. With much effort she was able to finish her education as an accountant and she wants to be a general accountant. She has two children and she also cares for her 70-year-old mother; seeing to her health and medicines. Her husband is an accountant. Thelma also sells cosmetics and clothing per prior order both at her work and from home because she needs the extra income to help her mother. With this financing she would like to make improvements to her kitchen because the wood is old. She also wants to build a covered shelter from the sun for more comfort. In the future, she hopes to make her kitchen completely of concrete. This is her fifth loan cycle with Afodenic which has helped her attain better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting, nails and lumber to repair kitchen and build a shelter from the sun.

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en:
Titilayo, a member of LAPO Microfinance, is excited to take a Kiva loan with LAPO. Forty-six years old and the mother of three children, she is married to Mr. A., an automobile mechanic. She is the owner of Iya-beji Cool Spot, a beer parlour where her customers come to relax with bottles of drinks, beers and soft drinks. She also sells drinks wholesale.

Titilayo has been a client of LAPO for over two years and is now requesting a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more drinks in large quantities to sell. She says she needs more money to purchase stock during this festive period when people buy more drinks. She appreciates all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban tiene 43 años está acompañado con la señora Antonia López, tienen una hija de 12 años que acaba de culminar la primaria.
 
Esteban se dedica a la elaboración de chipas hace más de 10 años, lo realiza en su propio domicilio, donde cuenta con todas las herramientas necesarias, posteriormente su señora se encarga de la comercialización en forma ambulante, ya sea en ómnibus que transitan sobre la Ruta Nº 1 o por las calles de la ciudad, ésta labor la realiza junto con tres señoras más.

Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de ingredientes para la chipa, debido a que en esta época tiene un buen movimiento y desea aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Esteban is 43 years old. He lives with Antonia López and they have a 12 year old daughter together, who just finished middle school. Esteban has been making Chipas for more than 10 years. He works in his house where he has all the necesary equipment. Later on, his wife sells them on the street, getting into the busses that go around Route #1 or through the city streets. Another 3 women work with her. He would like to use this loan to purchase ingredients as during this time of the year sells go up, so he wants to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for Chipa (starch-based batter) such as starch, cheese, corn flour and milk

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has owned and operated a coffee shop for eight years already. He also serves narguileh (also known as 'shisha' in Egypt), which is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. This tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit-flavored tobacco. Ahmad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Ahmad is special in his work because his clients feel comfortable coming to his shop. His clients can be anyone from his region. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his business and maybe enlarging his shop so that he can welcome more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: José Miguel

texts.es:
Josè Miguel Guzmán C. tiene 21 años, es soltero, y  no tiene hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Calzado Solidario es un recinto que se encuentra a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel en la vía a la costa.  Son 19 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.

Josè trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, papas y una  siembra  pocas cantidades de legumbres.  Vende los productos en la feria de San Miguel. 

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero en donde se reúnen todas las familias.

Josè solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y semillas para el cultivo de legumbres.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
José Miguel Guzmán C. is 21, single, and does not have children. He lives in the San Miguel district in the Bolívar province. He is a member of the Calzado Solidario Communal Bank. It meets in an area that is 15 minutes from the San Miguel district on the way to the coast. There are a total of 19 members in the group, which is composed mainly of farmers and livestock breeders. José works as a farmer in order to improve his family’s financial situation. He grows corn, potatoes, and a small amount of vegetables. His products are sold at the San Miguel Fair. The main cultural event is Carnival, which is celebrated every year during the month of February. José is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his field work and seeds for his vegetable crops. His goal is to generate good economic activity that will support his family. The main challenges that he faces are climate problems and diseases that impact his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and seeds to cultivate his crops

loans.name: Rasidat

texts.en:
Rasidat O. is 40 years old and is married with four children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. Rasidat’s children are excelling in school and this gives her joy. She hopes that her children will be graduates in the future.

Rasidat sells plastics products to make a living. She has customers, usually friends, neighbors and residents, that place specific orders for plastics. She hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more plastics products to sell. She hopes to grow her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kipas

texts.en:
Kipas is a 36-year-old farmer who is married with three children. He grows maize on his farm and also keeps livestock for resale. He has been selling livestock for a period of two years now. He makes a profit of approximately 40,000 KES per month.
Kipas was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by an existing client. He has not borrowed from another microfinance institution (MFI) before. He wants to use his loan to buy more cows, sheep and goats for resale. In the future, he hopes to buy a motorbike in order to supply meat with ease to nearby butcheries.

loans.use: To buy more cows, sheep and goats for fattening and resale

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La Joven Maria de los Ángeles B. R. es comerciante del Mercado Santa Ana su negocio es venta de ropa usada y esta ubicado en los módulos de Santa Ana, el financiamiento lo solicito porque nesecitaba surtir su negocio y comprar unas pacas que le vendian a precio favorable con el fin de vender y obtener  ganancias para reinvertirlo.
Su negocio lo administra con la ayuda de su mamá no tiene a nadie a cargo le gusta atender su negocio y estudiar.
Es su primer crédito con ceprodel espera que todo le salga muy bien para seguir trabajando con nosotros por un buen rato y así poder ver su negocio crecer.
texts.en:
La Joven Maria de los Ángeles B. R. es comerciante del Mercado Santa Ana su negocio es venta de ropa usada y esta ubicado en los módulos de Santa Ana, el financiamiento lo solicito porque nesecitaba surtir su negocio y comprar unas pacas que le vendian a precio favorable con el fin de vender y obtener ganancias para reinvertirlo. Su negocio lo administra con la ayuda de su mamá no tiene a nadie a cargo le gusta atender su negocio y estudiar. Es su primer crédito con ceprodel espera que todo le salga muy bien para seguir trabajando con nosotros por un buen rato y así poder ver su negocio crecer.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para comprar mercaderia para mi negocio  pacas de niño y de niña

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda M. is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs.  Happily married to Ronald M., a food vendor, they are blessed with five children.  Luzviminda makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing their own food vending business for three years now.

Luzviminda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than three years. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she has been able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business. 

To ensure the success of her business, Luzviminda would like to apply for a loan of 18,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to the expanding businesses by buying raw ingredients to continue the operation of her food vending business.

Luzviminda dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for food production

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 58 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus siete hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad de la selva peruana.Es una mujer luchadora que a pesar de las carencias económicas que paso cuando era niña, logro salir adelante, y en la actualidad atiende en su tienda de abarrotes que instalo con mucho esfuerzo, y ya lleva casi 34 años trabajando de manera constante. Su estrategia de permanecer en un negocio tan competitivo es que siempre compra productos que están al alcance del público en general, además mantiene su tienda siempre bien abarrotada de variedad de productos. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, y su rutina diaria empieza a las 5  de la mañana, y se extiende  hasta las 9  de la noche. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda de abarrotes con la finalidad de poder introducir nuevos productos, para ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.Este es el tercer crédito que tiene  con MFP, y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo puntualmente con sus pagos, además asegura sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, debido a que todos los integrantes se ayudan para salir adelante.Rosa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en  la compra de cantidad de  mercadería con el propósito de abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, pues quiere incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 58, is a single mother who lives with her seven children. They live in their own home in a community in the Peruvian jungle. She is a hardworking woman who managed to get ahead despite financial problems when she was a child. She currently runs her grocery store which she worked hard to open. She has been working there steadily for almost 34 years. Her strategy to solidify herself in such a competitive business is to always buy products that are within the reach of the general public. Furthermore, she always keeps her store well-stocked with a variety of products. She usually works on her own, but her children occasionally help her. Her day starts at 5 am and lasts until 9 pm. Her plan for the future is to expand her grocery store with the goal of introducing new products, in order to offer her customers the best. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with repayments. She is also very comfortable with her community bank, since all of the members help each other to get ahead. Rosa plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store, as she wants to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Mirtha Victoria

texts.es:
Mirtha es casada y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia en la universidad, Mirtha es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte hace 15 años y lo que mas le gusta de FINCA son las capacitaciones y reuniones amenas que tiene, Mirtha tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Mirtha los días domingos vende mondongo en su casa. La proyección de Mirtha es procesar cereales para desayuno. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y leche.
Su mayor sueños es tener una empresa de producción de lácteos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is married and has two children, one of which is studying at the university. Mirth has been a member of the Buena Suerte Communal Bank for 15 years, and what she most likes about FINCA are the enjoyable trainings and meetings that it holds. Mirtha has a store in her house where she sells general groceries every day. Additionally, Mirtha sells tripe from her home on Sundays. Her plan is to process cereals for breakfast. Her loan would be invested in buying rice, sugar and milk. Her biggest dream is to have a dairy business.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and milk

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela B. is from the village of Lalog 2, Luna, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Estela is married and has 3 adult children. Estela owns & operates a retail store where she sells rice to the local community.Through this business, Estela has been able to lift her family's living conditions so she really does her best to make the business to prosper. Estela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Estela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Her previous loan was of great help to her business, so she is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Estela from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
