Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Esmeraldeñas ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Esmeraldeñas está formado por un grupo de 9 personas entre hombres y mujeres, quienes buscan en el microcrédito la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios y mejorar su economía, son oriundos de la provincia de Esmeraldas y ahora vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida  por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico, su gastronomía y su gente.

La Señora. Rosa Manogi B. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Esmeraldeñas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, es el primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y ha sido invitada por una amiga a formar parte del banco comunal. Nuestra socia es de la provincia de Esmeraldas, ha venido a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de una oportunidad de trabajo, se dedica hace 6 años a la venta de camarón, labora los días feriados y fines de semana de 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. 
La Señora Rosa Manogi tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 19, 13 y 12 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos viven independientemente, su cuarto hijo este año ingresa a la universidad, su quinto hijo está en la escuela debido a que ha perdido el año escolar y su último hijo ingresa este año al colegio, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de camarón. Su sueño es el llegar a tener su casa propia.

La Señora María De Jesús B. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 53 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos de 32, 29 y 28 años de edad, todos sus hijos son casados y viven  independientemente,  su esposo se dedica a la venta ambulante de ceviche, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Nuestra socia es  de la provincia de Esmeraldas, vive en esta ciudad hace 6 años incentivada por el trabajo y en busca de mejorar su estabilidad económica, se dedica  a la venta de ceviche hace 24 años, vende recorriendo  los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca, labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m., de domingo a domingo. Es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y lo va a invertir en la compra de ostras para sus ceviches. Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres Esmeraldeñas ["Women from Esmereldas"] has 9 members, men and women, who are looking to microcredit for the opportunity to expand their businesses and improve their finances. They are all from the province of Esmereldas and now live in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its beautiful countryside, its historical center, its gastronomy and its people. Mrs Rosa Manogi B. is a member of the Mujeres Esmeraldenas. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This is her first loan with the Fundacion and she was invited to be part of the community group by a friend. She is from the province of Esmereldas, and came to the city of Cuenca looking for work. For 6 years she has sold shrimp. She works on holidays and weekends from 7 am to 6 pm. Mrs Rosa Manogi is 42, and a single mother of 6 children ages 25, 23, 20, 19, 13 and 12. Her three oldest children live independently. Her fourth child started university this year, her fifth child is still in primary school since he failed the last grade, and her youngest child is entering high school this year. She does not have her own home because she rents. She will invest this loan in the purchase of shrimp. Her dream is to have her own home. Mrs Maria De Jesus B. lives in the city of Cuenca and is 53. She is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children ages 32, 29 and 28. All of their children are married and live independently. Her husband sells ceviche [citrus-marinated seafood] door to door. They do not have their own home; they rent. She is from the province of Esmeraldas, and has lived in this city for 6 years, motivated by the work and looking to increase her financial stability. She has sold ceviche for 24 years. She sells by going to the markets of the city of Cuenca. She sells from 6 am to 2 pm, every day of the week. This is her first loan with the Fundacion and she will invest it in the purchase of oysters for her ceviches. Her goal is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of shrimp and oysters.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and dried fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish, as well as fresh ones, to sell. Flora is 43 years old and is married; her husband is a police man. She has four children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To stock more dried and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline P. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 50 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Evangeline operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as milk, coffee, sardines, soft drinks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding her business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mixy

texts.en:
Mixy belongs to the communal bank “Feria Fluvial” located in Valdivia. She has a stand where she sells fish and shrimp in the fair “Feria Fluvial” in the city.  This fair is part of a commercial part of the city beside the river Calle Calle, and this explains the name of the fair, as "fluvial" refers to a body of water, river or lake.
  
Mixy´s stand has been part of the family business for at least 60 years, when her grandmother used to run the business. She has run the stand for the past eight years along with her mother and aunt.  With this loan, Mixy would like to purchase a freezer to store the pre-cooked shrimp and sell them to local restaurants. 

She is the mother of four: 19, 17, and 10 year olds and a newborn only six months old. Only the three youngest reside with her. Mixy dreams of owning her own house, for which she applied for a mortgage and will receive news by the end of September. 

Mixy likes that the payments to Fondo Esperanza are weekly, as they allow her to ask for how much she needs and is able to pay it little by little.  She is also pleased with the disposition of her loan officer, as she is available to advise and teach her skills on how to run a business. 

Valdivia is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Ríos region.  It is known for having one of the few navigable rivers in Chile.  Among Valdivia's principal economic activities are the metallurgy industry, naval construction, wood production, paper and cellulose production, beer factories, and milling.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs Vanna N. and her husband, Mr Tom Toch (pictured above) have been married since 1984 and have eight children - seven sons and one daughter. One of them is married and lives away from home, one is a garment factory worker, three help their parents in the business and the other three attend school. The family lives on National Road No. One, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vanna and her husband are rice and vegetable farmers. In addition to farming, Mr Tom Toch is a fisherman. The couple have applied for a Kiva loan twice before. Vanna is now requesting her third loan of $1,200 to continue her farming business by purchasing fertilizer, pesticides and fuel.

loans.use: To use for farming

loans.name: Syrgaiym's Group

texts.en: Syrgaiym N. is the leader of the group. She is 45 and divorced. She has a daughter and a son; both of them are as school. In order to make money, Syrgaiym rents a shop and sells convenience goods. In this way, she earns 8,000 soms per month. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase a variety of convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. Aisuluu E. is the treasurer of the group. She is 40 and married. She has a daughter and a son. The son studies at university and the daughter is at school. Aisuluu works in the Department of Registration and her husband is a private driver. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a computer. In the future, she wants to provide her children a good education. Omurbek A., 39, is married. He has three daughters. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 3,000 soms, Omurbek and his wife started to breed livestock. With money received from the loan, they want to purchase more livestock for breeding. Abdugalim A., 49, is married. He has three sons and two daughters. Abdugalin is a private driver and his wife works as a teacher. Abdugalim wants to start breeding cattle. With money received from the loan, he wants to purchase a cow. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Arnaldo de 44 años y sus 4 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Teresa ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de plátano y café de la provincia de Chanchamayo, lugar hasta donde llegan sus compradores para obtener sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos de cultivo. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy puntual. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 40, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 44 year old husband, Arnaldo, and their four minor children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Teresa has worked with her father in cultivating the land since she was very small.  As the years passed she managed to buy her own fields.  Now she is one of the primary banana and coffee producers in the Chanchamayo province.  That is where her buyers come to get her crops.  

What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops, which she does with much love.  She has been doing this work for 20 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market.  It is very difficult to find trucks that want to take the heavy bags that contain her harvested crops.  In time she wishes to buy new land so that she will be able to increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very sure that she will be able to make all of her payments punctually because she has always been very punctual.  She is a very happy and supportive member of her communal bank.  She will use the 2,500 soles that she is requesting to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to improve production of her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve crop production

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Durante mucho tiempo Nelly ha trabajado en diferentes oficios pero debido a la exigencia y el esfuerzo que requerían D. ella hizo que deje los trabajos mas aun por dedicarse a su familia, ella quería trabajar por su cuenta utilizando sus ratos libres para no descuidar a sus hijos fue una buena amiga la que le enseño a vender diversos productos por campañas, así empezó con los turrones un dulce muy popular en el Perú que tiene mucha demanda los meses D. octubre, realmente le fue bien en sus ventas sus turrones tuvieron mucha demanda, ahora esta abocada a la campaña que viene.  la venta D. panetones por navidad  ella quiere invertir el dinero D. su préstamo abasteciéndose D. este producto sabe que tendrá mucha demanda, para la época D. verano también quiere dedicarse a la venta D. helados su suegra le ha ofrecido un espacio para que pueda empezar  este negocio, Nelly es feliz por que trabajando pueD. ayudar a su hija que estudia en la universidad y lo que la hace mas feliz es sentirse útil a sus 49 años, con su trabajo dentro del grupo como secretaria también se siente satisfecha.

*Nelly viste polo mostaza
texts.en:
Nelly has worked in different trades for a long time.  However, owing to the demands and effort which they required from her, she gave the jobs up in order to devote herself to her family.  She wanted to work for herself in her spare time so that she didn't have to neglect her children.  It was a good friend who taught her to sell various seasonal products.  She began selling nougat (a very popular sweet in Peru which is in high demand in October).  Her nougat sales went well.  Her nougat was in high demand.  Now she is getting ready for the upcoming season, selling panettones for Christmas.  She would like to invest her loan in stocking up with this product as she knows that there will be a lot of demand.  In the summer season she also wants to sell ice cream.  Her mother-in-law has offered her a space so that she can begin this business.  Nelly is happy because by working she can help her daughter who is studying at university.  What makes her even happier is feeling useful at 49 years of age.  Her work as secretary of her group also makes her feel satisfied.

*Nelly is the woman wearing the mustard-colored polo shirt.

loans.use: To buy panettones for the holidays

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en: Kamal G. is a 50-year-old farmer who has been growing vegetables and raising cattle in the Internal Displaced People Settlement for the last seven  years.  He is working in the local post office but his salary is too small to cover the needs of four children. He currently has two cows which produce milk. Kamal sells dairy to the local people. His son is helping him look after the cows. He plans to buy one more cow. Kamal had previously taken out a loan from AqroInvest and had successfully repaid it.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and fodder

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta  R. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Obo, Dalaguete, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating one business venture: buying and selling vegetables. Her husband Maximiano R., who is 49 years old, works as a motorcycle driver ("habal-habal") to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 10 to 23 years old.  

Restituta  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Restituta  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use as additional business capital so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children.  

Restituta  R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: buying and selling vegetables

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
As the saying goes, opportunity knocks only once. Rochelle D. C. knows this truth and grabs opportunity as it comes her way. Rochelle, 32, is a single mother of one child who is in elementary school. After finishing high school, Rochelle strived more to sustain their daily needs and to prepare financially for the future of her young child. The family lives in Pasay City, Philippines.

Rochelle runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells items that are needed daily by her neighbors. Products on her shelves range from bars of soap  to candy and energy drinks to rice.  She also manages a food stall where she sells foodstuffs to neighbors. After 18 years in business, Rochelle knows how to pay her dues. She also has an excellent reputation with her fellow community partners in CCT and, most important, with her customers. She earns an average of 10,000 Philippines pesos (Php) per month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php11,000 loan. She intends to use this money to replenish the inventory of her store for the Christmas season and to purchase raw meat and other ingredients needed for her food vending business.  Rochelle plans to take this opportunity to drive her businesses toward more profitability.  

Rochelle's life is never without challenges, both in her business and personal life. Nonetheless, she stays focused on the opportunities that lie ahead, and not on the failures of yesterday or the worries of today.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To replenish stock for her store and purchase ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Tegshee

texts.en:
Tegshee is 31-years-old and lives with her husband and three sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. All of her three children attend a local school. Her husband works for the gold mine during summer months and helps Tegshee with the business during summer months.

Tegshee operates a clothing sales business at a local market in the city. Currently her business is good, and she has two stalls at which she sells her goods, which are imported from China. She started her business in 2005 after operating a grocery trading business between 2002 and 2004. She works hard to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in order to buy her own apartment for her family. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods to sell for upcoming Tsagaan Sar, the Mongolian new year.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing goods to sell

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeung T., 40, is a local crop farmer who lives in a rural area near Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Mrs. Soeung T. has no life partner because she divorced her husband a year ago. She has two single kids who are employees at different companies, while another child is now married and lives independently. 

Mrs. Soeung T. will be using a Kiva loan to add to her personal savings to build a new house for her single kids to live in when they marry.

loans.use: To build a new house for her single kids to live in when they marry

loans.name: Abra  Delali

texts.fr: Madame  Abra fait le commerce de produit d’alimentation. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer  financièrement aux besoins  de ses  2 enfants. Elle a débuté en 1990 l’activité et s’approvisionne au grand marché de  Lomé.  Ensuite elle revend  les  produits au  marché  local d’adidogomé.  Elle  a 35  ans et est mariée. Elle est née en Côte d’Ivoire  et habite adidogomé. Pour augmenter son commerce, elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 2 cartons de tomate, 5 sacs de riz et 2 cartons de sucre.
texts.en: Ms. Abra runs a grocery business. This activity allows her to financially support her two children. She began in 1990 and she buys her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market. She resells the goods at local market in Adidogomé. She is married, she was born 35 years ago in the Ivory Coast and lives Adidogomé. To improve her business, she is requesting a loan to buy two boxes of tomatoes, five bags of rice and two boxes of sugar.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Miurel Del Socorro

texts.es:
Miurel del Socorro vive con una hermanaes en Nueva Guinea, se desempeña de docente, impartiendo sus clases con gran dedicacion y esmero, es una persona muy resonsable y estudiosa, actualmente finalizo su estudios en licenciatura de Biologia, desde pequeña a realizado el efuerzo por salir adelante en los estudios, obtiene ingreso de su actividad permitiendole desarrollarse y ampliar sus conocimientos. 

Solicita su crédito con el apoyo de Kiva para realizar un baño y bodega esto le permitira tener mejores condiciones y dar mayor valor de mercado a su casa. 

Su mayor sueño es que su vivienda luzca bonita y con todas las condiciones que se necesita en ella para un vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Miurel del Socorro lives with her sisters in Nueva Guinea. She works as a teacher, giving her classes with great dedication and care. She is a very responsible and studious person. She is currently finishing her bachelor’s degree in biology. From the time she was a young girl, she worked hard in her studies. She earns a living by teaching, which allows her to develop as a person and increase her knowledge. 

She is requesting a loan, with the support of Kiva, to add a bathroom and a storage room in her house. This will allow her to live in better conditions and will also add market value to her house. 

Her greatest dream is for her house to look nice and have all of the conditions necessary for a better life.

loans.use: To build a bathroom and a storage room

loans.name: Roddy

texts.fr:
Client de 31 ans, célibataire sans enfant, détenteur d'une licence en économie,toujours au chômage, au lieu de dépendre de ses parents il se lance dans la vente des produits divers DVD et  cassettes Vidéo.
Il ouvre son étalage en 2008 et il achète auprès des grands fournisseurs des vidéos, des DVD et autres produits divers pour son commerce.
A l'obtention de son prêt il va renforcer le stock des ses DVD, les vidéo cassettes, mettre a disposition des clients des produits de tous genres qui vont aussi contribuer a l'élargissement de son étalage. 
Tres entreprenant il a des grandes ambitions ,voyager pour aller a l'étranger  et être un grand importateur des produits divers.
texts.en: The client is 31 years old, single and does not have children.  He holds a degree in economics and is unemployed, but instead of depending on his parents, he sells a variety of DVDs and video cassettes.  He opened his stand in 2008 and buys videos, DVDs and other products from wholesalers to resell at his business.  He is going to use the loan to expand his stock of DVDs and video cassettes to offer his clients choices in all genres which will also contribute to developing his stand.  He is very forward-looking and has big ambitions to travel to foreign countries and to become a large-scale importer of varied products.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and video cassettes

loans.name: Ourn

texts.en: Ourn L. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Ourn is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 55 on the other necessary expenses. Ourn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Kisanga Group

texts.en:
Hamimu M. is in his mid forties, married, and has five children all of whom attend school. He has a fruit and vegetable business where he works from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily. He is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Hamimu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He is requesting a loan to increase his capital in order to buy more fruits and vegetables.  His dream is to improve his children's education and also have a food shop business.

Hamimu will share this loan with his loan group "Kisanga," which has 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Hamimu is in the middle, front row wearing a blue shirt.

loans.use: To increase on the capital in order to buy more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo tiene 27  años. Vive con su esposa e hijo en su propia casa en el caserío  San Bernardino, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Túcume, en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehiculo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. También, su esposa y él se dedican a la costura. Ofrecen el servicio a sus vecinos y conocidos en la zona. Abelardo solicita un préstamo para la compra de otra máquina de coser lo que los ayudará cumplir más pedidos en menos tiempo. Abelardo y su esposa trabajan juntos para sacar adelante a su familia. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado en esta meta.
texts.en: Abelardo is 27 years old. He lives with his wife and son in his own house in San Bernardino, a hamlet located 10 minutes away from the town of Túcume, in the north of Peru. He earns a living offering transporting passengers with his moto taxi, a motorcycle with an attached cabin to offer transportation services. Together with his wife, he also engages in sewing, and they offer this service to their neighbors and their acquaintances. Abeladro is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine that will help them prepare more orders in less time. Abelardo and his wife work together in order to provide for their family, and they are thankful to Kiva lenders for the support they offer them in reaching this goal.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Kagabi Multi Purpose Group

texts.en: N. Aisha is 29 years old. She has operated her restaurant for 5 years now, in Mpigi Town. Aisha is happily married and has 3 kids. She says that she was inspired by her friends to set forth in this business. Previously, Aisha, who comes across as a stickler of hard work, says she more into farming. She says her weekly profits are in the amount of Uganda shillings 70,000. She says with this loan, she is going to purchase more foods to be prepared and resold at the restaurant.

loans.use: The purchase of more food to be prepared and resold at the restaurant.

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es:
Higinio, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y cuatro hijos de 19, 18, 17, 15 años de edad, él se dedica a las labores agropecuarias, crianza de ganado y cultivos de maíz y frijol, inicia sus labores a las 4:00am hasta las 4:00pm, aprendió en su familia cuando le ayudaba a su padre.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra insumos agrícolas (abono y fertilizantes), también unas vacas, con este financiamiento cubrirá gastos muy necesarios para realizar sus labores, como son la inversión en ganado al igual que en la agricultura.
Él tiene la esperanza de fortalecer el negocio con esta inversión, acompañado de mucho trabajo espera tener una buena cosecha y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Higinio lives with his family, composed of his wife and their four children, aged 19, 18, 17, and 15. He is a farmer who raises cattle and cultivates corn and beans. He works from 4:00am to 4:00pm. He learned the trade from his family, while helping his father. He requests a loan to purchase agricultural inputs (fertilizers), and to purchase a few cattle. This loan will help him cover the expenses incurred by his work, including the investment of purchasing new livestock, and investments in his agricultural projects. His hope is to strengthen his loan through this investment and with hard work. He hopes to have a good harvest, to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products and cattle.

loans.name: Jimmy Omar

texts.es:
Jimmy Omar tiene 19 años, Es soltero vive con la madre y un hermano, no tiene hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Jimmy se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz  desde hace tiempo, pues es una actividad que le enseño su padre fallecido, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero y ayudar a su madre y hermano.

Le gusta salir a la ciudad de Ventanas a visitar a los amigos.
texts.en:
Jimmy Omar is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and one brother. He has no children. He lives in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. 

The members of "LA UNION" communal bank come together in the Aguas Frías de Medellín neighborhood, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and pole beans. 

Jimmy has worked in agriculture for some time, planting corn. His late father taught him this profession. He buys what he needs in Ventanas, and he sells his crops at the daily markets, especially the Sunday market. 

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost. With the help of the loan, he will be able to improve his economic situation so that he can cover his needs. Some of the challenges he faces are the competition and the changes in the climate. His dream is to keep working so that he can have money and help his mother and brother. 

He enjoys going to the city of Ventanas to visit his friends.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a 48-year-old lady and operates a power loom business at her home. She is very much an expert in her work and makes cloth from it. She is also a very good housewife and a mother. She tries to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She is the mother of five children. Three of them study while another stays at home. Her eldest son who is 21 years old left his education after 10th standard and started sewing and embroidery work to share the financial burden with his parents. He is now an expert in his work. 

Saira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her own business. With the loan, she will repair her power loom and also buy some thread that will allow her to continue her work and finish the orders quickly and more efficiently. 

She has been operating her business for the past 15 years and hopes that a loan investment will help her improve her business further.

loans.use: To repair a power loom and also buy some thread.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli comes from the village of Ruisi, Kareli District. She is 56 years old and lives with her 34 year-old son. Her son works as a watchman in the local school. 

Nanuli and her son  are involved in farming. They own a 3-hectare plot of land where cabbage, tomatoes, beets, onions, and garlic are grown. Nanuli sells the harvested vegetables locally to vegetable retailers. Also, the family has a milk cow. Nanuli produces cheese and sells it locally. 

She requested a loan for purchasing tomato seedlings, as well as fertilizers. Also, part of the loan will be used as payment for workers who will help the family with planting the seedlings, as well as fertilizing the land. 

Nanuli plans to use part of the income for her son’s wedding arrangements this fall. Another part of the income will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: Hernán tiene 36 años, natural de la comunidad de Palmapampa caserío de la ciudad de San Miguel, Hernán convive con Elena de 34 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 02 hijos y habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rustico. Hernán con tanto esmero logró convertir sus parcelas en áreas verdes, rodeado de árboles frondosos, ahí cultiva cacao y café, actividad que realiza desde hace 13 años. Además sabe que esta con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Hernán menciona que desde muy niño aprendió a labrar la tierra gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres, hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras. Su producto más rentable es el cultivo de café, porque los vende a un buen precio, gracias a las ganancias adquiridas logró comprar más terrenos donde cultiva  árboles maderables. Los meses de Junio a Agosto son tiempos donde mayormente se siembra todo tipo de plantas, razón por la cual Hernán acude a la entidad Financiera para tramitar un crédito  y llevar consigo uno de sus propósitos que es sembrar más cacao. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir sembrando y adquiriendo más espacios de terreno para así sobresalir de la pobreza. Este es será su segundo crédito y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao.
texts.en:
Hernán is 36 years old and native of the community of Palmapampa, which is part of the city of San Miguel. He lives with Elena, age 34, and they have two children. Hernán and his family live in their own home made of basic materials. With great care, he was able to convert his parcels of land into green pastures surrounded by lush trees. Hernán grows cacao and coffee, and has been farming for 13 years. He receives assistance from his workers. Hernán says that when he was a boy, he learned how to work the land as a result of the lessons bestowed on him by his parents. Today he works on his own land. His most profitable crop is coffee because he is able to sell it at a good price. As a result of his earnings, Hernán was able to buy more land so that he could cultivate hardwood trees. The months from June through August are when most of his crops are planted. For this reason, Hernán approached MFP about applying for a loan so that he could continue with one of his goals of planting more cacao. He intends to continue planting and acquiring more land so that he can rise above poverty.

This will be his second loan. Hernán is very pleased to know that he will have the financial support so that he can move forward with his plans. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy cacao seeds.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lotion, deodorant, moisturizer, lipstick, eyeliner, foundation, perfume, and cookware

loans.name: Immer

texts.es: Immer de treinta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija. El posee una tienda con la cual obtiene los recursos para sostener su hogar, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues Don Immer siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan, productos de buena calidad y por supuesto a un buen precio; el esfuerzo y coraje en el trabajo son la clave del éxito para Immer, es por eso que está decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, bebidas, carnes, embutidos, cereales entre otros al por mayor y así poder maniobrar mayor margen de ganancia y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo tendrá la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Immer, 33, lives with his life partner and their daughter.  He has a store where he earns resources to support his home.  Lately, Immer has acquired quite a few customers because he always has what they need; good quality products at, of course, good prices.  Effort and passion for work are keys to Immer’s success.  

This is why he’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy snacks, beverages, meats, cured meats and cereals, among others, at wholesale so that he can manage a larger profit margin and meet customer demand while at the same time providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, meats, cured meats, cereals, etc.

loans.name: C9284 Urunana Group

texts.en:
Charles is 48 years old.  He is married and has three children aged between 5 and 10 years old.   Charles is the president of this group, which is called "URUNANA" in the local language.  His business is well-organized and is well-known in the business of selling bananas. His business hours are from 7 am until 5 pm every day. He has three years of experience and currently employs one person to help him. 

Charles and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by buying more bananas for sale. With any profits, Charles and his team will reinvest in their businesses and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas for sale

loans.name: Sayie Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sayie II” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Abdul. Abdul is age 36. He was born in Masingbie village in northern Sierra Leone but he is currently residing in Waterloo, together with his wife and four children. His wife is a trader and two of his children are attending primary school, one is in secondary school and the last is not of school-going age. For 10 years now, Abdul has been selling gari (food made out of cassava roots), palm oil, rice, etc. With this loan, Abdul will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy gari, palm oil, rice, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 2 enfants.
Akouvi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend pour ses clients des produits de bébé pour  ses clients. Elle achète les produits à au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille avec 1 employé. 
Akouvi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Akouvi is 31 years old and married to a salesman. The couple have 2 children. Akouvi has been working in sales since 2005. She sells baby products and works with one employee. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to restock on merchandise.

loans.use: to restock on baby products.

loans.name: C4718 Dukore B Group

texts.en:
Julius is 29 years old and is single.  He is the leader of the group called "Dukore B".  Julius is the one in the picture who raises his hand.  He is commonly known for cooking food in his restaurant. Julius has been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from 5 am to 10 pm every day.

Julius and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, this team will expand its business by purchasing equipments to be used in the restaurant. If successful, Julius and his team will hopefully to earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, they will continue improving  their families' lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy equipments for his restaurant.

loans.name: José Alonso

texts.es:
El señor José vive junto a su esposa que se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y un hijo de 22 años de edad que trabaja en una gasolinera y estudia su último año de licenciatura en administración de empresas y vive también con una hija de 21 años de edad que trabaja como secretaria.

Don José es albañil desde hace más de 22 años, inicio como ayudante de un albañil, quien era amigo de sus padres, este le dio la oportunidad y le enseño el oficio. Desde entonces trabaja en su comunidad y en otras comunidades vecinas, así como en la ciudad donde ha realizado muchos trabajos y lo han recomendado.

Cuando su trabajo es por contrato, compra los materiales en la ciudad situada a 15 kilómetros de su comunidad. Las empresas ferreteras le hacen llegar los materiales hasta el lugar donde los necesita, cuando no es por contrato él les cobra a sus clientes. 

Don José esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para reparar el techo de su vivienda y la construcción de habitaciones para sus hijos. Con el préstamo él podrá tener una vivienda segura, evitar la humedad dentro de la vivienda ya que esta le deteriora los muebles y evitaría enfermedades por el exceso de humedad, al mismo tiempo permitirá privacidad a los miembros de la familia y mayor comodidad.

Él desea apoyar a sus hijos para que se superen, que estudien y sean profesionales y personas de bien.

En un futuro desea construir una casa para cada uno de sus hijos con el apoyo financiero de Fundación Campo, comprar un vehículo o camión de pequeña capacidad para utilizarlo en su trabajo y transportar las herramientas y materiales que necesita.
texts.en:
Jose lives together with his wife. She occupies herself with household work. Their 22-year old son works at a gas station and he is on his final year of his degree in business administration. They also live with a daughter who is 21 years old and she works as a secretary.

Jose has been a construction worker for 22 years and he started out as a contractor's assistant. He was a friend of his parents' and this gave him the opportunity and the training in the field. Since then he has been working in his community, in neighboring communities, and in the city. He has completed many projects and he has recommendations.

When his work is on contract, he buys the materials from the city, located 15 kilometers from his community. The hardware stores deliver the materials to wherever he will need them. When the works is not on contract, he charges his clients.

Jose requests a loan from Fundacion Campo (Kiva Field Partner) to repair the roofing on his house and to build bedrooms for his children. With this loan eh will be able to have a safe home, avoiding humidity within the house. This deteriorates the furniture and it will prevent illnesses born from excess humidity. At the same time it will grant privacy for the members of the family and greater comfort.

He wishes to support his children so that they improve themselves, so that they attend school and earn a career and be upstanding citizens.

In the future he wants to build a house for each one of his children with the financial support of Fundacion Campo. He also wants to purchase a vehicle or a small struck to use for his work and to transport the tools and materials that he needs.

loans.use: to repair the roofing of his home and to build bedrooms for his children.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged 29 and has been in farming for over 3 years, producing and selling maize, beans and vegetables to the local market. She is married with two children aged 12 and 3 years.

Mercy has requested loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her business has been the only source of income for the family, and she will be focusing on buying more dairy cows in order to enjoy the economies of scale. She adds that this is her second loan with Juhudi Kilimo and it will definitely make better returns.

Mercy says the problem of managing dairy diseases is a great challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Khabibulla

texts.ru:
Хабибулле 57 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Хабибулла – электрик по специальности и работал на местной электростанции. Но, к сожалению, зарплаты не хватало на покрытие расходов семьи и Хабибулла решил заняться собственным бизнесом в перепродаже семян.   Начав со стартовой суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Хабибулла смог развить бизнес с ежемесячным доходом около 20,000 сом.   
 Для дальнейшего увеличения ассортимента представленного товара и расширения торгового места , Хабибулла обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS). Планируемую прибыль Хабибулла намерен вложить в развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Khabibulla is 57 years old, married and has three children.  He is an electrician and used to work at the local power plant.  Unfortunately, his salary was not sufficient to cover his family's expenses, and Khabibulla decided to start his own business of reselling seeds.  Having started with a capital of 10,000 som (KGS), Khabibulla was able to develop his business to have a monthly income of about 20,000 som.  In order to further broaden his merchandise assortment and expand his retail space, Khabibulla requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  He plans to invest the expected profit into the development of his business.

loans.use: to broaden merchandise assortment and expand retail space

loans.name: Aunty

texts.en: Aunty sells palm oil in Eguafo. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Aunty has been selling palm oil for 12 years. She helps her husband take care of their children's education. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruit for the preparation of the oil. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy palm fruit for the preparation of the oil

loans.name: Lala Lemou

texts.fr:
Madame  LALA LEMOU a 47 ans, réside avec son époux et leurs sept enfants à Noumousso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Kadiolo.
LALA LEMOU  fait la commercialisation de boubous en bazins  et d’encens il y a environ 11 ans. Elle mène son activité dans sa famille au quartier Noumousso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle à cause de la qualité de ses produits et de sa crédibilité. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a sollicité l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter  une vingtaine de pièces de bazins (riche – moins riche), une dizaine de kilogrammes de graines de “magnon kisenin - gueunnin” et 15 bouteilles de parfums à Bamako. Après teinture et couture des bazins en  boubous ils sont  vendus. De même que les graines et parfums après transformation sont vendus. Elle les vend au comptant et à crédit à Kadiolo à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile et de façon ambulante.
Elle envisage réaliser avec son prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé en grande partie pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Lala Lemou is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and their seven children in Noumousso, one of the popular neighborhoods in the town of Kadiolo.

Lala Lemou has been marketing boubous [long, loose-fitting African garments] made from bazins [colorful fabrics with designs on them] and incense for about 11 years. She manages her family business in the Noumousso neighborhood where she is much in demand by her customers because of the quality of her products and her credibility. 

To meet the demands of her growing clientele, she has appealed to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

Her loan will allow her to buy around 20 pieces of bazin ("rich" [100% pure cotton] to "less rich" [not 100% cotton]), around 10 kilograms of "magnon kisenin - gueunnin" seeds and 15 bottles of perfume in Bamako. After dying and sewing the bazins into boubous they are sold. Similarly the seeds and perfumes are processed and then sold. She sells both from home and as a street vendor in Kadiolo, accepting both cash and credit from a clientele consisting of men and women. 

She envisages making an average monthly profit of 70 000 FCFA which will be used mostly to expand her business, contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 34-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling foodstuff in Bor, South Sudan, for two years.

Ayen is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for resale.

loans.name: Delmy Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Delmy solicita este crédito para poder impermeabilizar su vivienda, la cual se ha estado viendo afectada por las constantes filtración por las lluvias, lo cual provoca daños al interior de la casa por lo cual solicita de nuestra ayuda para poder pagar a la persona que se encargara de colocar la impermeabilización del techo.
   La señora Delmy es extranjera en nuestro país ya que es originaria de honduras, lleva viviendo aquí más de 4 años en los cuales ha hecho un patrimonio para sus hijos y al ser viuda es una gran responsabilidad mantener a tres hijos sola. Ella es comerciante ingreso con el cual puede solventar los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Delmy is asking for this loan to make her home rainproof, which has been affected by the constant leakage from the rain, which is causing damage to the inside of her house and so she is asking for our help in order to pay someone who will be in charge of waterproofing her roof.

Delmy is a foreigner to our country as she is originally from Honduras. She has been living here for more than four years and is creating a future here for her children as she is a widow and has a big responsibility to take care of her three children alone. She can cover the expenses of the house with her earnings as a merchant.

loans.use: to pay for the waterproofing of her roof
